Reviews.Title: “Most Relaxing Work Trip EVER”
Reviews.Author: jasonbulger
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work. Rarely ever to I go to a hotel and not want to leave. I usually end up spending most of my time away from the hotel. Not this place. Every inch of the property is meticulously designed to mirror the relaxing environment of the spa that is attached. If it weren't so far from home, I would make this place my regular getaway with my wife. The attached conference center is big enough to operate multiple events simultaneously. This is my second visit to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: Majgen
Reviews.Content: Stay here! Great customer service, very nice rooms, great views, top of the line hotel. This place is huge! Lots of things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Kid paradise”
Reviews.Author: brenda111Denver
Reviews.Content: my six year old claims this place is better than Disneyland...from the moment we checked in it was paradise. We got to the hotel around 11 a.m. and they allowed us to check in which I thought was nice, and they give kids this really fun rubber ball as a welcome gift which is a great touch. From there it just got better......beautiful grounds, great food and fantastic drinks at the bar! Even s'mores at night in the fire pits on some days. Truly the entire family had a wonderful time, and the starbucks on property was definitely a plus! We have stayed in many nice hotels but this one was top notch in every area. We will most likely make this an annual trip. If you want a trip where the kids are entertained by the pools and lazy river all day, while you soak up the sun with a good drink as well then this is the resort for you!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience for Entire Family”
Reviews.Author: deVeer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Arizona and spent the last 3 days of our visit at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge Resort. From the time we checked-in to the time we left, it was a great experience. Upon arrival we were greated by courteous and very helpful staff. We decided to upgrade our stay with access to the Griffin Club (great move) although it would have been nice if kids were allowed. Oh well, they soon go over the disappointment when the saw the pool, slide, and lazy rivier. Kids ate free in the resort restaurants which was a plus although they were just as happy eating the take-out from the Griffin Club. Also loved the fact that there was free access to laundry and supplies on our floor. Nice touch. We're already planning another trip to a JW resort, maybe this time in Orlando. Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: GinaMeeker
Reviews.Content: After trying to get a room for this past Easter weekend with no luck because they were sold out we reserved a Villa adjacent to the resort. With several friends staying at the resort we were invited to to enjoy the pool at the resort, knowing the hotel's policy is 5 wrist bands per room. Our friends gave us wrist bands and myself and my 3 sons (ages 11,.8,7) were having the time of our lives on the Saturday before Easter Sunday with 5 other families, 2 of which were hotel guests. I ordered a hot dog for my son and we both took bites out of it - it was beyond hot - scolding- we both burnt our tongues, my son was crying and the hotdog was gross so I complained and told the attendant at the snack shack to be careful with other guests eating the dog is was too hot. He called his manager and he refunded my money. We went back to our seats and all of sudden the manager, who refunded my money, and a security guard came over to where we were sitting, approaching me so agressively, it was shocking. He said, you were asked to leave once and you are treaspassing you need to leave the property immediately. I respnded by saying I was not asked to leave, which I was not the security guard said this is not up for discussion, so I said I need to find my 3 sons and got up. Ofcourse I couldn't find them they were swimming and having a ball, I walked around the property looking for them, my heart ponding. While I did that my friends tried to talk to the security guard to find out my they were kicking me out and he said he didn't know what happened but was just doing his job, they said you have the wrong person, she has done nothing but laying here getting sun and swimming, other guests sitting beside us tried to get involved and they said the PD would be called if I didn't leave the property. I finally found my kids and packed up and me and my 3 girlfriends and our 7 boys were escorted off the property all the way to the valet. How embarrassing, can you imagine. I am a single mom, a professional woman, a clasy and sophisticated person, I was enjoying my Easter weekend in Scottsdale, from California. I was sober and respectable and did not derserve to be treated this way. There was absolutely no reason to have escorted me out of this resort and in the insulting manner I was treated. This was honestly the most devasting experience of my life and ruined my children's vacation. They were embarrassed and confused. I am also a frequent Marriott client and can not believe they treat people like this. There was no discusson or empathy, they didn't pull me aside and explain anything or try to work with me. They treated me like a common criminal that had committed the worst of crimes. Beware if you are at this property you may get kicked out and be humiliated for no reason what so ever. I ahve travelled all over the world stayed in the most exclusive resorts and never in my life have I been asked to leave or treated in this way. I will never ever stay at a Marriott again. Thank you for making such a wonderful memory for me and my innocent boys. What a class ac JW Dessert Ridget!

Reviews.Title: “The whole family enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: amy54321
Reviews.Content: We travel all over and have stayed in many many Marriotts over the years. Went April 1-6...check in was very smooth...very accommodating especially for a busy spring break week. Aside from Marriott Aruba I would say this was one of the best Marriotts we have every stayed in. Had a great room facing the grassy / pool area. The children (age 14, 11, & 6) were all very kept satisfied and busy. There was something for everyone here. We hiked every morning then had lunch by the pool and went swimming. Many great sites around and a lot of fun unexpected activities available at the hotel. Many special touches around the hotel and great staff and service. We stayed our last night at Hilton in Sedona which was very dissappointing...would have preferred another night at Marriott and done a day trip to Sedona.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Experience.... Just Ok.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa L
Reviews.Content: We went April 1 - 5. Our room was facing a brick wall so we could not even tell in the morning if it was sunny, cloudy, warm, cold etc.... Had i actually paid for this room (won this trip) I would most definately said something. The room was very nice however. The pool area while very nice, was extremely crowded with kids, and had I know that would have booked for a later time in the year as it was only myself and my husband on this trip. The worst thing of all at this resort was the price of food and drinks which was absolutely ridiculous !!!! I would never go back to this resort again, and am totally glad I did not pay for the hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Poorly”
Reviews.Author: JimboMadisonWI
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I was Marriott Platinum for two years, and have over 200 nights in Marriotts in the past five years. So I know the in's and out's of staying in a hotel, and what service is all about. The problem we had is my wife stepped on a rusty safety pin outside a resort entrance. The pin went up through her flip flop and and basically stapled her flip flop to her heal. The service we recieved from the hotel regarding this incident was horrible. From the people who came to the scene to the lost prevention people that checked in on us everything was a huge mess. In the past when I have stayed in Marriott resorts, and I thought the service was impeccable, but it was not the case at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge. If visiting Phoenix I would pick another resort or if you are loyal to Marriott try a different property other than this desert ridge. Basically I am out a $100 copay for a tetnus shot and to offset that they offered me cookies and ice cream. Not to mention the loss of vacation time sitting at the Mayo Clinic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - do not deal with Alexander at reception”
Reviews.Author: BIGtraveller66
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great grounds, excellent pools and service outstanding in all restaurants/pool. We stayed in one of the suites which was a decent sized room with great flow to the room. Our only issue was the noise of the road nearby however, by the second night, it was obsolete! At all times we encountered friendly, courteous staff with the exception of Alexander at front reception. He is not working in the right field. He was unfriendly, unhelpful and even lied to us a few times. When we requested a late checkout, he lied to us again (despite being Elite members) and when he walked away, we asked Brian who gladly accomodated our late check out. Truly, not acceptable for this standard of hotel, for elite members or for any clients paying the fees/rate of this hotel. Overall, great location, lots to do and definitely recommend for families with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: blackjeepguy
Reviews.Content: I stay at Marriott's 100 nights per year for business so I decided to try this hotel out when I was in Phoenix. One of the nicest hotels in the country. The service was amazing, one of the best I have experienced. Everyone at the front desk could not have been nicer or more helpful. Bartender Mike at the italian restaurant was a great guy. My only knock was the hotel has a kids vacation club in it and they are clearly promoting a kid's free for all which seemed strange for a high end convention hotel. Since the hotel is attached to time shares and condo's the place was just too small for as many kids were there. Without a specific pool for adults you just never got a break. I would recommend staying here if you have kids otherwise you may want to find a hotel which caters more too adults.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: sakidog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days at this resort at the end of March while I attended a conference on site. The resort and grounds are beautiful and very well maintained. The room was large and comfortable. The entire staff was extremely friendly and professional. Everyone we encountered from check in to the restaurants and concierge were great and eager to help. My only complaint was that the resort was overflowing with kids! It was spring break and the kids were really hard to avoid, even late in the evening in the steakhouse. It seems like a great family resort if that is what you are looking for. My husband and I don't have kids and probably would not return to the resort for that reason. We did find the spa pool and that was an amazing quiet oasis from the noise of the rest of the outdoor spaces. You can either pay for a day pass or it is included if you are an elite marriott member. I had a hot stone massage while I was there with Stephan and it was amazing! The spa facilities are relaxing and very nice. That was definitely worth the splurge. There is a happy hour from 4-6 at Roy's and the drinks, appetizers, and staff were all great. Everything is $6 and you can sit out on the patio and enjoy. We did this almost every night and had a great time. Our dinner experience at Roy's was not as good. The drinks were not good and dinner was cold and just not up to the price we paid for it. We have been to other Roy's locations and we were disappointed with this dinner. Overall the resort was very nice. We really enjoyed the stay. Maybe a week other than spring break would give me a different feel for it.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of walking--try not to forget your car keys!”
Reviews.Author: p169649
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very busy with lots of families and conference attendees. Great people watching! The first room we were given had a view of a concrete wall-- kind of scary. We were able to change easily and got a nice room with a view of a pond. The second person who helped change our room let us know we got free entry to the spa as platinum members. We would not have known it if we had stuck with our first room. The tacos by the main pool were 3.00 each and awesome! Restaurants were fine. There is a huge mall w lots of chain restaurants you can walk to. Also a great cinema in the mall. Saw Hunger Games on IMAX. If you have a car, the concierge had a sheet of hiking trails you can drive to. Cave creek park had great hiking and horseback riding 20 min from hotel. The hotel is very clean and nice; marked off mainly for location and distance from room to lobby and parking.

Reviews.Title: “great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: mike r
Reviews.Content: the property is beautiful and the pools are great. the service is ok, not what it is at other jw marriotts. as my wife says - it always seems like they are trying to say "no" to your request or question instead of yes (as is the case with the higher end hotel chains). also, since there are so many people here, it always seems like you are always waiting in line for something.. the hotel is huge and we were there over spring break so the pools were very crowded. the rooms are typically marriott rooms, but there did seem to be more hall noise than normal. we had to wait to get into the breakfast restaurant (as there is no breakfast for marriott rewards members (but that is the case at all marriott resorts). The pool service is also very slow. overall, a beautiful place and great for families. just be patient and you will enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Gigantic!”
Reviews.Author: latrell1
Reviews.Content: Every bit as plush and enormous as you might imagine a five-star resort to be, the JW Marriott Desert Ridge was admittedly pretty impressive. Even the Priceline-level room I got was pretty phenomenal, with a big balcony, comfortable loveseat, and fantastic work chair -- I wanted to go home and buy that same chair. Fantastic bed, too. The highlight of this resort was pretty clearly the pool, which seemed to stretch on forever. The lazy river actually had enough square footage to be lazy. Inner tubes were free and plentiful, and there was a bar and taco stand within feet of the pool entrance. All the poolside areas were immaculate and functional, even down to the restaurants situated just outside of the pool/lake area. Service here was inconsistent. Check-in was a breeze, a late checkout wasn't a problem, and it was never an issue getting somebody on the phone from the front desk, even at busy times. With such a sprawling resort, though, I'd run into situations where one hand wasn't really talking to the other. The girl at the front desk, as an example, told me that the steakhouse on site was open till 10 PM. I decided to go there for dinner after dropping off my bags. When I asked for directions to get there at 9:30 (the hotel is big enough to require such directions), I was given functional directions only to arrive and find that the steakhouse had closed at nine. It seems like somebody could have filled me in there. I ended up heading back to the water's edge to grab dinner at the bar area, and while the service was great when someone actually showed up, it took a full 25 minutes from when I sat down to the moment where someone even came by for a drink order. The area was a little crowded, but not 25-minutes-bad. Oh, and the resort fee. $25 per day is a little nuts, even if it gets you access to the gym and free (very functional) internet. This should really be $15/night and it should cut out some of the useless accoutrements (e.g. free appetizer at the steakhouse with an entree purchase) that are padding the fee. It didn't bother me since I had a greatly reduced rate, but for $400-$500 a night, that extra $25 is no fun. That resort fee also includes a discount on valet parking, lowering it from $25/night to $15. If you don't choose to use the valet, parking here isn't all that great; it's a pretty lengthy walk from any of the free self-parking lots to the entrance, especially with bags. Those are all relatively minor slights, though, on an impressive resort. Forget going on vacation to Phoenix; you could go on vacation to this hotel, never leave the property, and be very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place if you are not a Marriott rewards member”
Reviews.Author: UDbill
Reviews.Content: Love the grounds, This is a beautiful Place. The golf Pro Shop is very helpful. The staff is very nice. The problem I have is that as a Marriott rewards member you really don't get any member benefits at this hotel. No upgrades without a hefty cost, no breakfast and you can't even get a free cup of coffee in the morning. What happened to Thank you for being a loyal customer? I received a regular room, a bottle of water and a late checkout. I can get more preferred treatment at Residence Inn, Courtyard or any other hotel in the Marriott system. Must be policy issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great escape destination”
Reviews.Author: Texincolorado
Reviews.Content: Took my family to this resort and we are guaranteed to go back. Plenty to do for the entire family. The food at the various spots on property was what we needed and incredibly delicious. Our server even suggested a meal for breakfast that had me craving for more. The pools were fantastic and relaxing. The golf course is a wonderful design. Everyone we met from the staff made us feel relaxed and appreciated. We will start our plans for next year and figure out how we incorporate this destination back into them. We loved this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort”
Reviews.Author: shelb333
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott Desert Ridge was a lovely resort, but not nearly as nice as the JW Orlando or JW San Antonio. The room was nice, balcony wonderful. The pool/lazy river was not as nice as the other lazy rivers we've been in at JW's. The Blue Sage restaurant was good. The sushi bar was average. The resort wasn't as "kid-friendly" as I had hoped. My 11 and 13 year olds didn't have any options for activities, too young for Segway, too old for "kid" activities. Service was above average. The hotel was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: TigerLilyPad
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this wonderful property after a week in Sedona. Lovely grounds, great landscaping and amazing pools! The lazy river was a great way to spend an afternoon after a week of hiking. Great for families and couples. The resort is huge and had dining options for all budgets. Starbucks on site. Loved seeing the wildlife: lots of bunnies and even a family of quails by the pool. Sitting by the firepit at night was fun and relaxing. Will definitely return! The spa facilities were wonderful. Enjoyed the private pool reserved for spa guests after my massage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: bayres
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort, perfect place for a relaxing weekend. The grounds are appealing and serene. Service is great, rooms are confortable and well maintained. Only drawbacks are distance from town and no taxi service (hotel provides a car and driver (extra charge) a roundtrip to Old town Scottdale $140, ouch! Also no wifi in the room (free wifi on the lobby). Overall a great place for a short relaxing period.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort”
Reviews.Author: roaches02
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort! Staying here on business for a few days was a highlight of our week in Arizona. Frankly, you don't even have to leave the property, if you so choose - everything you may want is readily available within the grounds of this very serene location. Our stay was enhanced by the superb quality of the personnel who seeme to anticiate our every need. We sat around the pool - towels were offered. We asked for our car - the valet had it waiting for us right in front when we came downstairs. We asked for a seat outsdie next to the firepit - how about a comfy sofa for two? No hesitation - I would highly recommend this property to anyone who craves service and serenity. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not to the standard I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: dcrose
Reviews.Content: This is a very large scale resort but did not meet my expectations. On the day I arrived I noticed a mini-bar fridge in the hall outside of a room and it was still sitting there a day and a half later. I noticed room service trays in the hall left there for quite some time too. Also, I had a garden view from my patio but when I got back to my room after a full day and evening out, a huge temporary tent had been installed on the lawn blocking any view I had (see picture). To make matters worse, they were testing the PA/sound system until late into the night and it was very loud in my room as the tent was right outside my patio door. I finally called the front desk and they said they were just finishing up getting ready for a big event they were hosting starting the next day. Luckily I was checking out next day as I can only imagine how loud that would have been. It is a very nice resort but not to the standard I would expect and there are better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Really Wanted To Love This Resort”
Reviews.Author: Martin W
Reviews.Content: On first glance this resort has everything you would want. Beautiful street appeal, inviting lobby, wonderful pools and "lazy river" and appealing guest rooms. After a few days we began to question the lack of an acceptable "turn down" service, quality of bedding (especially the pillows) and overall cleanliness of our room. Sheets were stained and not changed regularly. Be sure to ask for rooms facing the pools and golf course for the better views.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona!”
Reviews.Author: debihearn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week, with ours friends, at this incredible resort. The condos are beautiful & the pools are awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: rskny1
Reviews.Content: Lovely place, great service, food at conference great, nice rooms,spa was incredible,only negative was thin towels

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: s20mark
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all that I have come to expect from JW resorts. Clean well kept property with great service. Came for a seminar so I can't speak to many of recreation amenities but the hotel is great. I had a small issuenat check-in and the desk manager went above and beyond to make it right,,

Reviews.Title: “Holy Moly...what a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: acandkc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the total package...from the beautiful palms lining the front ( complete with resident great horned owls) to the four interesting pools, from the concierge desk that will help with everything to the beautiful rooms! One of the interesting things in this time of cutting back is the large staff there...from the front desk to the greeters and door openers and concierge desk to the wait staff. These people are happy to help! We were in room 4565...in the back overlooking the desert garden and loved this room. The balcony provided a beautiful view of mountains, the golf course in the distance, cactus garden and of course, the multitude of rabbits that spend their day trimming the grass!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond your best expectation”
Reviews.Author: Blm0098
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days at the time shares and visited the JW Marriott both properties were great Marriott places to stay. The property is a bit North of downtown and probably 30 minutes North of the airport if those locations are important you may want a different place. Bus service is provided between the properties and local shopping center. Many daily events. We enjoyed our short stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mavenhawk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an annual meeting. Beautiful room, nice view of palm trees and pool. I don't care for the very thick carpet in the hallways, while it is quiet it is very hard to roll your suitcase. Also what used to be a minibar i now empty and not on, with a sign in it that says this is not a refrigerator. Aside from those two minor things this property is beautiful and the staff is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Large, Acceptable Hotel for Corporate Events / Golfing; JW Quality is Lacking”
Reviews.Author: illini1996
Reviews.Content: I am Marriott Platinum Elite (Lifetime Member) and stay almost exclusively at Marriott Properties. My family stayed at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge from 2/23-2/27. This is a very large (950 room) hotel, catering to corporate events and the golfing community. The grounds are well maintained and beautiful. The pool(s) are large, well maintained and the lazy river/slide is enjoyable. The staff is friendly and attentive. However, I would not recommend this hotel for families and I think it is not up to JW Standards. We were upgraded to a hospitality suite. The room was big but tired (stained carpet, dinged walls, old decor). I was offered an alternative room but it wasn't worth the effort to re-situate with two kids under the age of 1.5. The food (room service) was a disappointment (quality) and really, I don't believe this hotel distinguishes itself from a regular / full service Marriott. If you're going to have a corporate event or guys' golfing event, this hotel is good. However, I would not recommend it for families or couples looking to get away.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Pastorkenaz
Reviews.Content: The J W is at the top of their game. Excellent customer service... Above and beyond in all aspects. Within 20 minutes of our arrival I was greeted by name. I would strongly recommend the Griffin Club. For a few dollars a day you get breakfast, lunch, awesome appetizers and an open bar from 4 till 11 with top shelf libations. Daniel and Brian are fantastic. The resort upgeade our rom to an executive suite with a stunning view of the mountains. The spa is a great place to relax and unwind....the massage .....world class!

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: briniquimi
Reviews.Content: We went to a wedding at this resort. The grounds are attractive and the rooms are comfortable and clean. The resort is very close to restaurants and other amenities. There is also plenty of parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great as always”
Reviews.Author: debphill
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here too many times to count and we always have an outstanding stay....Very pleasant and helpful staff members. Front desk staff was very welcoming upon our check in. She commented several times they appreciate our return visit and our loyalty as a Marriott Rewards Platinum Elite member. This stay we used Marriott Rewards points and our room was the very last room on the 3rd floor overlooking the golf course. The walk was a bit much but most likely because of the use of points on a Friday and Saturday night and not a “paying” guest. Could not figure out why they only have the live music until 10pm on Friday and Saturday nights. The outside patio was pretty busy both nights and it would have been nice for the music to go on a little longer as people really seemed to be enjoying listening and some were even dancing, but 10 came and they packed up. Roy’s Hawaiian Fusion was great as always! Upon check out everyone said Thank you for staying with us. Very nice touch…. We will definitely return to the JW, but if we use points again, we will make sure to ask for a room a little closer.

Reviews.Title: “It was comfortable and nice”
Reviews.Author: ypwalter
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. It's large with the first glance, and it is actually really amazing there. I used my points for a night stay there. They offers good free spa for whole day for their member. The room is large and look pretty new for me. Also, I like how it designed to have a patio outside to see the nice nightview of the highway, further buildings, and hotel facilities. I like it so much. It is definitely a 5star experience for a spa resort hotel. I will come back if I have points or more money later in my life to enjojy =)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Spot in the Desert!!”
Reviews.Author: Krista N
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter, and I stayed at the JW Marriott in November 2011. I was traveling for business and they came along to enjoy the weather and property. I'll break down the main categories. Rooms: The rooms are fabulous, tastfully furnished and spacious. There was plenty of room for us to sprawl with all of the baby gear and we didn't feel like we were cramming a crib into a corner. The crib provided by the hotel was modern and felt pretty safe. The bathrooms were enormous and our daughter enjoyed a few 'swims' during our stay. Dining: The food at the hotel is terrific. Starbucks was a morning staple, and convenient for most rooms. The bars and restaurants have great happy hours and we enjoyed some early drinks most nights in the warm fall evenings. We had dinner at Blue Sage twice and it was delicious both times. The prices are reasonable and quiality high. The sushi at Roy's was a big disappointment - but drinks were delicious. My husband also ate at the Vista Lounge for a burger and it was great. Throughout the business meetings the catered food was also amazing, especially the breakfasts!! Location: You are in North Scottsdale so it's a bit of a drive to get to any main attractions. We took an ATV over to Fountain Hills and into the Saguargo National Park, which was really cool to see. I'd highly recommend one of these trips - ours was organized through Expedia's Destination Services. If you're looking for shopping, drive ~20 minutes south to Scottsdale Fashion Square or head over to Kierland Commons (~15 minutes). You'll find every shop imaginable between these spots.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Linthicums
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the atmosphere and accommodations, I could tolerate the conference. The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean coupled with great nightly entertainment ~ who could ask for more. My plan is to return and get an opportunity to see some of the sights off the resort. Had a great time and looking forward to my return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service and great value”
Reviews.Author: mitchboyle
Reviews.Content: We stayed 12/8-11 and I don't know that I've ever had the extra special attention like I did at JW's Desert Ridge. We ate at all three restaurants and whether it was a well timed refill, a perfect suggestion or an incredibly gracious staff everything was beyond special. The same thing can be said at the front desk, especially when it came to making sure I was completely satisfied with the room and all the other amenities. If you want to golf the course crew was phenomenal at working with T-Times and accommodating last minute changes. Everyone at the shoppes were a delight as well. Lastly the value was incredible. The "fling and swing" program was easily the best 5 star value in town. So how good was it? I get to find out again when I come back later on this month!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful winter escape!”
Reviews.Author: brewski59
Reviews.Content: My wife and I escaped a recent Rocky Mountain blizzard by spending a long weekend at the JW Desert Ridge Resort. Upon arrival, the lobby and grounds were a beautiful invitation to a relaxing weekend of luxury. At check in we had a delightful trainee who gave us an efficient and warm reception. Our room had a nice but somewhat obstructed view of the pool area and distant mountains. We used the small balcony frequently during our stay. The room itself was nicely appointed and the bath had both a shower and tub (although the tub was nothing special, the shower was delightfully invigorating). The grounds and facilities were impeccable during our entire stay. We enjoyed the expansive pool area (which was not at all crowded in this off season time) and hot tubs, and soaked in a bit of sun during the afternoon. We enjoyed a dinner at the Blue Sage the night we arrived, and at Roy's another evening and an afternoon of treatment at the Revive Spa on site (all reviewed separately). Throughout our stay the staff was delightful and professional. There are also a number of other off site restaurant options just a mile or less away, but we enjoyed staying on site for most of our meals. The location is on the far north side of town, but we enjoyed being a bit out of the way. We also took a day trip to Sedona (which was beautiful but very touristy in town). When some rowdy neighbors disturbed the peace Saturday evening, the whole incident was handled quickly and effectively by the staff. Nikki, the front desk manager, made up for the trouble the next day and we appreciate her efforts. Overall, it was a relaxing time at a beautiful resort. This is what a JW is all about.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful oasis in the desert.”
Reviews.Author: nlthevenot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I splurged for this weekend getaway and it was worth it! The service was incredible, the food and drinks sublime. I only regret having to go back to reality and not being able to stay longer. Don't waste too much money on the breakfast buffet. (There is a Mimi's across the street.) Instead, have Prickly Pear Margaritas and chips/guac/salsa by one of the many pools. After your nap, golf game, or spa treatment try dinner at Blue Sage. The Chicken Pot Pie was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: ArtofHair T
Reviews.Content: This resort was chosen as a couple day layover from Hawaii to Maryland. My visit was end of January which was great because this is a resort kids would love. The lazy river and many pools to choose from. The service was great. If you workout you have to wait if your an early riser or come from the east. The gym opens at 6 am and not easy to get to. Great stay but I will choose J W Marriott closer to PHX airport.

Reviews.Title: “Aah Nothing Like a Real Spacation!”
Reviews.Author: Cin3nyc
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the most beautiful JW Marriott Properties I have ever visited. The spa itself makes you feel as if you are in an aquarium -- the tile surrouding the building is a gorgeous sea blue - and the food on the menu is simply scrumptious. The hotel itself is dramatcially landscaped but still retains a low-key ambience. Don't miss this very special JW if you are in the Phoenix area any time soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: easttdav
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 1/21-1/25 for business, and enjoyed the place immensly. The landscaping is beautiful, the restaurants are superb. My wife and I also went also to the Desert Botanical gardens, and hiked Camelback mtn. both of which are close. A huge shopping center with many restuarants are within 2 miles (less) which means convienance. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Could Be So Much Better If Only...”
Reviews.Author: sbajb
Reviews.Content: …The hotel would work with the customers! Let me preface by saying we are Marriott "elite" members. We try to stay at Marriott as our standard hotel when ever possible. We are loyal in that regard and unless we are traveling to a destination location that has a special resort (such as in Australia , we usually chose a Marriott hotel/resort because they are reliable and we know what to expect, and generally speaking the communication is fantastic. Our first stay at the Marriott Desert Ridge was a few years ago. We booked a suite and on our arrival were so surprised when we arrived to our room and found we were placed in what was named the “Board Room”. It was actually an approximately 800-1000 square foot large open studio suite which contained a living area with small patio and then a “dining area/board room” area which had a beautiful dining room table which would comfortably seat oh, I’d say 10 people. There was also a hutch which had a selection of hard -back books in it. Mostly for show, but during our 4 night stay we did read a couple of them. The suite, used probably more for business gatherings could also be used for small impromptu cocktail receptions because it also had a small butlers pantry in another area which was accessed by a second entry door. This area included a small kitchenette with microwave, fridge, 2nd honor bar and wet bar. In our case it worked out perfectly for our long weekend. Oh- the bedroom was a pull down Murphy bed. Located in the living area. Worked for us. Good bed, nice selection of pillows and the robes were really nice as well. On this experience alone I would rate the resort 5 stars. We enjoyed the 24 hour room service, the fitness center and the on demand movies. The problems we have with the Marriott Desert Ridge is that we really like this room and on the following visits we have attempted to book and make use of this room to no avail. The first attempt we tried to book online and the room wasn’t listed. So we called the hotel directly. After being shuffled from person to manger, we were informed that the room was not available anymore as a “single booking” and if we wanted to book it we would have to book it tandem with an added room (with an adjoining door leading to a basic hotel room, which would end up costing us approximately 1/3 more per night)- or we could book a one bedroom suite and take our chances upon arrival that it would be available. We did the latter and it wasn’t available on check in. We tried once more, and again no luck. The Marriott Desert Ridge is a nice hotel. It is a simple hotel with some perks, but in all honesty if they wont work with us, to let us have the room that we desire- why should we continue coming back?

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Resort”
Reviews.Author: Durwoody
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott Desert Ridge was the hotel we were diverted to by the Talking Stick Resort when they had an A/C problem. This was a very nice resort with traditional design with a Southwest-type feel. I found myself fascinated by the décor throughout the resort, especially the lighting and the railing details. The rooms were spacious and the bathroom had both a tub and separate shower. The vanity was large enough for all our toiletries. The beds were very comfortable and the right amount of firmness. If it wasn’t for my snoring relatives I would have had a perfect sleep! LOL. We really didn’t spend much time in the room but took loads of pictures of the surround gardens and landscape. Everything was well maintained and the staff were helpful and courteous. I would definitely return here for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Five Diamond Resort”
Reviews.Author: SeattleSleepy
Reviews.Content: JW Marriott, Desert Ridge, Phoenix is a 5-Diamond Resort in the true sense of the word. We recently stayed for 4 short nights while attending the Youth Soccer Regional Tournaments at the Reach 11 Sports Complex (about 3 miles from the hotel). The weather was great but so was the golf at both of the resorts Wildfire GC Faldo & Palmer courses. Add to this our daughters G98 ODP Team won the championship for the State of Washington only added to a great weekend. Hint about the green fees - book your tee times on GolfNow website, you'll save 50% or more on most of the courses in Phoenix including the Wildfire Courses at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “It's all good”
Reviews.Author: cellapink
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a long weekend at this hotel in October 2011 with another couple. This was actually my second stay at the resort, having spent a few days in one of the time-share condos a few years ago. This is an exceptional resort for its size. I generally prefer smaller, boutique hotels, but I love this property. The pool is exceptional, the restaurants are excellent, and the spa is top-notch. I had one of the best massages I have ever had. While lying there I was actually trying to think of a way to justify another trip to Phoenix just for another massage. I also had a terrific pedicure. I honestly cannot come up with a criticism. There are a number of lovely resorts in the Scottsdale area, but I will stay at the JW Desert Ridge whenever I am in the greater Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Travelgal483
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as part of a California/Arizona/Nevada road trip and it was by far my favorite stop we made. In the middle of the Arizona summer heat, it was the perfect place to come back and cool off at. The entire resort was extremely relaxing and blended in seamlessly with the surrounding desert landscape. The pools/water features were absolutely gorgeous and the room was so beautiful. We were very impressed with how clean and comfortable the bed was, as well as the rest of the room. We were also very pleased with the location, as it was very close to nearby shops and restaurants where we could walk around during the day. I would return to this JW in a hearbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Property”
Reviews.Author: bonniep71
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this property last week, 12/27/11-1/2/12. We were very pleased with the hotel; it's exactly what it should be, in-between a Marriott level hotel and a Four Seasons level hotel. The property was very nice, pools much enjoyed by the kids and adults alike. The rooms are very spacious, clean and well decorated. Beds and pillows are very comfortable, bathrooms are large. We ate several nights in the lobby bar, nice selection of sushi on the menu as well as other more kid friendly options. Blue Sage restaurant was very good; breakfast buffet is extensive and food was excellent. We went to happy hour at Roy's our last night and it was so beautiful with the fire pit and great drinks and apps. This hotel is in a great location, convenient to shopping, dining, phoenix, pinnacle peak, etc. I have stayed at other resorts in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area, several more upscale than this, and I will most definitely return here if traveling with my children again. One thing to keep in mind is that this hotel hosts many large groups. You may want to ask which group(s) are booked before you book. Our rooms were 4559 and 4557, perfect location, close to everything but no noise at all, even on New Year's Eve! Staff were all very accommodating and friendly, only complaint were several servers at Blue Sage who were totally disengaged. Lobby/lounge servers were excellent as was front desk, valet and housekeeping. Looking forward to a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Large hotel w lots of action for all ages”
Reviews.Author: Joanne1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Christmas break with 2 families with teens. Came here for 2 nights after being at Camelback JW. Hotel rooms much more updated and hotel is gigantic. The great service and beautiful grounds makes you forget you are at a conference hotel in the middle of a busy shopping area. We LOVED the breakfasts at Blue Sage (ate outside in the sum) and had a very good dinner at Roys. The marketplace area for a quick breakfast was a bit if a bust with very limited options. The pool area and the staff serving drinks/food made it very enjoyable. The weather was gorgeous and even the teens enjoyed the lazy river. We took advantage of the free driving range area but didnt get much else for the $25/day resort fee. The kids went trail riding at McDonald's ranch but they found it a bit touristy form their age group. We looked at the spa but it was a bit far away (the property is enormous) It wasnt a bad ride back to Scottdale for some good dinners in town. The stores close way too early (like 6 pm ) this time of year so plan carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: AMB69_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent resort and impeccable service. Great place to relax and great shopping with access to an extensive selection of restaurants close to the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Large Hotel with a beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: SG2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott during National Field Hockey Tournament over Thanksgiving weekend. Check in was quick and easy, staff were wonderful considering the hotel was full of kids playing at the tournament. Room was spacious, comfortable beds and clean bathroom. Considering we got a really good discount rate the view wasn't great which is ok since we spent most of the time outside the room. Our stay included breakfast grab bags which was good it was the same on all days we stayed there. Dinner over thanksgiving day was wonderful it was part of the team dinner at the restaurant. Food at Blue Sage restaurant was good, fire pits and kids activities such as making smores was nice touch. Kids loved the pool especially the lazy river - although food services at the pool was slow. Access to restaurants and stores at the near by mall was great, it is walkable distance about 15mins walk to the mall. There are theaters, shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun family stay”
Reviews.Author: gooseontheroad
Reviews.Content: Started our vacation at this very fun resort. I must say that when it comes to meeting the needs of many different age children, Marriott does the best job. Our youngest loved the Nickolodeon themed part of the pool fun and our older daughter had a great time taking a water color class and then riding segways in the hotel ballroom. I took a Segway tour of the desert which I really enjoyed and we all loved just the fun and family feel of the resort. It was crowded and seats at the pool were often a challenge but when you travel during school breaks that is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay - Much Better!”
Reviews.Author: des104joy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort on business during the last week of September and stayed here for pleasure with my wife the weekend of Labor Day 2011. My business stay back then was good, but the weekend (Labor Day Holiday) was not good (too many loud drunk and partying groups - it felt like a spring break atmosphere. I decided to give the resort a second chance and returned for a business stay in Dec. 2011. The entire staff were very nice and accommodating. The room (5442) was excellent. I love the resort and the property. My co-worker had issues with the gym/fitness center being closed and closing earlier than normal, but the staff accommodated him in the spa fitness center. Overall - I will return for business but the jury is still out on returning during a busy holiday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good destination hotel”
Reviews.Author: tsgbhalf
Reviews.Content: Really like coming here for a couple of nights. Big but, not loud-busy. Roy's Restaurant is really good. Resort also has a good steakhouse in Meritage

Reviews.Title: “Not entirely a 5 Star experience”
Reviews.Author: raj_sundar7252
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 days and 4 nights for a company conference. The rooms are a little cramped if you are a group of more than one. Other than that, the campus seems okay and there is a whole lot one can do within the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: Erica S
Reviews.Content: The JW Desert Ridge is a fantastic place for families who are active. We found the hotel very accommodating to our kids (14 and 17), the pool areas are fantastic and there is plenty of dining options both on property as well as a short drive away. This area of Scottsdale/Phoenix is the best all around area I've found for easy access and lots of stuff to do. The only thing keeping my rating from 5 stars was it was very expensive, but, it is a resort so what do you expect. The staff was all great, can't say enough good things!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding...but...”
Reviews.Author: crosscreek7
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding resort. We were there on a golf package, and we were encouraged to check in at a time so that we could even get 9 holes in on our check in date--something that we felt was incredible service. The rooms were lovely and the staff was professional and attentive. Our check in was fast and easy, and our room was assigned after we were asked what view we preferred. Again, great service. The resort is located near great restaurants and shopping is fairly nearby. However, the one problem we encountered was when we arrived at the golf course only to find that it was "cart path only." A bit disingenuous since this had not been stated anywhere when we made the reservations several months ago. The pro shop told us that they seed every November and no carts are allowed until much later in the season. They said for medical reasons, a golfer can get a red flag, ride along the rough and cross at 90 degrees. OK, but still not resort golf. When I mentioned this at the hotel, they had no idea that this was going on at the golf course. They immediately offered to refund our money...again, very good service. Walking was not an issue for us. However, before you sign up for golf here, and before you travel to this resort, be sure to find out restrictions at the golf course. BTW, both courses were great, though the pace of play was sometimes slow, probably because of cart restrictions on such wide open courses

Reviews.Title: “Competitive rates-5 Diamond Resort-Lazy River”
Reviews.Author: Bobby J
Reviews.Content: Luxury Resort in Phoenix, AZ. The best of everything. 'Nuff said.

Reviews.Title: “A TRUE Resort in the Desert!”
Reviews.Author: JabsPOV
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I went on a retreat and it was more than we expected! The rooms are very well appointed with very large balconies and the Cloud Lounge (concierge level for adults only) was FANTASTIC!!! For an additional charge you get a full breakfast (wonderful culinary staff), a bar that opens at 12 noon daily, appetizers (steak & risotto) in the early evening followed by desserts. They have a fun water slide and an adults only pool, for when you want to read or just relax. Golf course is gorgeous, but I am not a golfer. SHOPPING - Walking distance to a nice little shopping area, not Neiman or JCrew but they have several decent restaurants (an In N Out), Old Navy etc.... good for drinks (a break on your wallet). The SPA - One of the best stone massages I have ever had and I am a spa snob! The whirlpool area could be a litte larger if you are with a group of ladies, but the private spa pool makes up for it! JAZZ Series - Desert Ridge host 2 jazz concerts a year with major artists and it is very fun. People are partying! Only Con - about 45 minutes from the airport, but what resort isn't?

Reviews.Title: “Enormous and friendly”
Reviews.Author: family_guy_98101
Reviews.Content: This place is huge, and obviously set up for large groups. There are great family-friendly amenities such as their pool complex and restaurants with top-rate food. The staff were very helpful and attentive. Given the size, it's not a place to zip in and out. It took me five minutes just to walk from my parking spot to the front door., and then another five miniutes to get to my room. It can take longer than that to walk from your room to the meeting areas and restaurants. Then again, it is clean and nicely decorated, so if you're not in a hurry the walk in pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Average Luxury Resort & Spa”
Reviews.Author: foxyfit4
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this resort for work. It was your average resort & Spa for the Phoenix area with the JW touch. The golf course and pool area were amazing... The resort offers a varierty of restaurants. Despite that fact, I was very disspointed though with the room service menu. I usually work long hours on the road so often times I am forced to order room service. Because of that, I have cecome a bit of a room service snub (LOL)! Also note it's a $55 cab ride from airport! Overall, you will be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort property”
Reviews.Author: minicooperdad
Reviews.Content: Visited here with my wife and toddler. Beautifully landscaped, very large, property. The pool is obviously a highlight. It's actually multiple pools with fountains, a bar, a lazy river, etc. They do it up nice. There is food service by the pool. The food is your usual burger type fare, but, as you might expect from a JW Marriott, better quality than your average TGIFridays. They also offered a special, portable grill for tacos by the pool, a nice touch. The pool is very kid friendly. Good choice of restaurants - a Hawaiian/asian-type restaurant that was very good. This place, I think called Roy's, offers great outside seating with live music and happy hour. That's a great spot for an end of the day cocktail. There is another bar across the way, also with outside seating and live music. Both areas also offer outside propane fire pits which add nicely to the ambiance. The fine dining option is of the Italian variety. The food is very tasty and inventive. The outdoor seating by the lagoon is quite nice and borderline romantic. Despite the fact that this mega resort is in the 'Burbs and by a bunch of malls, the grounds of the Desert Ridge are quite nice. I recommend taking the guided tour. They will show you some of the local cacti plants, etc. that the Marriott painstakingly had to leave in place when they were building the resort. Plus they will show you their herb garden, the fruits of which are used in the dining rooms. The breakfast buffet was mediocre at best. There were a couple of decent shops in the complex. Parking is ample, but it's a long walk to your car if you don't valet. As I mentioned, there is a big mall about a ten minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the visit”
Reviews.Author: Donald P
Reviews.Content: Great pool. Great restaurants. Helpful and thoughtful staff. Bartenders a great and there are plenty of TVs with multiple channels so everyone can watch the football game of their choice. Only complaint is wait time for food at the pool though the waitress warned us it would be bad. Drinks are very good. Shirley works on the customer service hotline. She is fantastic and so customer oriented, she should be the GM. Breakfast came out hot each morning. And I mean hot and though you may be saying, "big deal. It should", how often does it not. In my experience, a lot. I'd go back in a heartbeat. Didn't play golf, but the course looked great.

Reviews.Title: “great convention hotel; probably too big if not part of a meeting”
Reviews.Author: prs174
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 nights in mid november. terrific service; excellent food during small meetings we held all day; staff was courteous and attentive; clean, quiet , well appointed room, facing golf course and pool; solid workout room; had a terrific massge on friday afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Murph1954
Reviews.Content: I have been to the hotel maybe 10 times since 2007. The experience is always enjoyable. The service is most professional. I look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “High end resort perfect for large meeting”
Reviews.Author: 2tampuh2
Reviews.Content: This is a very impressive resort. Was here for a large business meeting but it felt like a vacation. The resort is huge and is more of a large meeting hotel but the convention areas are nicely spaced from the resort pool, rooms, and restaurants. The staff were very friendly and kept the place incredibly clean. The finishes are very high end in the rooms as well as the resorts bathrooms and other facilities (towels to dry your hands). Room was average size but had a balcony, Bathroom in the room was on the larger side and had separate glass shower and soaking tub. Service at the restaurants was responsive and attentive but drinks and food are expensive. From the pool there is a great view of the mountains and downtown Phoenix (about 30 min south). The grounds are impeccable and the outside spaces are beautiful. I would def. come back here for vacation to golf or just relax, in fact there were a lot of couples there. Expect luxury and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Took the luxury out of "resort"”
Reviews.Author: katsat
Reviews.Content: We took extra steps to ensure our reservations would be just right for the family over Thanksgiving. From the beginning things started to go wrong; our tee time was mysteriously cancelled, on arrival the room was not what we had been assured we would receive, they were not able to grant a late checkout later than noon. When I explained the late checkout was in order to keep a spa apt which concluded at noon, they still would not extend checkout to 1:00 pm. So, I cancelled at the spa. After realizing the room was incorrect, they moved us to a hospitality suite, which had all the charm of a conference room. The bathrooms needed updating and the towels looked like they were 10 years old. House keeping arrived at 8:00 am the first morning (Thanksgiving) and breakfast was our next big disaster. I phoned to inquire about breakfast, and while they could inform me that the lounge was the only place open, no one could confirm if it was buffet only. When we arrived and found that it was, we were erroneously sent to the spa for a full menu breakfast. Back to the room, ordered room service breakfast an hour later, late and starving...our soft poached eggs arrived hard boiled and the hot chocolate came in a packet with hot water. I can't list all the misinformation, the incorrect room service orders, the disappointment with the restaurants, but I can say that all we could do is laugh after a while. What went right: Amanda realized how bad things were and tried to make things right. The golf course was beautiful and that cart gal made a great bloody Mary. I can honestly say that with all the other terrific resorts in Scottsdale that we will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and business meeting/convention venue”
Reviews.Author: SteveRBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very large and somewhat outside the city center. Very quiet. Great location for a large business meeting or convention. Rooms are comfortable and very clean. Food and facilities are great

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: nelli9595
Reviews.Content: The resort is really nice and it is great for a convention. Lots of room, great bar, and several different restaurants. Great golf course. Plus the service was amazing. I had a cough and the front desk gave me a hand full of cough drops when I asked if the gift shop had cough syrup. Great star and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing and Large place”
Reviews.Author: zrb2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights as a "getaway" from the hustle and bustle of kids, work, etc... We really wanted a nice relaxing stay at a resort without paying $400/night or something crazy. This Marriott property fit the bill. The resort is huge and the walk from the self-parking lot to our room was lengthy,,,,although we don't mind walking so no big deal. The weather was chilly for Arizona,,,low 70's for the highs...so very few people were in the pool area. We took advantage of the Lazy river (really nice) and one of the large pools plus the outdoor hot tub. The grounds and landscaping are beautiful. On check-in the front desk guy told us he moved our room to a more scenic view overlooking the desert botanical gardens (instead of facing a wall). We appreciated that....although truthfully there seemed like a ton of vacant rooms in our wing so it probably wasn't very difficult to do...but this was a nice touch. Made us feel like we were important! The Blue sage was excellent for lunch. We did not splurge for a the $25 breakfast buffet but rather bought some breakfast food from the Target nearby and stored cream cheese and orange juice in the mini bar fridge. We did eat at Tuscany one night and it was just so so. My wife's ravioli dinner came out cool so we asked to have it heated up. It came back barely luke warm. I'd stick with the pizza from this place. I saw it on someone else's plate and it looked better than anything we ordered. There was a big sales conference going on here....beware that this is a huge convention/conference hotel and lot's of conventioneers are loading up on the company expense credit card. EVeryone looked classy and well behaved though....except the people next to our room liked to come back late night, probably after several drinks and they made some noise. The walls between the rooms seemed very thin. Overall, our stay was very nice and we have fond memories of this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: lacortec
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in October during our honeymoon. This was our first stop on our road trip through AZ and our intentions were to decompress after the wedding. That exactly what happened. The pool was amazing and the landscaping was beautiful. I highly recommend Desert Ridge if you are looking to relax for a day or two.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Michelle J
Reviews.Content: I was expecting more from a JW hotel. The hotel and rooms were clean and the service was fine. Everything was just a little bit worn or run down. It did not have the "crisp" look to it that other 4 and 5 star hotels do. The lay out of the hotel is bizarre and confusing. The pool chairs were not comfortable. I just stayed at the Arizona Biltmore in October...doesn't even compare. Biltmore was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Totally relaxing and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Richard7535242
Reviews.Content: Because of the hotel,s beauty, lack of crowds, wonderful pools - especially the lazy river with a slow current and free tube rafts that keep you cool - and inexpensive rates, I like the hotel in summer or off season times but anytime is nice. Love the early morning Starbucks adjacent to the tranquil, meditative outside desert garden area with benches, some semi-secluded, to read or just enjoy the sunrise and early morning even in summer. The huge just built somewhat upscale outdoor mall(?) within walking distance (one-third mile?)or take the shuttle) is available. Have stayed here at different times of the year four times, the last being in late 2010. Kids will love it too with the pools, lazy river and pool slides.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl1974_10
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. when i arrived to the hotel it was dark but there was this beautiful lights on the trees so it seemed very magical and very welcoming. I was there on a conference but it looks like there are elevators everywhere so I didn´t need to walk that much. The room was big, with very good sized bathroom. The food at the conference was amazing, four stars. The out area is beautiful, with lights and water everywhere. The gym was not very big, but I went really early so it wasn´s so full. The things I wasn´t as happy about was: the internet, it was difficult to get connection in my room, they only had one vendingmachin and it was in a small room on the 5th floor. I would have like to have a restaurant with light meals like sandwich and that kind of things. I got very good food at the conference and didn´t need a full meal in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: momoftwo78
Reviews.Content: One Amazing resort. They have a really good sense on what to do to make your stay as comfortable and relaxing as possible. The pool is a must since it has many pools where you can just wonder off and relax. Walking around the grounds was great day or night with wonderful view of the desert. No free Wi-Fi they charge $12 I think for connecting and the parking lot is out of the way. You have to walk up to the hotel and through the lobby. Not very convenient if you are traveling at night alone with small children sleeping. Other then that a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Expensive, Busy Resort”
Reviews.Author: LynnFarmingtonCT
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days at this resort for a conference. It's a nice resort property with great pools and a golf course. The rooms are a decent size. Regular amenities you would expect and a Starbucks in house. The property was sold out for the conference so working out in the very small fitness center (free) was a no-go unless you went at 4am or 6pm. They have a nice spa with another workout area, but you have to pay extra. The staff is very friendly. I was worried because my room was just off the busy main floor, but the walls are thick and I didn't have an issue with the noise. Hard for the staff to keep up with cleaning the rooms in a timely fashion due to the full house. The maid never made it to my room on Saturday until 3pm. By that point, I was finished with the conf and wanted to relax, so my room wasn't cleaned that day. My biggest issue was the cost of the hotel - well over $300 a night. Didn't feel it justified that price. Initially, I was on the Marriott wait list. I had booked another hotel just in case through Priceline. A 4star+ resort 11 miles away - The Boulders. The room rate was $50 cheaper than the Marriott. Ultimately, I chose to cancel that and go w/Marriott to be onsite for the conf., but wished I had stayed with The Boulders. It's a much nicer facility and would have cost less. Ultimately, I'd recommend this location but I would suggest you look elsewhere if they are hosting a conference or are or near capacity, especially if you're going to spend more time at the hotel than away.

Reviews.Title: “marriott desert ridge - beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: ItravelaLotuKnow
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great -- clean rooms, beautiful grounds, very quiet at night, Starbucks off the lobby. Staff was great, would highly recommend. It's a low rise facility and blends in nicely with the desert surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: rgoyal4
Reviews.Content: Family friendly, beautiful property. If you have a car, not more than 10 minutes from downtown scottsdale. Great restaurants in vicinity as well. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: L0ve2Travel73
Reviews.Content: We came for a conference and we pleasantly surprised. The room was nice and I really enjoyed the balcony. It was nice to have a separate shower, it made it easier to get my son in and out. I enjoyed the location as I could walk to the outdoor shopping area and enjoy a meal at one of my favorite restaurants, Yard House. The food they provided for the conference was definitely better than expected. My son really enjoyed the lazy river and the water slide, he could have stayed there all day if I’d let him. It is a very big hotel and depending on your location you may have to walk a bit (we were quite a ways from our conference so I definitely got my exercise for the day). I tried to book at the spa but they were very full and couldn’t work around my time. If you are planning on going there I would book in advance. We staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, fun for family”
Reviews.Author: larryschwartz
Reviews.Content: We chose this location because we wanted a nice place that my four year old son would also enjoy. It was a good choice. The customeer service was awesome. We spent several days just floating on the lazy river and my little guy loved the water slide. Dining was great too. All of the kids meals were included since we were resort guests and all of the restaurants took great care of us. We were able to eat well and still make sure that my son was happy. The rooms were clean and they quickly took care of any requests like towels and other standard stuff. We would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but too far out of town”
Reviews.Author: Fysmd
Reviews.Content: Went for a conference (BroadSoft Connections) and place has great conference facilities, food was especially good considering that they were catering for over 1000 people. Room (4526) was standard for this type of resort if a little smaller than some. Lazy River is a great place to relax but stay away from the CLEAR rings (not flattering!). Resort charge includes WiFi which is available everywhere and surprisingly fast and reliable. Great to avoid ludicrous roaming charges.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Dealsnphotos
Reviews.Content: This is as good as it gets when it comes to friendly and helpful staff. Its a beautiful resort whit all the things you could need. I was there a while,so I took advantage of the free guest laundry. The scenery was great and the pools fantastic. I had a little trouble working out a time to get the room cleaned, but nothing major. It's in a good location, with restaurants and shopping. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: earladybon
Reviews.Content: Came here for a business conference but had some time to enjoy the facilities. The resort is just beautiful with tremendous thought as to layout, landscaping,facilities and just a real joy to the eyes. The lazy river pool is pure fun and relaxing. The hotel is very family friendly with kids having a blast in the pools and at a child center. The staff everywhere seemed to be especially trained in human kindness. They were never in your face but always seem to appear when you needed assistance. The food was fabulous. We had an especially good time with Umberto and Ana from food service. Restaurants were plentiful and service/staff were great. The rooms were clean, the beds wonderful, the room very airy with a great view of the mountains. Bathrooms were very large with modern amenities. This facility was the best! Although I was here for a conference I never felt less than an invited welcomed guest and treated like a queen. Dont hesitate to come alone, with a family or for business. This facility was the best I've seen in a long time!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and peaceful - and baby friendly!”
Reviews.Author: LillyDeViaje
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights while I attended a conference. The conference and lobby facilities were gorgeous. The on-site restaurants and entertainment were great (although the restaurants did seem a bit overpriced). The lazy river, pools, and outdoor lounging areas were spectacular. We loved the desert botanical gardens, and the convenience of the rental car office on-site. Staff were exceedingly warm, welcoming, and helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable. It was baby friendly as well, offering a crib in the room (that was more solid and more comfortable for my son than a standard pack-n-play type item), a free rubber ball to play with in the pool upon check-in, and high chairs at the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: horseyross
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to this resort at least two times a year. We just love the lazy river and their spa. The best time to go is in the winter because you can sit around the fire and enjoy the scenery. I wouldn't recommend their steakhouse. It's the same price as Ruth Chris but nearly the same quality. Stick with Roys Restaurant on the property. They have great food and happy hour!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent conference venue”
Reviews.Author: wisgirl01
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights for a national conference, and it was spectacular! The rooms were impeccably clean, with a large room and huge bathroom, nice quality amenities, and the staff was very friendly. I also liked that my room had a balcony overlooking the desert botanical garden. It was a nice escape for some fresh air after a long day of meetings. The conference rooms were conveniently located, and the grouds were amazng. I wish I had time to enjoy the pool and golf course, both were beautiful and very inviting. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A "10" plus”
Reviews.Author: Louiexo
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four day stay at the Desert Ridge for a conference, and I was blown away. Everything was top-notch. The room I had was on the top floor and overlooked the desert botanical garden and golf club. The view was breathtaking from my balcony, and the room was very quiet (even though the hotel was fully booked). The pool areas and outdoor lounges were great, the service fantastic, and even the singers in the bar areas were good! I organized a little golf outing for the conference, which the club staff was fantastic about facilitating. And the (Arnold Palmer) course was fantastic! Everything about my stay was flawless, including the meals we enjoyed at Roy's and the Meritage. I wholeheartedly recommend the Desert Ridge for anyone looking for a perfect vacation spot or conference locale.

Reviews.Title: “How do you say fabulous?”
Reviews.Author: momonbusiness
Reviews.Content: If you like sun, desert, lounging by the pool and watching the stars at night, this resort is for you. I was there for a conference. The facilities were excellent - when everyone wasn't sneaking outside to enjoy the pool area. There are hot tubs and relaxing areas for the grown UPS, a lazy river for the kids and restaurants for all tastes. Roy's Hawaiian Fusion is especially good. The golf is also excellent with reasonable prices and quality rentals. While I wish it wasn't so far from downtown, there's really no reason to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: amyp
Reviews.Content: The staffmembers were above and beyond nice! The pool area is awesome. The location is good because it's across from the Desert Marketplace which is a big, outdoor mall with lots of restaurants, shopping and Target if you need anything. My room faced the entrance and on the last night the "background" music they pump outside was able to be heard inside and I had a 6am flight the next morning. Grounds are well kept and it was a great place to have a conference. Not close to Scottdale or downtown though.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: cuberican
Reviews.Content: Had a conference at the hotel. It's typical of a JW in that it's high end and has a lot of amenities. It is massive though, so not everything is at your fingertips. Lots of walking between rooms and various activities. Enjoyed a massage at Revive Spa. I recommend having lunch at the Spa Cafe. It's healthy and reasonable, compared to other places. Roy's is always a good choice for a very nice meal. The Concierge did a great job of helping us arrange dinners off property. We had a wonderful meal at Ocean Prime, which is across the road, but a $6 cab ride, because you wouldn't want to walk over in the heat. I also had to rend a car for the day, but that was super easy because Hertz has a location on site. Because this was for business, I did not go to the pool, but others reported that the pool was really nice. And some even brought their kids and said the water park was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful retreat with lots of activities”
Reviews.Author: Veni-vidi-vicidotcom
Reviews.Content: I won a stay at this beautiful resort and did a lot of activies in the area. The workout facilities were great and of course Marriott is very true to their brand. Very high quality

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: polaraubie
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the spacious room and the generous bathroom, with big tub and separate shower, and lanai overlooking the very well-kept grounds. Terrific pool and areas for walking around the grounds. Convenient shopping a short drive away. Fine service. Roy's offers a terrific selection of drinks and bites at happy hour and serves up a fine dinner. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: TxGrlOutDoors
Reviews.Content: I'm kind of surprised by the high reviews of this place. Maybe it's just my expectations. My spouse had to go here for work so I tagged along and left the kids at home. It's a good location in that it is right by a great shopping center (Desert Ridge Marketplace) that is mostly walking distance but you can also take one of the taxi's/cars over for $5. That shopping center has a movie theater, several restaurant choices, and stores. There are a couple neighborhoods within walking distance as well, so for me needing to just walk and be out, I could go through the neighborhoods and use their trails/washes. The resort itself was just okay. The lazy river was small and it turns off at 7pm. I would have enjoyed being down there past 7 when the sun was down. There are a couple hot tubs so that was nice. I don't know how old this place is but overall it just felt older to me. Had I not been able to leave the resort, I would have gone crazy. I've stayed at several resorts like this and they have all been better, to be honest. Also, most resorts I've been to have had exemplary service, with staff going above and beyond to help me. That was not the case here. I dragged my suitcase a huge distance and was passed by several staff people in golf carts and nobody stopped to help. Not a huge deal, but the service I've received other places. Our shower also leaked onto the bathroom floor like mad. We had to use our towels and mop the floor several times and request new towels. The price of the food wasn't as bad as some places. I will admit I only ate breakfast on site, and left for all my other other meals. Overall I would not call this a resort, but rather a hotel with extra nice pool ammeneties and a spa attached. Nice place to stay in Phoenix, but not a place I'd fly back to for a "resort" visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great summer fun”
Reviews.Author: craftnut
Reviews.Content: Loved this place! Came here for a summer deal, wanted great pool and great food. Despite the 117 degree day, the lazy river was perfect! Drinks were expensive, but the pina colada was the best I've ever had. We upgraded to the Cloud Club--so worth it! Included afternoon bruschetta, appetizers, cocktails, dessert and after dinner drinks and full breakfast (even omelets cooked to order). Next time we would skip dinner in the restaurant since we filled up on the delicious appetizers. Also enjoyed great jazz music in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort overflowing...literally”
Reviews.Author: pikiniki93
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family of 5 in an Executive Suite with one bedroom. The room was spacious and very well appointed. The resort is lovely and large with a number of pools, world class golf along with a wonderful spa. The location is a bit isolated but there is a large shopping center right next to the resort and the 101 freeway is within a 5 min drive. My only real complaint was the number of people in the lazy river and surrounding area. This was a BIG issue because in AZ in the summer you NEED to have a way to cool off if you are outside. It was quite ridiculous. For a resort this large and for the price, the lazy river should have been 4 times its size. You literally were touching the people next to you if you decided to cool off and get in the water. Sitting in the surrounding lounge area wasn't any better. Chairs and towels were lined up right next to each other; absolutely uncomfortable. Although the food service staff was working hard, it took nearly an hour to bring us 4 drinks. Many more wait staff was needed. We would have given 5 stars for this property had it been based on the resort's INDOOR experience alone.

Reviews.Title: “Well kept considering it's age, but too many kids”
Reviews.Author: business_traveler008
