The bathroom was a decent size but a large part of it was taken up with a standard bath tub (no bath products were provided). There was room for double sinks but there was only one sink. The shower was about the size of a telephone booth. The towels were absolutely terrible. If you're looking for soft, fluffy towels, this is not the place. Nice bath robes, but worn and one of them was discolored. SO, if you're looking for a great resort and don't plan to spend much, if any, time in the room, this could be for you. We most likely wouldn't stay there again. When we stay at a resort, we like to be pampered and expect something more luxurious in the way of a room.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous, quiet treat in the midst of a busy spot!”
Reviews.Author: Murry08
Reviews.Content: The staff made our stay at the JW Marriott more than just a nice experience. The hotel is gorgeous and beautifully maintained, but the staff was extraordinary. Everyone from the maids to the doormen/women to the staff in the restaurants was attentive and helpful. The restaurants were top of the line all the way--from the way the food was presented to the variety of food available. Everything was nicely done. The room was neat, clean and quiet with those wonderful big pillows and super soft sheets. Who can ask for more when traveling?

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: leonil300
Reviews.Content: Great! Excellent! The best hotel i've been to so far! excellent facilities and very accessible!

Reviews.Title: “Good conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlbanyL
Reviews.Content: This is a nice conference hotel. The rooms are clean and spacious, there are several restaurants on location, but all are quite expensive. Numerous heated pools outdoors are nice. Overall there's not much to do and a long drive to key attractions. I wouldn't have picked it for a family vacation. Pricey and boring.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: chickie-b
Reviews.Content: We were here recently for my husband's conference, staying four nights. The check in was friendly and efficient, and the rooms were very comfortable, clean and spacious. No refrigerator in the rooms. I noticed also that there was no coffee pot, for those who desire coffee in the morning. Great facilities here, beautiful property. I enjoyed the pool area, and lazy river. Very friendly staff and helpful, knowledgeable concierges. My husband had some business needs that he requested assistance with and they were provided graciously at no extra charge. He remarked that the conference facilities were excellent. They had several choices for restaurants and we enjoyed a good meal at Tuscany, their AAA four diamond rated restaurant. Other guests at the conference enjoyed their meals at Roys. Right across the street was a Desert Ridge shopping mall which was convenient. I had lunch at Tomatoes which was very reasonable with a variety of fresh soups and salads. On the property there is also a Hertz rental which was convenient for us. This resort had many other facilities, of course a spa and fitness classes which I did not use. All in all, a very enjoyable stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, excellent service, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: klawd
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort, staff and service are great, mall within walking distance, but I think this hotel was overpriced. Breakfast was very expensive $17 for continental. I spent 1 night at Residence Inn at Scottsdale for 1/2 the price, more spacious room, and breakfast included. I recommend if you're planning to pamper yourself, or if your company is paying.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5* room - but nice nevertheless”
Reviews.Author: W0rldTravelerNY
Reviews.Content: I traveled here for a conference. I thought the grounds were very nice, inside of the hotel was a typical large conference hotel. Not too impressed with the room which did not have wireless internet, faced the parking lot, and I would say was more in line with a regular Marriott room rather than a JW Marriott. Loved the Roy's restaurant - would definitely recommend. Room service was decent but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay w/ top notch customer service”
Reviews.Author: riodoc
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just returned from a 3 night stay w/ her 2 children 11 and 13. The place is great for kids this age . They absolutely loved the pools especially the lazy river. We picked this as our starting point of a 1 week trip which included a trip to Grand Canyon and Las Vegas. Was perfect for kicking back and being pampered. Wonderful breakfast buffet although a bit pricey. Dinner at Roy's on property was top notch all around. Also took advantage of the Cloud Club lounge (extra fee but well worth it) which was staffed by very friendly and accomodating personnel. Stay at alot of Marriotts and have to say I was most impressed by this one. The place just exudes class. Will definitely return when in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice & clean, grounds were beautiful, but P.T. Barnum would be proud”
Reviews.Author: rockymountainhip
Reviews.Content: Although we found the room was exceptionally clean, nice, and spacious with a great HD TV, this resort is designed to $5 & $10 (not nickle & dime) you to death. There is no refridgerator or microwave like you would expect to find in any quasi-upscale hotel/motel and which are always useful when traveling or staying for extended periods of time. There is a coffee maker in the room but no coffee pot or coffee==that will cost you extra. There is no ice maker anywhere, you have to order ice from room service which we presumed was about $5 for a handful of ice. There isn't even WI-Fi in the rooms. Instead there are some areas around the front lobby that you can get connected but expect to pay about $13 to get connected each day. I declined this "service" so I'm not sure if they also charge you for actual time spent on the net. While our room was paid for by employer, the resort still wanted our credit card for "incidentals" that they expect you to have to pay while there. The grounds and area are really well kept and beautiful and a walk around the outside of the facility is a must do. We didn't go into the swimming pool area because you have to swipe your room key into the gate to get in and we expected that would also be an "incidental" we didn't want to pay for since we were not going to actually swim. There are several of the typical shops and restaurants found in most well appointed malls and shopping centers just across the street from the hotel grounds but it is a fairly good (albeit pretty) walk from the hotel to this area. We ate at the Keg Steakhouse our first night and we both had the toughest prime rib we have ever encountered. We both had tired jaws from trying to conquer these overpriced pieces of meat. We would never return to the Keg because we've had much better prime rib at less than half the cost of this place. We thought initially the Keg was going to be really good just because their prices were extaordinarily high but then you don't always get what you pay for, certainly you don't at the Keg. However, Steamers Seafood Restaurant located closer into downtown Scottsdale was a real treat. The shrimp, scallops, and fish were very good and the prices are reasonable. Also, Mimi's is in the area across from the hotel near the Keg and Mimi's is generally a very good choice for breakfast, lunch or dinner. All in all, aside from the beautiful grounds which you can take in without actually having to stay in the resort, we would prefer to stay in any one of the better motels that provide lots of amenities such as coffee & tea in the room, a fridge, microwave, WiFi. At the Desert Ridge Resort, we felt like P.T. Barnum was following us around (extracting as much money as possible for those things usually included in the price of the room in better hotel/motel selections) while whispering "there's a sucker born every day" as the dollars fled our pockets.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: AngelaS10
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Beautiful and comfortable room. Very good food in restaurant, although you do pay the "resort" price. Lazy river and pools great!

Reviews.Title: “Massive Hotel. Nice. Impersonal. Spotty Service. Some Odd Issues.”
Reviews.Author: ChetX5150
Reviews.Content: It's almost 2010 and yet I was told my deluxe king room did not have wireless internet. Really? Is that possible for a nearly 1,000 room JW Marriott conference hotel? The hotel is big and has lots of amenities. You can get lost here, it's like a biosphere. Grounds are nice, but location is pretty far from the core Scottsdale properties. For many off-site dinners and meetings, journey is a pain. We did a conference dinner at the Phoenician and it took a good 40+ minutes to get there at 5PM. Had some room service errors and slowness, but food was pretty good. Has one nice restaurant on property. Had a somewhat difficult concierge experience when they could not find a package that was delivered. In a nutshell, it's a good, above average facility for a conference, but they do not live up to the JW name on service and attention to detail. It's no Phoenician, No Four Seasons, No Royal Palm, No Marriott Camelback. But, if you are here for a work event, it has what you need, however, it's not a four or five star hotel on service. The facilities are very nice, but I had too many minor issues to compare this to a true Scottsdale resort like the Phoenician. If you want the best Scottsdale has to offer--this is not it. And, it's way out of the core area. Nearly 1,000 rooms and it feels that big.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: DeOhGee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous. Settled in the suburbs, it had a great view of the mountain ridge. There is a major mall across the street with a lot of places to eat. (I recommend the Keg, a better than average steakhouse). There is a pool and a lazy river. The rooms is big with a HD flat panel. My wife complained about the 6 ESPN channels, but that seems fine with me. They have a fireplace pit at night. As with all Marriott's, everything is pricey. But this was definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcheck99
Reviews.Content: Our friend paid for us to stay here for our Wedding night. The room was beautiful and very spacious. We loved the short time we spent here. The bedding was very soft and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Golf and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: jdubTeeDot
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Desert Ridge Resort! Spent a long weekend there with my girlfriend and we were really impressed with everything. The rooms were clean with great furniture, the staff was friendly, food was delicious and golfing in October is always great. The location offered a variety of amenities to keep you occupied or you could just relax in the desert sun by one of the many pools.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DMH3953
Reviews.Content: What wonderful special few days in spent in the desert. Rooms were well. aquatinted Food was well above normal Spa was just delicious A well spent few days in the dessert

Reviews.Title: “Great, relaxing weekend at nice resort”
Reviews.Author: brianasea
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel has beautiful grounds, lovely pools, and great food. We had a nice room overlooking the outdoor lounging area and some of the grounds which was very nice. We ate at Blue Sage several times and really enjoyed the food. We ate at Roy’s once which was not quite as good. We checked out the steakhouse during the day and they were a little snooty so we opted out. We decided to do to Cloud Club for one day of the trip to enjoy some afternoon snacks, drinks, and breakfast. They have a nice outdoor patio where we watched a wedding. Service in the club was a higher level than in the rest of the resort. The food in the Cloud Club was about 90% hit and 10% miss. Overall it was a good value for the $50 discounted price per person. The best feature of the hotel by far was the lazy river. My husband can’t stand to just sit by the pool, so the river was perfect because kept him somewhat occupied with people watching and playing in the water.

Reviews.Title: “Customer satisfaction is paramount.”
Reviews.Author: oplaptop
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautifully groomed and I loved the way that it was in keeping with the desert surroundings, desert doesn't mean dry and brown here. The staff went over the top to make my traveling companion feel at home when finding out it was her birthday by sending her a birthday card with everyone's signature and a lovely dessert with a "Happy Birthday" written in cream colored frosting on top of the chocolate treat. We were impressed. The service at poolside was pleasant and unobtrusive. The room was beautiful, clean and we had a great view across the massive complex full of pools. There was also a lazy river pool with intertubes which we found quite relaxing after a long day of meetings. The resort although away from the hussle of the surrounding shopping and eating areas was really just right across the street so we had plenty of variety of both in close proximity. The resort was also fairly close to the airport. I guess what I liked least was that we were not allowed to bring a cooler to the pool. Drinks were expensive and it would have been nice to cut some cost there.

Reviews.Title: “georgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparkerMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, i had a great room next to an elevator that brought me down to the pool, I was there on a conference and the location of my room was good, beautiful grounds and you can rent a Sedway to tour it. They offer a great tour of the Gerand Canyon with Detour tours, worth every penny a must see.. There is not alot to do without a car but you really don't need to, there is plenty to see and do at the hotel. There is shuttle to a mall with plenty of restaraunts and stores. The food at the hotel is a little pricey but good. Just be careful the water in the refigerator is 7.10 a bottle, I thought it was free.

Reviews.Title: “take your accountant and ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: bill007
Reviews.Content: Potentially a lovely resort , well kept , with very good facilities . However I would not return because of a couple of major issues. When I booked I called the hotel and was told there was a package which was $ 269 and gave free breakfast buffet and $ 100 a night towards the hotel restaurants. When I checked in I asked to confirmed the package but they said " no free breakfast". After a long discussion they eventually agreed to honour what I had been told and not charge for the breakfast. However when I checked out they had charged for the breakfast !.. That was another long conversation but they did eventually cancel that charge. They had also not applied the$ 100 credit to my dinner at Roys restaurant at the hotel . I took issue with this when I checked out and got the bill and they said " that resturant is on our property but not owned by us so you cannot use the credit. " I said that was the first time I had been told that and if I had known I would have eaten at one of their other restaurants . They said that when they gave me my room key there was some small print on the documents attached stating that Roys was excluded, , so I had to pay for that dinner. ( When I got home I found the papers they gave me when I checked in and there was NO mention of the fact that I could not use the credit at Roys) . When I checked out I asked if I could use some of the unused credit for lunch . They said that was fine. However that was then charged to my credit card, but when I raised the issue they cancelled it. . This was all such a hassle I would not return. I got the clear impression that they will charge for everything they can and hope you do not notice. The second issue I had was that despite a very good range of pools, not one was " adults only" and all had noisy kids so I had no peace to read. I also think that the $ 25 " resort fee" should be shown upfront as part of the room cost, not slipped into the final bill .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Setting - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: elicyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at J.W. Marriott Spa & Resort for three nights for a business event. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. The facility is gorgeous! I could have spent most of my trip in the lobby or the huge arrival verandah. This impressive property blends very well with the natural surroundings and I was thrilled to see jack-rabbits eating grass on the lawn on my way to breakfast. Dining outside was a treat as well since all sorts of birds, including hummingbirds happily mingled with diners and staff and more aggressive species waited to snatch left overs from the buffets and clearing trays. The impressive labeled native plant collection on the walking paths and an adequate number of big comfy wooden benches and chairs made it easy to tolerate the high temperatures (102 - 106 during my stay). The distant mountain range was an impressive view from my balcony. A colleague said she'd seen a coyote on the path during an early morning jog. This facility is definitely for nature lovers and is a perfect backdrop for nature photography. My king room was adequate, though the color scheme and decor made it a little too casual - might do well with an update. The room and the entire hotel were clean and tidy though. In my room was a large desk with ethernet (wi-fi is free in the lobby), big screen TV, large chest with in-room safe, large closet, loads of large mirrors, a seating area with loveseat and coffee table and a large bath with deep soaking tub and separate glass shower. When I reported the toilet handle was barely attached to the tank when I got to my room maintenance arrived promptly to make the repair and the front desk followed up via phone to ensure all was well. Meeting areas were great but our group was quite large so we utilized several salons. Because of the size of the room it was difficult to view either of the huge screens while presenting from the center of the stage. One thing everyone noted was the hotel catering staff for the meeting was reluctant to leave the buffets out for very long even though the meeting frequently ran past break time. Stragglers arrived to the foyer to find the serving trays had already been removed though there had still been plenty of food. Food during the meeting and via room service was good, nothing extraordinary but certainly not inedible. The resort boasts several restaurants though I did not get a chance to try any of them. There is also a spa, golf course, swimming pool with 'rafting,' a Starbuck's and Kinko's as well as several upscale shops. Kiosks to print boarding passes are across from the front desk and are a welcome convenience. The conscierge desk staff was even there late evening to help facilitate day trips or outings and there was a multitude of brochures to peruse. Each morning, a variety of newspapers were available at reception. Despite the magnitude and elegance of the entry and reception, the main focus at Marriott Spa & Resort seems to be comfort and a down to earth friendly, cheerful approach. I suppose that would explain the sunny yellows and bright colors in the rooms rather than more somber and stuffy elegance. One point to keep in mind if heading here for a stay is the resort is very large. I was on one end of the building on the lobby level and my meeting was at the other end. It was easily a ten minute walk, albeit through the beautiful lobby and past a bank of windows through which I could watch the bunnies enjoying the lawn. Marriott was advertising a deal, $99 a night for up to four nights for a future visit but it was necessary to prepay and I wasn't sure when I'd be in Phoenix again so I didn't get details but I would definitely recommend this property for leisure or business especially at those savings!

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Chopalua
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a huge parcel. The location, flora, water features and golf is what makes this hotel. Because of this, they can also charge a higher rate. I thought the room was a bit run down and slightly dated (late '90s/early 2000) decor and color scheme. This was our second visit to the property. The outdoor features is the draw to this place. The hotel draws families and golfers. If you don't mind kids running down the hall, overtaking the pool or sporadic sounds of screams, then you'll not be irritated at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Best room we will stay in this year.”
Reviews.Author: Nevada_Terry
Reviews.Content: We stayed in conjunction with a jazz concert on September 11 in room 5305. The accommodation was large, clean and comfortable. Our room had a king bed with deluxe linens. Our private balcony faced the north east and had a bistro table and two chairs with a great view of the pool and mountains. Room amenities included a flat panel TV with analog and digital content, couch, coffee table, desk with internet access (at extra cost) and two telephones. Beware that all calls made from room telephones to numbers outside the hotel are at extra cost. Check in is normally at 4:00 PM but I called ahead and was granted a 2:00 PM check in. Our stay was on a Friday night and there was a large gathering in the lounge area. One could hear the din from all of the people gathered in the lounge but it was not loud enough to spoil our stay and it did diminish around midnight. Check in was fast friendly and efficient. My biggest complaint with our stay is that the Marriott does not make it easy for those driving their own vehicle. If you choose not to use valet parking (I don’t trust the valets with my car) the self parking areas are far from the lobby. There is no close temporary parking for check in and the valets insist on taking your car keys while checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Hinsdalemama
Reviews.Content: It really is a pleasure! The hotel is so nice that we stayed there 3 times n 3 different occasions in the past. It has beautiful rooms and grounds, great restaurants and costumer service is fantastic! I recomended it to many of our friends who were all very impressd!

Reviews.Title: “Watch your stuff: Security may not take you seriously”
Reviews.Author: KQW
Reviews.Content: My daughter spent the night with a group of friends. They were in the pool and she foolishly left her new iPhone by the pool. Needless to say, it was stolen. She went right to Security and reported it. The person who was there listened to her, told her that "we will get right on it". She asked if he needed her room number or phone number. He said to check at lost and found when she checked out in the morning. If it was there, it was; if not, it was gone. As a teenager, she failed to get that person's name. In the early morning, she contacted Security to see if it had been found. The person working said there was no record of her loss. She told him what had happened and they were able to locate the person that took her info. He said "oh, I thought it was a prank and that she wasn't a guest." I am pleased that the person in the morning told her he was embarrassed by what happened and that he represented Marriott Hotels to her right now and he was sorry for the lack of followup. She left her phone number in case it is found.... The liklihood of finding it last night was slim; the following day it is nill. But, the issue is that you would like to think that Security at least was following up on a loss when it is reported to them. As I said, watch your stuff as you may not get help depending on who you talk to in the Security Department. My husband is a Marriott Silver Member and we are used to excellent treatment by Marriott. Just because she was a teenager does not mean that the same service should not to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, away from downtown”
Reviews.Author: cadence8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 30 minutes from the airport, but an easy drive (you want a car this far out). The grounds of the hotel are beautiful, there are pathways through the golf course with patches of desert that come alive with animals in the evening. There are at least 4 pools, so it is easy to find a quiet one. The cheaper (though not cheap) restaurants in the resort aren't that exciting (Splash, Blue Sage) but the Italian restaurant and Roy's are excellent (I left my credit card at the Italian restaurant, and it was promptly returned). Rooms are very nice, flat screen tvs, fairly spacious (though my view was of the roof of the convention center). There was a balcony off of the room. There is a large and growing shopping area across the street (there is a shuttle from the resort, but a car is much more convenient), so you don't need to eat in the expensive hotel restaurants. I was there for a convention, so it was nice to be able to take the elevator from the down to the meeting. I would consider staying here again if visiting Phoenix (though I didn't find Phoenix that exciting).

Reviews.Title: “beautiful grounds, tons of activities, loads of fun!”
Reviews.Author: IndieQueen819
Reviews.Content: simply put: i loved my time spent at the JW Desert Ridge. Our room was beautiful with a private balcony overlooking a mountain range and a beautifully landscaped courtyard area. The wildlife on the actual resort blew my mind as well. we frequently shared our breakfast with the local birds and bunnies. The pool area was busy, but enjoyable and clean. Would definitely go back if we could get a good deal again!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel ... Fabulous Amenities ... Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ccollman
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge as a little getaway for my wife and I. They had some really good summer specials for us locals (we live only five miles away, if that), so I decided to take advantage of a couple and see what this resort was like. We had never stayed there before. The first night, we got a local rate of $111 for the night. The arrival, valet and check-in process was smooth and everyone greeted us and made us feel welcomed. The room was spacious with a king bed, big couch, desk, flat-screen TV, balcony and a huge bathroom with separate soaking tub and shower. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were top of the line. We spent most of the day relaxing in the room or walking around the resort holding hands. It was great! For dinner, we ate at Roy's, one of the restaurants at the hotel. It serves Roy Yamaguchi's renowned Hawaiian Fusion Cuisine in a festive, island-style atmosphere. The food was great and the service even better. The second night, we did the "Buy two massages and get your hotel night free" deal ... the two massages were only $175 total and they were great! The Revive Spa truly lives up to the hype and advertising ... it is luxurious, well-appointed, soothing, clean and the service is outstanding. My wife and I got a couple of great massages and spent most of the day at the spa, swimming in the pool, eating at the spa cafe and taking advantage of the amenities. For dinner, we just decided to sit outside at the Vista Lounge, had a couple of drinks and ordered some sushi rolls. They were really good! Later, back in the room, we got the munchies and I decided to order a Chicken Pot Pie from the Blue Sage Restaurant. This was the only down side to the whole experience ... it was the worst Chicken Pot Pie I have ever had! Oh well. The next morning, the check-out process was painless as all we had to do was drop the key off at the front desk. The valet had our car waiting, loaded our bags and off we went for the five mile drive home. Overall, I give the JW Marriott Desert Ridge the highest rating I have ever given a resort. The facility is new, fresh, modern, clean and inviting. The staff are, without question, friendly and very, very service-oriented. And just about all of the food was fantastic. I know the prices for the accomodations become quite steep in the winter during high season, but if you can get a deal, I would highly recommend this resort in every way. Heck, even without a deal, it would still be worth the experience if you could. If you have read any of my other reviews, you know that I can be highly critical of a hotel when necessary. In this case, I have nothing but praise for the JW Marriott Desert Ridge Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort - top notch except for restaurant/bar service”
Reviews.Author: misha62
Reviews.Content: The rooms were lovely the grounds exquisite and the facilities top notch. The front desk/phone service staff were extremely helpful. On the last evening of out stay we attempted to relax and enjoy the bar and restaurant. Of course, as with most resorts, distance and cost of transportation off-site make for very high prices for on-site food and the Desert Ridge was no exception. A convention at the hotel did push the limit of capacity at the Blue Sage restaurant but nothing beyond that experienced by most major city restaurants on a Saturday night. We found ourselves waiting for 45 minutes to be seated for a buffet. The hostess was useless and couldn’t seem to “finds” any of the parties whose name she whispered (there was no hearing her meek calls over the talk of the people waiting). My husband and I eventually walked in to “see” buffet and noticed several empty tables for two. Still we continued to wait. After finally being seated, we noticed quickly that the large numbers of wait staff did a lot of running around but accomplished very little on each “trip”. The service should have been relatively easy given that most customers chose the buffet. Our first thought was that our table was not assigned though we were in the front room and passed by every server going to the kitchen, bar, and hostess station. The hostess by then had been joined by a young man who seemed to be the only individual trying to solve problems. He seated us, got us our water, cleared tables and sat the crowd the hostess couldn’t seem to handle. We waited 15 more minutes for someone to take our drink order so we could tell them we wanted the $19.95 buffet. Finally a rather abrupt waiter came by and gave us permission to go the buffet. The “adult” buffet food was good but small plates and bowls for deserts and soup were not available. The waiter appeared for what was only his second visit to bring our check. When we finished eating, we continued to wait for another 30 minutes for our money to be taken and another 10 for our change. By this time there were about 4 tables left in the restaurant with patrons seated. Our wait gave us time to watch the hostess take 30 minutes to buss a table across from us with ADD like distractions pulling her away to seemingly meaningless tasks every few seconds. The entire staff was now in closing mode and we were completely unable to make eye contact with anyone. Luckily we were not in a hurry and decided to make the best of watching and chuckling at this hapless display of disorganization. After more than two hours we went to just outside the restaurant to the large patio area to enjoy a drink. No server asked us our order though they did serve other guests around us. We then ventured to the lobby bar are where we experienced the same non-service. I strongly suggest the Dessert Ridge go to the local Denny’s or Waffle House to bring their wait staff up to the standards of the rest of this hotel’s service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel..should have better restaurant service..”
Reviews.Author: coastal4
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel rooms, lobby, pools and landscaping..A+++..but the restaurant service, particularly at the Blue Sage is the WORSE we have ever experienced at a resort..for the money paid, expect the best..I am not a complainer, but took 45 minutes to get our drinks..kids gave up and ate from the slop buffet( worse than what you would get at a Mac Donalds)and they tried to charge $17.95 each, even though one of our kids was free with the resort fee we paid..our food arrived cold 30 minutes later..meanwhile the kids left, had been gone for a long time, and waitress asked if they wanted refills on their drinks, not noticing they were gone..our salad came after the meal..and the kids dirty plates sat at the table the whole time..horrible experience, for such a beautiful place..get your act togwether Desert Ridge!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: suzyav8trix
Reviews.Content: Local Phoenix resident - Staycation! It's hot here in the summer and many of the local resorts have specials, especially for the locals. It was time for some "re-connect" time with my hubby and I found a great deal on a room and 2 spa treatments, with breakfast, for 2 nights, so I booked it. We checked in between 2 and 3 on a Friday afternoon -- valet was wonderful, bellman took our bags, and we checked in. Just as we had begun to wait, less than 2 minutes, another clerk came out from behind the wall. Now, that is what I call service. We were upgraded to a suite because of my rewards status. Nice. We were also offered the option of opting "out" of the resort fee -- which I thought was required, but I see from several other reviews that that appears to be something this Marriott is doing this summer. I was very excited not to have to pay $25 just to save $10 on valet parking which was the only "feature" of the resort fee that was of any value to us. We were there to relax and did not need internet access, no kids, etc, etc, etc... However, it appeared on our bill the 2nd night. A quick discussion upon checkout and it was promptly removed. Nice. Very nice. We got everything we asked for: extra pillows, extra towels, within 1/2 an hour of checking in. Our suite was lovely -- huge bathroom all done in marble and granite, nice bed, wonderful bed linens, flat screen TV. Beautiful double balcony where we enjoyed our morning coffee. The "living room" furniture was dated with the support on the chairs and sofa, worn out. Since we didn't really need/use that room, that was not an issue for us. The property was built about 2002, so it's coming up on time for a re-do. I did notice that part of our hallway had different carpeting and door number signs -- very pretty -- maybe a sign of things to come? We also upgraded to the Cloud Club -- which is a very good value for 2 people -- especially if one of them has Marriott rewards elite status. Made to order breakfast, tea and cookies and candies available all day long, sandwiches mid-afternoon, adult beverages from 4-10pm with a "taste" from one of the restaurants at 5 and desert at 8. No one under 21 allowed. Nice. Very nice. My only complaint is that it is supposed to be non-smoking yet they allowed cigarettes and cigars on the "far" balcony -- which stunk up the whole place. Oh, and have I mentioned the spa? I love the Revive Spa. I have used the spa outside of this stay and have never been disappointed. Hubby had a brown sugar moisturizing scrub and a gentleman's facial, and I had a therapeutic massage and facial. Wow. Excellent on all 4 counts! And the locker rooms are modern with all the conveniences -- robes and slipper, showers, steam room, sauna, jaccuzzi, hair dryers, and all the necessary products -- hair spray, deodorant, combs, brushes, qtips, etc. And there's a serenity pool. Yes SERENITY -- No one under 18 is allowed. Quiet. Beautiful. Peaceful. Luxurious. Ahhhh. Although this place is huge -- it's beautiful and well done. The hotel was busy, but not crowded. All of the restaurants are great. Our room was at the end of one wing, so it was exceptionally quiet. Did I say I love this place? I really do. If they could enforce the no smoking policy at the Cloud Club it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: TNgal
Reviews.Content: First off let me say that July in Phoenix is very hot. It was 115 degrees during our visit. When we arrived with our rental car we parked under the entry canopy. The valet insisted on taking our keys while we went inside to check in. Check in was very slow since there were only three associates behind the counter. When it was our turn about 15 minutes later we were taken care of promptly. The associate did not mention the resort fees (they cover high speed internet, fitness facilty etc) of $25 per day. When I checked my account on the hotel channel I saw the fee and asked that it be removed. When I checked out I realized they only took the fee off for my first day. The mistake was corrected. We went back out to retrieve our keys and inquire about parking. We expected that we would have to pay $10 per day but we were not charged. Self parking was quite a distance away but as we were unloading the car a golf cart pulled up and whisked us up to the hotel ballroom so we could check in for our conference. He literally pulled us right up to the door. I did not book our rooms under our event's group rate. I was able to find a cheaper rate through AAA. Their rate also guaranteed us a view of the pool. We received an email from the hotel concierge asking for any other special requests...and all of them were met. Great view, high floor, extra pillows etc. The room was very large with a huge balcony overlooking the pool area. The bathroom was also very large with a tub and a seperate shower. The entire bathroom was travertine and granite. Perfectly clean and well appointed with a blow dryer, toiletries etc. The fabrics in the room were a bit dated but the bed was all white high quality linens. The matttress was extra cushy. My king room had a small sofa that also pulled out into a bed. The armoire at the foot of the bed had a 42" high def flat screen. It was also outfitted with plug ins for computer, Ipod with power cords in the roomy closet to make all the needed connections. There was also a mini bar and very small frdige in the armoire as well as a small safe. The closet was large and had many hangers, 2 plush spa robes, a full size ironing board and iron, coffee service and the entertainment plugs mentioned above. Large sliding doors went out onto a semi private balcony. It had plenty of room to relax and it was awesome to sit out there in the morning before my meetings and enjoy the cooler air. At least it was enjoyable until my neighbor turned out there two kids onto their adjoining balcony. I glanced over and discovered that they were just sitting there staring at me...my guess is the parents stuck them out there so they could have some "alone time" in the room? HA, The hallways were divided by large stairways and atriums so there wasn;t that Vegas huge long hallway vibe. I think this contributed to it being very quiet at night. There is a bar in the hotel lobby that plays live music at night outside on a patio. Unfortunately the patio was close to my room so it sounded like a live concert up in my room til after 10PM. The ballrooms were a decent walk from the rooms but certainly not excessive. The meeting rooms were well appointed and even those usually boring banquet meals were all very tasty and enjoyable. We tried two of the hotel restaurants, The Blue Sage, which was more like a big coffee shop and Roy's. Roy's was outstanding but quite pricey. Good for an expense account or special occaision but definitely not everyday vittles. There is a huge outdoor shopping complex called Dessert Ridge across the street from the hotel with tons of restaurants and another complex just down the street with many upscale eateries. We tried 25degrees there and it was outstanding. Gourmet burgers and excellent appetizers. The pool area was just outstanding. There was a long lazy river and then about 4-5 other pools scattered about. There were tons of chairs and many water stations. Everyone grabbed the complimentary tubes and cruised along with their margaritas and pina coladas. It was just wonderful. The landscaping was inpeccable and the terrain went on and on with golf course and the hotel grounds. It was so much greener than I thought the desert could be. The sound of running water was everywhere with water features of all varieties scattered around. Every single hotel associate I came into contact with was smiling and friendly. I don't know if this had to do with the economy and them being so grateful to have any job or if perhaps they had the opportunity to hire a higher calibre of employee because of it. Regardless they all went out of their way to be extra nice and helpful. Was this the most spectacular hotel out there, no, but this whole experience ranked right up there as being among the most pleasant I have had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: SoBeGirlNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 5 night stay at this property. After traveling to Mt. Rushmore and the Grand Canyon, this was the last part of our trip and it was going to be relaxing. Well, it was extremely busy with a Wine Festival, pastry competition, train convention and it was also 4th of July. I guess that was to be expected given the time of year. The whole staff at the property was extremely hospitable from the valet attendants, front desk staff, bell staff and servers. We did get upgraded to a suite because of my husband's Marriott status which was beautiful. The room was very clean and had 2 balconies, bar area, dining room and huge bathroom. It was very comfortable. We did opt for a daily Resort Fee of $25 which gave our kids free breakfast, lunch and dinner in the Blue Sage, internet access, free parking, complimentary spa / fitness club access, etc. Very useful considering our kids ate about $35 each morning at the buffet. Pool was very busy and you had to get a chair before 10am or else you wouldn't have a place to sit. LOTS of kids! Loved the Lazy River the best. Great Nickolodean activities for kids which they loved. I love the spa! My sister and I had a massage and it was very relaxing and also lunch in the cafe. Excellent service and great food! Would definitely go back but maybe not in July (too hot!) Might try in the winter months and it wouldn't be so crowded. Best restaurant was the steakhouse. Delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort - You Won't Be Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lululouise
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Resort - everything you need is right there. They offer five different restaurants, pool and spa. My friend and I had a girls' weekend and enjoyed every bit of it. We got an awesome deal for SPA treatments (facials) and spent part of the day at the SPA's pool, which was very relaxing and a great way to cool off in 103 degree heat. I would recommend eating at Roy's and getting the price fixe dinner - it was awesome! Also, I would recommend upgrading to the Cloud Club. The concierges' are wonderful and you get a cooked to order breakfast. It was well worth it especially if you're a Marriot Rewards Member. Although the valet parking is a bit expensive, it's worth it in the summertime! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “one word excellent”
Reviews.Author: mskeena
Reviews.Content: need i say anymore, EXCELLENT!!! any money spent here is well worth it. the service the spa the location EXCELLENT!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not overly impressed”
Reviews.Author: butterflyy2000
Reviews.Content: First of all valet park if you dont want to walk a mile(or it seemed like it) from your self parking lot..Hotel is HUGE, be prepared to walk alot in general. Staff not overly helpful. Lazy River closed at 7pm and didnt open until 11 am, so we really didnt get much use of it with the 4 oclock check in and noon check out..plan to spend at least two days if you want to enjoy the pools! Room was nice, I had asked to be upgraded to a suite, thinking we would have a bedroom, with living room area..what we got was one very large room, with two balconies, although it was very nice with nice views, we would of preferred the bedroom/living room set up better. Plus the sofa was not a sleeper, so the kids had to camp out on the floor(we didnt realize that it wasnt a sofa sleeper, until we had already settled in, and didnt feel like moving). The best thing about the hotel was its beautiful grounds.Overall, I would probably not stay here at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay at this property again”
Reviews.Author: SpaGirlDallas
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful property- no arguments there. When we checked in the host told us in order for a king size bed we would have "no scenic view".. It was 11pm and we were tired- so we agreed. That was our mistake! The room was very nice but when we opened the window- it was literally a brick wall. I could not believe we were paying $275 a night and not an ounce of sunshine in the room.We were there for a conference that started early the next morning so we went to bed and thought we would deal with it the next day. When we did they said they could move us the next day. By then we were settled and did not want to re-pack and move rooms. We had a tight schedule and we were exhausted from having a house fire the week before our meeting. When we checked out we requested a review and some consideration on our room charge. We felt like we were getting a lesser value than all other rooms in the hotel. They refused to discount us- quite frankly we would have been happy with any compensation but for the fact that we were already on a "group rate" they would not even consider. I called the hotel months later just to let them know how I felt as a customer and I could not get an answer or a call back from the manager. There are so many fabulous places to stay in Phoenix and we go to Phoenix at least once a year sometimes twice. I will never stay at this place again and I am bitter about the treatment. I will stay elsewhere and drive over for the conference.

Reviews.Title: “If you like Disneyland come to this spa!”
Reviews.Author: TheBusIsLeaving
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Ridge resort for two days at the end of our vacation. It is a beautiful large resort with all the amenities. We were given a very quiet room, although it overlooked an acre of roof. The room, bath, cleanliness was all very good. We spent one afternoon at the outdoor pool area. It was what we expected - lots of noise and young families. I had one little boy cannonball me while his mother watched and said nothing. They had the entire pool but chose to douse the few adults talking. The resort planned this area well because all the water falls really drown out a lot of the worst noise. That evening we dined at Ristorante Tuscany and it was by far the finest meal of the week including our excellent service. It was a very expensive dinner but I would highly recommend this restaurant. The next day we planned to spend the entire day at the spa pool and then have a massage in the afternoon. This is a beautiful spa and we were very impressed when we first arrived. That soon changed. In spite of many signs placed in the spa and outside at the pool stating no cell phone use, no smoking, etc. people were just coming to the spa to make their cell phone calls at the outdoor tables. Women were chatting on their cell phones in the locker room, and people were loudly conducting business all around the pool. One young women was on her phone the entire afternoon. The spa is also nonsmoking yet one young man found a lounge chair outside the locker room and smoked away. You could smell it in the pool area. The final straw was a young mother and grandmother rolling in her baby with stroller, etc. to camp out at one end of the pool. The spa states that it is for adults and children over 16. Another young mother not using the spa brought her 6 year old son to the outdoor spa cafe so she could talk on her cell and let him run around. Why have rules if they mean nothing? This is not an adult spa and it was not relaxing. The waiters will not say anything for fear of losing tips. We changed our plans for massages knowing that tranquility is not a priority here. The next morning were were charged an extra resort fee for each day even though we were on a package and did not use the internet or parking. They said they had taken it off only to find they had not when we returned home. Nothing earth shattering, but nevertheless an annoyance that takes time to correct. If you have small children and like a loud noisy resort this is for you. If you like a first rate spa experience I would look elsewhere for these prices. Also, if you need to get to the Phoenix airport they do not have any reasonable transportation provided by Marriott. It is about a 30 minute drive as costs about $60.

Reviews.Title: “A step into tropical paradise!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hazother1
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome. We had a lady's weekend, and it served it's purpose as a place to relax & rejuvenate. The pools were beautiful. The atmosphere in general was breathtaking. Great location next to the mall with the free shuttle. The food was on the pricier side, but the mall food is a great option. Staff was always helpful and friendly. They were quick to attend to any needs and requests. Would go back in a heartbeat!!!!!! The only downside is that there's a daily $10 parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Overinflated surprise charges”
Reviews.Author: ashtonnewmexico
Reviews.Content: Took advertised package for jazz concert for $269 for one night. Ended up costing way more. The room with "resort fees"; "parking fees"; taxes was $335.69. However, supposedly in the package was a Sunday brunch. Well, besides the $335.69, I received a charge for $51.55 for tip and taxes added to my $335.69 room charge. Amazingly, the brunch was VERY disappointing, and the service terrible. No way, would I pay that kind of money for that kind of service and food--especially when it was supposedly "included" in the package. Sent email to the manager, and got "template" response of how competitive they are. I will never return to this location--way too busy (waited in lines for everything), and terribly expensive. I feel swindled by all the hidden charges.

Reviews.Title: “BEST THING IS THE LAZY RIVER”
Reviews.Author: rockstar321
Reviews.Content: Went to JW from May 7-12 with a mother daughter trip, the lazy river is the best thing about this hotel. The hallways to the rooms and I think the rooms are dated. There were peanut shells in the hallway that were never vacuumed up and sat there for days. The fitness area that is free is ok, machines are dated. I sid check out the spa fitness and that is very nice. Something that the hotel forgets to tell you is that you can use the spa fitness center which has state of the art equipmen for free but never told me that until I had a question about the internet two days later. I will probably not be staying there again, the rooms need revamped, it is a big hotel. The service was good at the pool and at the outside bar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Samson1Nj
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this decadent, four star, oasis in the desert? Worth every cent. It almost seems like a small city unto itself - various shops, restaurants and loads to look at right on the first floor. Service was outstanding. View from the room was wonderful. Only complaint - for such a costly hotel, they DEFINITELY need to invest on high quality sofa beds - even a roll-away would have been better than the rack that was provided.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised that they had no record of my reservation”
Reviews.Author: susmug
Reviews.Content: After I booked my trip, I emailed that hotel to confirm my reservation. I received a response email from the resort manager, Bradley Colton, who wrote that my reservation was confirmed and that he would be sure to notify the front desk that they should hold my room (I was arriving at night). After a long flight from NY and a half hour ride from the airport, they had no room for me, which was upsetting. After the desk clerks were working on the computer trying to find a room for me they put me on the ground floor in a room for a disabled person. I was not pleased with the room, especially considering the high price I was paying. I asked to be moved, which they did at no delay, to a room on the fourth floor with a lousy view. The rest of the trip was quite nice as it is a beautiful and peacful resort. It is necessary to have a car if you want to explore the city, although there is a bus line that stops in front of the resort. The buses there are pretty good, if you are not in a rush to get anywhere. But they stop running at about 9:30 at night. RENT THE CAR AT THE AIRPORT. The Hertz rental car place at the resort STINKS- long wait of 2 days for a car. Don't expect any exciting night life in Phoenix during the work week. Places are practically empty after 8. The shopping is the same that you have at home-all the same stores, but the merchandise may be a little different. There are a lot of shopping malls in Phoenix, very large sprawling shopping malls, and they are repetitions of each other. Drive outside the city and see Carefree and Cavecreek.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: chrisRochesterNy
Reviews.Content: Every Staff member was excellent,friendly and provided great service , from the front desk to the maids. Food was excellent in all restaurants, kid friendly , all the pools and grounds were wonderful.Tennis and Gold not to be missed. We'll be back !

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, but nice”
Reviews.Author: asmets41
Reviews.Content: Had stayed previously at the Camelback with my wife , but had the kids this time and decided to try here due to the pool description. Wrong. Pool was disappointing at best. Slide was for much smaller kids and lazy river was nothing to write home about. Service around the pool was also poor. The first time we ordered they lost our order and when it was realized they did bring out food right away at no charge. The restaurant Roy's which is located in the hotel but not affiliated with it was great. Spa was average at best also (the Camelback has the best spa according to my wife). Overall ok experience, but not someplace for kids older than 10.

Reviews.Title: “I expect more from JW”
Reviews.Author: jennjason711
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott Gold member I was disappointed at how many times I had to request the services and "extras" that both the room package and membership level require. I don't need a letter every day telling me what I can expect and then have to send every bill back to be adjusted. The location is beautiful and the number of activities for the whole family where great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy”
Reviews.Author: aaronc68
Reviews.Content: On a short note I had a very nice time and the staff is very friendly, very popular resort for families. Pool is great for adults and small children, golfing prices vary during the season and if you want to golf free sit in on a time share sales pitch and golf both courses complementary on the resort

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break relaxing family getaway”
Reviews.Author: tstitzel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW for the first time. We found the property very clean, service was very good, tennis courts, pool spa and exercise facilities were all in excellent condition. We had two rooms and were very satisfied with the stay. We will return to the JW!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay at a beautiful resort - top notch service every day. Long read - but new perspective.”
Reviews.Author: CincyFam
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by smiling faces immediately upon arrival. Had plenty of assistance with our luggage and were escorted to our rooms realtively quickly. Check-in was painless and the staff were very friendly. We had two rooms and both were found to be very clean - beds very comfortable. Housekeeping was great - graciously providing some essentials we forgot. Didn't 'lock up our belongings' as another reviewer recommended, but never had a single problem. We used the tennis courts daily and the pros were wonderful. They even let you play in the evenings (lighted courts) at no charge. They were great with our teenagers. We found the Faldo golfcourse to be fairly well maintained and challenging. We did not eat at the restaurants onsite - prices were exhorbitant. We did however find good deals at the small shop outside the Blue Sage. Nice chef salads & sandwiches at reasonable prices. Best bet - go to one of the many nearby (five minutes) shopping areas as they have several restaurants to choose from. The property is beautiful - flowers, trees, grounds all well maintained. The hotel was not busy the first few days of our stay - and booked solid towards the end. The pool had lounge chairs available all the time - and staff was helpful in bringing add'l chairs out as needed. Our pool servers were attentive - even during the busier days. We did not use the lazy river, as it was mostly filled with small children. The pools were all to be heated but we found the small pool in the rear of the property extremely cold. We were told the heater was broken, and soon to be fixed. It remained cold our entire stay. The others were fine. Overall - a great, relaxing vacation. Easy drive to Sedona and Phoenix airport.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, dangerous pool area”
Reviews.Author: westoverlawyer
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a week, part time for a conference and part time for vacation. Where oh where to start? 1. The worst service of any hotel I have ever been to. Staff at the pool area are rude, unresponsive, and act as if you are bothering them if you ask them for anything. 2. I was overcharged on my bill several times. 3. There was a bizarrely mean woman tending the slide in the Lazy River. She actually seemed to get off on screaming at the kids and singling out certain kids for her disdain. Everyone at the resort was calling her the "Pool Nazi." Several people complained, to no avail. 4. The pool area has some smooth concrete which is lethally slippery when it gets wet, which resulted in, 5. my broken second toe and a complete lack of empathy or any response at all from the hotel management. AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL. The food ranges from bad (Blue Sage, which apparently cannot discern the difference between an omelette and scrambled eggs despite numerous edification efforts by me) to Bad Plus Expensive (my $80 wagu rib eye cooked within an inch of its life when I requested "rare" and no comping for it) to OK (Roy's is fine but everything is horribly salted) to "Not Bad" (Tuscany is what we would consider a mid-level restaurant here in Portland but much more expensive). I am now in bed with a very messed up toe and management refused to put me in tough with their loss claims department so I could send them my medical bills. My son really enjoyed our three hours in the emergency room, and when I asked the hotel to fill my prescription so I could simply lay down for a while after returning from the hospital, they took the prescription and said they would "see what they could do." 6 HOURS LATER they called me and said "we don't do that." Meanwhile, my now green, black and blue toe had swollen to twice its normal size and was throbbing to the sounds of the music in the room next door, which I could easily hear because the walls are so thin. But I have no pain medication. Ah, perfect. I was looking forward to golf, tennis and hiking in Scottsdale. After my injury, I could not do anything. you would think someone would check in on me from the hotel, no? No. I don't usually stay at Marriott Hotels. I will never stay there again. You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property / Rooms Just Okay..”
Reviews.Author: Rabu23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a few friends for my birthday. The room was really crammed, but someone cozy. We ended up sitting outside on our balcony to have breakfast in the morning (where we had views of the roof :/). The beds were extremely comfortable (which I've found to be true for all Marriotts I've stayed in). The bathroom was really nice and spacious with a separate shower & tub, with plenty of room for sharing. We had all of the regular amenities included with a standard hotel room. There was a Starbucks inside the hotel, which was nice, and a nice lobby. The grounds were what made the hotel. There were beautful pools with a lazy river, gorgeous flowers, trees, and water features everywhere, you were right on a golf course (wish I had the time to play), and plenty of outdoor seating to enjoy the views. The property was well maintained and very relaxing. I would consider going back for the grounds; for over $300/night, the rooms were ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Unlimited Golf Experience for Two From $119....HOGWASH”
Reviews.Author: Captn_Joe
Reviews.Content: I'm not writing about a stay at the hotel but their "bait-n-switch" marketing tactics. What I'm talking about is their published "Unlimited Golf Experience for Two from $119" that has been in Golf Week Magazine for the past two months or so. Whenever I call to obtain that rate they are "always booked" I get bogus replies from the operator staying that they "just booked 10 reservations" and that the $119 rate is no longer available but they can do this date at $179 (in the middle of August) or dates in Oct, Nov and Dec for $289. My question... when are the $119 dates available? Classic example of get the customer on the phone and try to get them to book at a much higher price. The $119 price is just not available. They minus well just say the rooms are free. Don't advertise something that is just not available.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed in this Marriott Property! Long but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: JRBAKER24
Reviews.Content: We chose this resort for our last night in Phoenix, (and because it was a Marriott) to end our vacation on a fabulous note (so we thought). We checked into our room, which was beautiful and had a great bathroom and comfortable beds. The TV would not decrease past 19 on the volume level, and I called the front desk to ask for help. The question I was asked was "did you try the remote?". Wow. About 30 minutes later, a maintenance man appeared and was mystified because he couldn't decrease the volume either, so he called in assistance. It could not be repaired, so we were moved to another room--this was about 1 1/2 hours after we had checked in (for only one night). The next room was exactly the same, and the TV worked. I went into the restroom to use splash water on my face and almost overflowed the sink because the stopper was broken and plugged the sink. I had to reach in to dig the stopper out, and didn't bother asking for it to be fixed because our time had already been wasted some. There are no vending machines on the property, which was an issue for us because my husband is diabetic and sometimes needs a quick soda if his sugar levels drop suddenly. **The last problem we did not discover until we were already home--when checking in we were asked for a card for any incidental expenses, which we are accustomed to, and my husband gave his debit card--now, normally we would use a credit card, but staying only 1 night we knew we would have no additional expenses. Checking our bank statement, a $210 charge was debited at the exact same time we checked into this establishment. Our room rate was only $161 plus taxes (government rate)! I called the hotel Saturday, and they said they could offer no help, it would have to wait until Monday and a separate billing department would be able to assist me. I did call them Monday, and was told by a representative that it was a "hold" placed on the funds (which renders them completely frozen until Marriott calls the bank to have them released). That's all fine and good, but we were not told that any amount would be frozen by the check-in girl, and we travel frequently and are used to giving a card for incidentals, which we normally never accrue. Our 1st 2 nights in Scotsdale we stayed at a lower star Marriott and this one could use some tips to earn its higher star rating. As stated by others, the housekeeping staff did not acknowledge us at all when we walked by, and we always make a point to speak to housekeeping in the hotels we use. We would never consider staying here again, much to our disappointment. It didn't ruin our entire vacation, but what a hassle!

Reviews.Title: “Ovwerrated”
Reviews.Author: travelmanMA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Time share villa adjacent to hotel.It was about a mile away. The hotel is one of these overpriced corporate places that caters to business travel. The time share villas are a bus ride away from the hotel amenities. There are two great although very overpriced golf courses that are best accessed by listening to a 90 minute aggressive sales pitch trying to sell you a timeshare. For that we got two free rounds..valued at almost $400 Unit was small. Sound isolation was poor. Resort had few other features . Its close to a huge mall.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Heaven”
Reviews.Author: markt3
Reviews.Content: No, I don't mean West Virginia. Visiting Scottsdale at this time of the year is just that - 'Heaven'. Temperatures are cool (40's) in the morning, but 70's by noon. The JW has everything a first class resort should have: excellent spa, 2 great golf courses, 4 super restaurants, conference rooms, banquet halls, pools and an in-house Starbucks. The room are comfortable and the beds are great, I actually slept very well on them. Service was impecciable, friendly and always helpful. We ate at 2 of the restaurants on site, Roy's, was had excellent food and Meritage, a steakhouse which had a wonderful $39 seasonal steak special. The lounge is very spacious, although somewhat noisy when crowded, but we spent a lot of our time at the outdoor fire pits in the evenings. We played the 'Palmer' golf course, which was very enjoyable and of course the desert vistas were wonderful. There is plenty of shopping and other types of less expensive restaurants nearby at the Desert Ridge outdoor mall-like area too. I would certainly return to JW Marriott Desert Ridge!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TravelTacoma
Reviews.Content: What a great place to be. The golf courses were spectacular. The service impeccable. The pool was refreshing. Definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PATravelnut
Reviews.Content: This is a very grand hotel in a beautiful desert location. The service was excellent and very friendly. The lobby was fabulous. The grounds were immaculate with beautiful plantings and many different pools including a lazy river. I was here for a convention and everything was well organized and professionally run. The rooms were very nice, but there was some wear on the furniture. The bathrooms were luxurious. My room was on the fourth floor of one of the wings overlooking the pools and mountains in the distance. Unfortuately the view was almost completely blocked by palm trees whose branches were right at the level of my balcony. I priced this hotel on a website at $500/night, but I paid considerably less at convention rates. I think this hotel is fairly priced at $300.00/night, but $500/night would be overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service I have ever had at a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Phil
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of Marriott properties, but seldom do I stay at their top tier locations. I stayed here for 3 nights during small business gathering of about 60 people. I have to say that I thought the staff was outstanding, from the bellman to the maid service. I did not make it to the pool, so I cannot comment on that. I did have quite a bit of interaction with a lot of the other staff and I found them to be absolutely outstanding..very helpful, very available and very courteous. Everybody made me feel like I was an important guest. The Palmer Golf Course is in great shape, the twilight rate was good, the carts were in great shape and the GPS worked very well. The food was very good and the bartender that worked our event (Tatiana) was one of the most personable and professional that I have seen.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Ridge”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoVacation123
Reviews.Content: Service at the pool is awful. Servers hang out at the bar and ignore the guests, stop by every 2.5 hours to see if you need anything else. They goofed up my order 40% of the time. After you beg for a menu they will tell you that they will be right back, you will never see that staff member again unless you go to the bar where you will find most of the servers watching tv and hanging out. Everything else is great. If you plan to eat, drink and spend a lot of time at the pool you have to prepare for the worst! Otherwise the grounds, rooms and the rest of the staff is great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent visit to the Marriott Desert Ridge”
Reviews.Author: JStentz
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Fantastic pools and lazy river. Very nice public areas for relaxing and having a beer. Absolutely fantastic golf course - we played the Palmer Signature course. Its worth sitting thru the time share high-pressure sales spiel for the free rounds of golf.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull Place!”
Reviews.Author: kayla_h
Reviews.Content: My stay at the JW Marriott was fantastic. The staff was always very friendly...everytime they saw you they always smiled and said hello. The hotel itself was beautifull, the gorunds were amazing, and the pools were perfect for the hot weather! (make sure to wear your sandals and dont walk on the HOT HOT pavement!!!) I did not agree with the internet fee....it should be included in the "resort fee" or in your nightly rate. Our room had a great view of the ponds and the beds were very comfy!!! So overall i highly reccomend this hotel, however some of the extra fees should be cuz to make your vacation that much more enjoyable!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly kid friendly but ditch the fees”
Reviews.Author: BettyCrocker411
Reviews.Content: Our family of three (mom, dad and 7-year-old) really enjoyed the hotel. The staff for the most part were friendly and from all over the world. We met a young man from Kazakhstan on some exchange who was working in the restaurant. My guess is that the previous reviews about unfriendly staff had to do with English not being these people's first languages. The lazy river was surprisingly entertaining. We thought we would get bored going around and around but it was very relaxing -- a combination of people watching and going on a car ride. The rest of the pool complex had a little something for everybody. Even if I had a two-year-old and our elderly parents with us, there would have been pool stuff to enjoy for everybody. Our biggest complaint was the fees. The $13 fee for internet access is ridiculous, as is the $22 fee for valet parking, the $20 fee for access to the Revive Spa fitness center, the $20 for access to the golf driving range, the $20 access to the tennis facilities, etc. The parking lots are pretty far from the hotel and in the summer heat, it is not a pleasant walk. Why is it that at the lower end Marriott (Fairfield Inns), you get free breakfast and internet access but as you move up the price range all the freebies disappear? If you're shelling out a few hundred a night for accommodation the least they can give you is a free breakfast and internet access. Any management types listening? Fortunately, we got a really good hotel, air and car package through Southwest which made all the extra expenses reasonable in the big picture.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Property, however, too big and fee structured”
Reviews.Author: dooleke
Reviews.Content: Upside: Nice pools fun for entire family. Lazy River was great! Excellent service. Nice people. Rooms good size with nice comfortable beds. Downsides Internet access fee $13/day with advertised as hi-speed was acting like dialup with 1 -2 minute per website speed. (Marriott staff refunded the fee. Again top service). $25 "resort fee" per day was choc full of hyped value savings that included internet, wow. It should have been included as standard. $25 valet parking per day. Overall very impressive property, but not practical as the 800 room size hotel really added time to getting around and the nickel and diming for everything really left me disappointed. I don't mind walking a mile through Caesar's Palace but this place is just big to be big. Marriott should include these fees in the room rate and not have to "sell" me a value package when I'm on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: maddogSJ
Reviews.Content: Wonderful visit...a true resort with numerous amenities, quality service, and stunning location.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Mixed Feelings... Really Wanted to Like it ... But...”
Reviews.Author: dreampilot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid July for six nights and seven days, four of those days attending a convention at the resort. We have a lot of mixed feelings and I have to say that if it wasn't for the great rate we got (nearly 70% off rack) because of our convention, we probably would rate this stay a lot lower. First the good... 1. Location: It is convenient to the Desert Ridge marketplace, a full service mall including a 20 screen movie theater and dozens of restaurants. The Resort runs a shuttle every 15 minutes or so to the mall. If you have a rental car - it's location is very convenient to Phoenix's highway system and downtown is only 20 minutes away. 2. Grounds/Atmosphere: well kept - and you can't beat the bunny brigade as we called it. In the late afternoons, dozens of rabbits plop on the green grass and stretch out - it's an almost surreal experience which is fun for young and old alike. There is a lot of grounds to explore... Although I have to say Orlando's JW Marriott's lazy river is much more fun, there are at least more pools to choose from. The slide would be more fun if it wasn't turned off so early 3. Rooms: Pretty typical for Marriott - which still has the best beds of most any hotel in it's tier. Bathrooms are nice and the flat screens come with full computer interface to hook up your laptops too. Patios in every room are a nice touch and big enough to host 4 friends relaxing. 4. Front Desk Staff, Concierge, housekeeping and Parking Staff were great folks and easy to talk to and represented the Marriott brand well Now the not so good... 1. Service: Outside of the folks mentioned in #4 above, We were extremely disappointed in the service by the other staff. We had better experiences with service at Motel 6 and other budget brands then some of the people we ran into here at this JW. The lounge and bar staff were completely rude, hard to get a hold of and just not very pleasant people to deal with. Our waiter at Roys and one of our waiters at the Blue Sage were the rare exception to the restaurant staff as well. If I ever stay here again - I would much rather take a shuttle to Desert Ridge Marketplace and eat over there than waste any more money at the Resort restaurants and their rude service.. 2. Speaking of staff - the lack of friendliness at the pools by staff was also very noticeable - and quite honestly for what we're paying (if it was normal rack) - we would expect a few more options poolside for drinks and snacks similar to how Orlando's JW resort runs. 3. If you like the all in one contained resort experience, I suppose you will like the entertainment options (2 golf courses, spa, etc) available - but we made more trips into Phoenix than the average guest because quite frankly, these resorts can get boring and drain your pocketbook dry. So maybe in all fairness this complaint isn't fair to direct at this JW specifically - but imo, if you plan to stay a few days here consider renting a car (AT THE AIRPORT - NOT THE RESORT - YOU"LL SAVE LOTS OF MONEY) and exploring the area more. I am not overly picky about service but the consistent attitude and not so hot service we received from the lounge, restaurant and other staff here reduced our rating a whole "star" alone. Anyway - We would recommend this resort if you get a great deal but if you're paying full rate - you'd be much better off perhaps at another one of the many, many resort properties in the area.

Reviews.Title: “No "Green" in the desert!”
Reviews.Author: melodyheard
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, the resort itself is beautiful, the spa was nice, nothing spectacular and the breakfast was good. Overall this is a nice hotel, my main problem is that they are not environmentally friendly at all. Here are a few examples: -There are about 4 different elevators to get to the same location. This is a total waste of energy. - There is no option to reuse towles. - All five of the bathroom lights are controlled by one switch. You have to turn all of them on even if you only need one. - Daily print outs of hotel activities are left in each room! - There are a gazillion pools in the middle of the desert. Sure they are nice to lounge in but its a bit much. In this day and age I just dont think it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel-Lacks attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: tmalkoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days at the beginning of July. We wanted to bring our 2 of our children to a resort with some water features. When we checked in I presented two $500 gift cards to put on our tab. I knew we would spend more than that and they need to be processed. The girl told us it would be more convenient to run them at check out. What she meant was it would be more convenient for her as they take some time to process. It was off putting to be turned down for payment up front. Also, I have used thousands of dollars of these in Marriotts across the country and have been greeted much more graciously. One of the reasons we booked this hotel was for the lazy river and slide for our kids. The pools and grounds are gorgeous. We called before our trip and were told that the lazy river and slide were open until 7;00pm both nights so we booked it. However, both nights the river and slide stopped at 6:00 even though the signs posted said 7;00. Of course, the young people working the water area leave like robots as soon as it stopped flowing and couldn't answer any questions. We were later told that the features are on timer and a supervisor did not reset it. Our suite was $400 a night and there are many nice resorts in the Phoenix area with water features and better rates who are much more alert. It felt like the staff is less on top of things because there are fewer guests. Andrea at the front desk credited us $50 for the inconvience but the experience was not optimal. On the plus side, our two room suite beautiful. The fabric and features are relaxing,upscale and the new LCD tv's were great. Another detail that fell through the cracks was the air conditioning in our suite. The kids side with the sleeper sofa was great, but our room with the king never cooled down(we set it at 60 but it was about 78) and it never went off the whole 3 days we were there. Again, management needs to pay more attention to the details. The Blue Sage restaurant on the property was great and the kids loved it. Our second night we left the pool and wanted to eat at Roys. They would not seat us because we were in our suits and cover ups. I could understand this during convention season in Phoenix. However, when it is 111 degrees, your restaurant is almost empty and there are only 2 resturants on the property that are open, it should be adjusted for the season. Again, property management should close for the summer or pay attention. Our general feeling is that this is a great corporate hotel in a beautiful setting.
