Later we met our friends in the huge and most beautiful lobby and waited forever on the patio to be acknowledged and served drinks. We decided to move inside and found a spot near the bar so our husbands could serve us rather than die on the vine. The people watching was fabulous tho- Obviously lots going on. A reception was queing up before entering their poolside designation. We noticed an entire outdoor common area had been roped off- and this was the beginning of how things were going to go - removing pool areas, lawn areas, patio areas for convention meals, receptions, MLB club members and special events. The "vacationer's" space got smaller and smaller as the weekend proceeded. All the pool's furniture filled up in the early morning either with bodies or "saved" with books and towels. Poolside service was very stressed, and there were long waits to order- and to receive orders. We watched as other guests lost patience and learned that the management had no time for regular duties as they followed up with personal apologies. I have no idea why they were so short-staffed, as the complex is designed to serve the masses. Perhaps that is the downfall, as the staff did not seem to enjoy or handle their positions under stress and there is no excuse for runnng it understaffed. We dined at Tuscany, it was fabulous and here the staff knew how to treat and please their guests and allowed us to feel like we were in Europe where it is impolite to hurry the guest along or present an unrequested check. This was our favorite meal of the entire trip! Roy's was a great environment, on patio outside. The food was also good but you will have to pay to get any amount of it, salads and accompaniments are separate. Their location is more visual to the "hotel masses" and here we knew that our table was "scheduled" for another reservation behind us. Reservations are a must, suggest later dining to avoid being rushed. The onsite Starbuck's had huge lines all mornings and usually ran out of breakfast items and popular ingredients before we got up. The hotel was full the entire time we were there, not just the weekend. We went to the spa on 2 different days: peds and manis on one visit, maggages the other. Never have we paid more for salon services, but were happy to have the use of the spa included which isn't always the norm for pedi/mani services. The massages were excellent but construction was underway next to the pool, tractors and alot of dirt and dust aloft along with the noise. There are many spas in the Phoenix area and this one dosen't come close to the atmosphere or relaxation available at JW Marriott's Camelback Inn - there is where you will find spa bliss! Our husbands golfed on site - very expensive for the quality - they are used to the Trune courses in Arizona and there is no comparrison except in fees. We were certainly paying enough and know what the resort experience should be. After a few days of not being treated as JW Marriott guest's reputation holds, we managed to get rooms in JW's nearby "real resort" Camelback Inn. This property is much older and smaller - but if you are expecting service and an relaxing atmosphere you will be treated as the most important guest that you deserve to be and would expect when staying at a resort. The Desert Ridge is a Convention Complex. All the amenities are a huge bonus and a great addition to the convention experience, resulting in positive reviews from the business traveler, and a huge dissappointment to the vacationeer! I shouldn't close without mentioning the middle of the night fire drill. The continued blaring sirens emptied bathrobed guests into hallways. I felt horrible for the parents of wailing children but the worst of it was that there was no communication. Remember, our rooms were at the farthest point, Egypt, and it was a hike with and without use of elevators towards the lobby. Since this turned out to be a false alarm it was unfortunate that staff did not send runners or use the PA system to explain the situation. They did record and deliver a phone message hours later that blamed the incident on a guest, suggesting that he was drunk in the bar and pulled down on an alarm. I don't like to quote over used phrases, but when we left the Desert Ridge I said to my friend, "Been here, Done that, Won't be back."

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: StarBellySneetch
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we noticed that the parking lot was located kind of far away, but decided to just deal with it and make the long treck to our room. It was probably smart of us to do this, because we noticed that the valet people act like vultures if you park your car even for just a minute in front of the lobby entrance. They come over to your car right away and pester you to use the valet service. We ended up doing this one night after returning from dinner, and it was a big mistake. They charge close to $25 a day for valet service, not including tip; and the valet guys (there were two of them when we pulled up) were all over us for tips, I found that to be kind of annoying. Other than the valet though, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Everything was really clean, and the hotel grounds were really nice. The room itself was great. The pool area was nice, and I enjoyed the lazy river. I also liked that they had a starbucks on site. My only other complaint besides the valet, would be that I noticed there were a lot of people staying there for business. This bothered me, because when I go on vacation, I don't want to look at people walking around in business attire, talking to each other about business stuff; the whole reason why I'm on vacation is to escape that kind of atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Relaxing Stay at the JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Togtog
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a great stay at the JW Marriott Resort in Desert Ridge. Since our stay was over Memorial Day weekend, we thought we would have some hassle checking in, etc. However, it was smooth and quick and the woman who checked us in was very pleasant. The room was wonderful with a beautiful view of the pool, golf course and desert landscape. The bathroom was a good size with a separte walk-in shower and bathtub. The service we appreciated was the nightly turn-down service which also included refreshing the towels if needed. We travel quite a bit and unfortunately have encountered nice resort hotels which have the worst sound-proofing . . . however, we slept through the night without having to endure any outside noise. Having kids, this is a plus. The pool was great and is where we spent most of our time. Being 100 plus degrees outside there were plenty of umbrellas (we had no problem finding chairs w/ an umbrella in the morning, however, it did get crowded by late morning). Also, there were staff members handing out pitchers of ice water and popsicles throughout the day. The food you can order at the pool was good and the service was quick. There is also a great kid's menu (we were not given the kid's menu and had to request it). There were a lot of activities at the hotel during our stay including a movie shown by the pool every night, a cowboy camp night with s'mores and a native american family who performed traditional dances. The fitness center could be a little bigger. If you want to go on the treadmill or do weight machines it's not a problem. If you do mat work or free weights, first of all there are no mats and secondly there is very limited space to work out. The Desert Ridge Marketplace nearby has something for everyone. There are several restaurants including California Pizza Kitchen, Rock Bottom Brewery, the Yardhouse and Macaroni Grill. Great restaurants for kids. There is also a movie theater and the outdoor mall had a lot of your typical mall stores. We will definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Memorial Day Worth Remebering”
Reviews.Author: averagefamilyguy
Reviews.Content: We had a good time here. Most of the positive reivews below are true The staff was friendly and would usually greet you or make eye contact with you if you passed by them. The hotel was well staffed during our stay over the Memorial Day Wkend. Everything was clean - very clean. The pools were great and not too crowded. There were ample activities for the kids and adults alike. We had an easy time getting a table at Roy's and the Breakfast buffett. Pool service was also very good and well staffed. We got our drinks and food FAST. The bad? Well, our 2 year old almost fell through the balcony even as we supervised. We were 5 stories up. There was enough open space between our balcony and the room next to us to allow him to slip through. I mentioned this to the hotel staff and was told they would make management aware. Be sure to check your balcony if you had kids. This 1/2 hour from downtown Phoenix and closer to the Scottsdale area. Easy drive to Talisen West. We'd consider going back. .

Reviews.Title: “Best Christmas gift ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Burg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from this JW as a Christmas gift we had given ourselves. We enjoyed this place so much, we hope to return again in August with our kids. We booked an executive suite package that included the "Cloud Room." Since we did not bring our teenagers on this trip, our daily visits to the Cloud Room were greatly appreciated as it was a holiday weekend and there was no shortage of children of every age here. Everyone was especially helpful here. We thoroughly enjoyed getting ideas and tips from Elizabeth, Concierge at the Cloud room and reviewing our day's events with Sharon in the evening. These two women helped make our weekend exceptional. The most appreciated advice was to use the spa pool since no children were allowed. We enjoyed everything about this weekend: the room, the service, the food, etc. We ate at the steakhouse and our only wish was that they would have offered smaller portions. We hope to receive the same gift next year.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge”
Reviews.Author: Mike89
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great Memorial weekend getaway. On every level this hotel scored an "A" in my opinion. I was immediately impressed by the quick check in and friendly staff. For instance upon entering my room I noticed a problem with the a/c. No worries, the staff quickly found me another room, sent up a bellman to move my luggage and to deliver my new keys all within 10 minutes. Oh and the room we got had an amazing view of the pool and golf courses. The staff also did a lot of little things you typically don't see at resorts these days. For example at the pool, employees handed out pitchers of ice water, iced towels, freeze pops, etc, etc. Hmmm, I didn't receive any ot these things on a recent stay at the Ritz Carlton in Maui! The concierge was knowledgeable, accessible and very accommodating. The rooms were always spotless and tended to multiple times per day. The bathrooms were what you would expect a 4plus star hotel to have.The balcony was clean and spacious enough to stretch out a bit. The ability to print your boarding pass in the lobby....huge plus. Starbucks on site need I say more? The golf courses although a little brown from the weather still top notch. If I were to have one complaint it would be the lack of an adult only pool. There are 5 pools on site and all of them were filled with screaming kids. Unless you're by one of the fountains you won't receive a lot of quiet time. Overall a fabulous experience...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: CNorm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at this beautiful resort for 2, all too short days, for a conference he attended May 9 - 11. While my husband attended meetings I floated in a tube in the lazy river pool (and I was certainly not the only adult in the lazy river pool). This property is absolutely stunning, gorgeous grounds, tastefully decorated rooms and a bathroom I wish I had in my own home (marble, granite and travertine). The beds were comfy, though I would have preferred firmer pillows. Neither my husband nor I found the hotel staff to be snotty or rude as another reviewer mentioned. Everyone we encountered was helpful and friendly. The concierge even gave us a much better suggestion for transportation back to the airport (and made the reservation for us as well) than what we were originally planning to do. We took SuperShuttle from PHX to the hotel for $19 p/p. A little time was wasted in making various stops within the airport to pick up more passengers and then having to stop at another hotel to drop someone off, but this is the nature of SuperShuttle. However, the driver was quite competent. But for our return to the airport we took TransStyle Limousine for $22 p/p. It's a town car that takes just 4 people. We were at the airport in 20 minutes. One other convenient (and free) perk was that you could print out your airline boarding passes at a computer in the lobby near the front desk. The computer only prints boarding passes, but for about 20 airlines. We appreciated this convenience. Food at the hotel: the restaurants are pricey, as one would expect them to be at an upscale property. My husband brought me breakfast from the spread at his meeting, but I did have lunch at the pool one day. I thought the prices were reasonable ($12 for a very large and filling spinach salad and $5 for a smoothie). I had seen other people's orders and knew, before I ordered my lunch, that the portions were plentiful. For dinner we took the complimentary shuttle to the Desert Ridge shopping/dining/entertainment complex across the street from the property (the property is large and also encompasses the Marriott Vacation Club, so the shuttle is necessary). There were many good dining choices with many price ranges at Desert Ridge. My only disappointment was some of the equipment in the fitness center. My husband and I are both gym rats, and we both love the elliptical trainer. Some are better than others and the ones at this Marriott were not good at all. Very awkward and uncomfortable to use, so ended up running on the treadmills (which were quite good and had personal TV's with complimentary earphones). Though we were here for a short conference, I would definitely consider returning for a long weekend sometime, perhaps even a sisters/girlfriends trip. It's perfect for that.

Reviews.Title: “Unreal Experience”
Reviews.Author: NaptownTraveler
Reviews.Content: You know that commercial where the weary business traveler goes to check in and the first thing the front desk does is say, "I'm sorry, it appears we have overbooked your room. We have another room it is on a different floor," and the exhausted and exasperated guy says, "Fine," and the next scene is him walking into the type of suite in "Ocean's Twelve"? You know the kind of suite you picture Julia Roberts getting? Weeeeellllll.... That's not exactly what happened to us. Okay, that's exactly what happened. We got the most pimped out suite I had ever seen! We really did not expect much because we had gotten a time share presentation invitation from Northwest WorldPerks. My wife and I were considering a timeshare, and maybe a temporary relocation to the PHX area for a year (while a friend rented our house from us, our jobs are in demand anywhere in the US, and thus our friend indirectly pays for PHX apartment), so we were intrigued, but we did not expect much for $75/night. Well it turned out after our "Great AZ Road Trip," which I chronicled under my review of the Comfort Inn Camp Verde, I was actually prepared to pay big $$$ for an upgrade. After all it was our third anniversary and I wanted to live how the other half does, at least for a few days. Well did not have to shell out for the upgrade thanks to the large Honeywell conference that took about 99.4 percent of the hotel and bumped me into a suite. Now this was no ordinary suite... Noooooo. We walk into gleaming marble foyer, with the most detailed closet with ample drawer space and plush robes. On the left is the bathroom with: Double vanity; Everything you could think to need in little baskets underneath on the shelves; A completely marble tub and seperate marble shower big enough for two and surrounded by glass; Seperate powder room with a phone in it!!!!; And marble that goes 3/4 up all the walls. Go past the bathroom and into the room (that was at least two regular Marriott suites in one) and there was: A huge TV with a nice interactive menu hidden in the TV armoire; Two bookshelves with actual books I would want to read (of course JW Marriott's book was there as well); Two leather "Lazy boy" chairs; Leather couch: Solid wood desk with a computer and internet; Large dining/board room table with eight chairs; Large wet bar (about double the size of most hotel wet bars); Mini-fridge (always how you get in my book of favorites): Safe; And king-size Murphy Bed with memory foam mattress with soft white linens. The wife and I laughed ourselves silly for about two hours and called everyone we knew. Mind you we're on vacation and people are wondering why were calling them so late (PHX was three hours behind at that time because it was Indpls's first year on EDT.) Then we got scared that they might make us move, but that never happened. They probably wouldn't but we left our do not disturb sign out 24/7 just in case. I experienced nothing but first class service while there, but then again, I wasn't really trying to get much other than a tan and tall drink. Ate in the steak restaurant once and service was above average. Expensive pool side drinks, but convenient and very tasty... er, effective! Time share presentation was very pleasant until they told me that unless I write a check for $X,0000 right then, I'd have to finance through them to buy... and the interest is 14.9%! Are you kidding me?!?! I could've bought it at 0.9% on my MC right then, but they don't take plastic. Dumb. Killed it right there and we were going to buy one. He did give us a $100 Marriott certificate though - applied it to a free steak dinner in one of their five restaurants! I had a very good filet, but it's not Sullivans. Scenery is 2nd to none. Our room overlooked a courtyard full of wonderful vegetation. My wife enjoyed here morning strolls before it got above 90 degrees. If I was an advid golfer there is no way I would miss a few rounds out here. Especially since you can sometimes get the Jack Rabbits to go after your partners ball. The only way this place would be better is if it was in Sedona, but you wouldn't want this place there because it would make Sedona too commercialized. The hotel was full of people bt did not feel crowded. The main guests with the deep pockets were Honeywell, but unlike some of the other reviews, I did not feel ignored. Housekeeping to valet, to regular attendants were courteous and acknowledged me before I had even made eye contact sometimes. The gentlman working at FedEx Kinkos was gracious enough to waive the internet fee because I was just on for literally two minutes. I think it would cost him more in his time to ring up 78 cents. Parking is a nice walk across some HOT blacktop, but I will take 115 degree heat over Indiana winter anyday. Water is something that is sold everywhere here so you're thirst is not far from relief but make sure that you are drinking water BEFORE you are thirsty. A smart tip is to go the grocery store in the shopping area across from the resort and just get a twenty four case of water. You will even appreciate warm water when it's 115 Farenheit. Pools are exceptional, but get towels early or bring your own. When I was there they were asking for hotel keys for towels, which is smart because there seemed to be some locals there who probably are not paying for these amenities. The place is so large there is not much that staff could do to keep them out. Did not utilize the spa, but definitely considered it seriously. Did a lot of exploring of PHX. Old Town Scottsdale is great. They are still building around Scottsdale and the free bus service is great, especially if you want to find a free place to park and then ride around town to several points including Scottsdale's amazing mall! The only other place I though to compare is the mall near Waikiki, but Scottsdale's mall was indoors and Hawaii's mall outdoors. Lot's of great mom and pop restaurants in Old Town Scottsdale. Wanted to try them all! Overall, I had the most enchanting experience in PHX and the JW Marriott was the crowning jewel. I hope to go back several times over my lifetime. Maybe one day I will retire there at the ripe old age of 51. Hmmm... Early retirement plan...Maybe I could be Ocean's Thirteenth - Doh! Too late.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: akamommy2
Reviews.Content: This resort was AMAZING!!! I have never seen anything like it. Of course, this was my first resort experience, but still, I can imagine that it is one of the best. The rooms were very clean. We had a beautiful balcony that overlooked beautiful scenery. Overall, it was a romantic and fun experience!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: albison23
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. Snotty, rude staff. Check in: Rude staff. Requested king bed twice. Did not receive. Husband put my name on the reservation to arrive on my own, was not on reservation, had to wait for him to arrive over an hour later. Guest parking FAR away, valet = $20 a day. Room: Nice room, it seemed as if someone was ALWAYS vacuuming outside our door! Comfy beds, upgraded linens, NICE bathroom amenities. Room service available 24 hrs a day (I believe) Grounds: much of the pool was closed, but what was open was heated (we were there in the winter, so that was a nice option) Decorated tastefully for Christmas. Event: Went for my husbands yearly work party (1,000+ people!) Event was great, staff for the event was great. Open bar staff was very nice. After event ended, resort had pay bars open in the lounge which kept guests happy. Of course, everything was overpriced, but that is to be expected : ) Check out: Same rude lady. Charged us incorrectly. Gave us someone else's bill. Not apologetic. So rude, I would NOT return to this resort. Close to Desert Ridge shopping and resturants, but area is too big and roads could not handle the traffic. Not walking distrance to anything. Overall, beautiful resort, rude snotty people. Would not return.

Reviews.Title: “I was one of the conventioners the other guy disliked”
Reviews.Author: rbuffing
Reviews.Content: My husband's company was the convention that irked the other fellow so badly. It's free for us, so maybe my expectations were lower. Strange the manager told him they don't cater to families... my 4-year-old loved the slide and lazy river. They have a kids club, but I have to say if she weren't in there with the other kids we know from the office I don't think it would be so great. The kids club doesn't use the pool until May, so it is JUST child care. Well-executed crafts, table games, etc. - but not the "adventure" the web site implies. We are from Phoenix, so a word of advice to out-of-staters... don't bake your brains out by the pool in a lounge chair with no shade. There are tons of pool areas that are underneath a grove of palm trees AND on grass. The grass makes it at least 10 degrees cooler, and less risk of sunburn. What I liked best was my spa day. The best facility I've been to in Phoenix. AND the spa pool also has the grassy, palm-shaded lounge chairs. And it was well-attended by courteous folks who will refresh your ice water or take your spa bistro order. What I liked least was the thick layer of grunge on the floor of the shower in our room. See photo. I guess they think because it's travertine you can't distinguish the gunk. I wrote the word "Yuck" with the back end of a plastic eyeshadow brush. For the kind of money it costs people who pay for the rooms, it is not too much to ask the staff to use a scrub brush. That's room 4143 if you're interested.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Ridge- Convention Hell”
Reviews.Author: traveler3311
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to treat our senior in high school with a special experience for Spring Break so we booked rooms at the JW Desert Ridge for post Easter. We had been there before so we thought we knew what to expect. The biggest problem we had was the hotel was overrun with convention folks. Hot tubs,pool decks,all day set ups were what we experienced for 2 of the 4 days we were there. Rooms are nothing special and neither is service or food at the pool. Slow and expensive would be fair to say. When I expressed this feedback to a senior manager of the property I was told that they cater to business travelers not family travel..The comments were not in line with the caring environment of the empolyees who work hard to be nice. I was left to feel that I was not important to the overall success of the operation. This is direct conflict with Mr Marriott's book and philosophies and I found that odd enough that I had to express it in this format. We wont go back to this property and I was planning to but a time share across the street for 2 week in prime time..but no reason to now that I know they focus their efforts in a way that I am not comfortable with. I am not naive to think business travel is not important to any hotel's livlehood...but if I want to be around drunk conventioners when I am with my family..I would book a lessor expensive place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: tiger12896
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend there for our three year anniversary, and also to propose to her. I only made the reservation two weeks in advance, and the website told me that only double bed rooms were available, and early check-in was unlikely (we're in the Phoenix area, so I had hoped to show up early to enjoy the pools). I went up to the resort a week before, and talked to someone at the front desk, telling them that it was a special occasion, and while they couldn't gurantee anything, they said I ought to be able to get a king bed. When we showed up, not only did we get a king bed amd early check-in, we got one of the nicest views from our balcony. The pool area is awesome, with excellent drinks. We had lunch and the following mornings breakfast at Blue Sage, with dinner that night at Tuscany. They also knew it was a special occasion, and they couldn't have been nicer, seating us at a fantasic table by the water and fountains, and giving us a complementary dessert (the dinner was awesome as well). Overall, we had a fantastic experience, and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Godd, The Bad & The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: stad
Reviews.Content: Stayed for almost a week in April. If you have small kids-DO NOT STAY AT THIS PROPERTY! Page down to the Bad & Ugly for more details. The Good: beautiful landcape scenery, outdoor speakers w/ soothing music playing everywhere, tranquil water features, attractively designed rooms/suites, complimentary laundry facility. Tuscany Restaurant and great live music( 2 guys in their 40's)Complimentary mountain bikes. Allison at Tennis Center is a gem! Fitzroy, and red hair German waitress at Blue Sage are super nice as well. Lots of pools. The Bad: Black mold & mildew in every corner and grout line of the adjoining room's shower. Filthy bathroom floor covered in hairs upon checkin. Housekeeping overall was lax for such a $$$resort. Stopped into the "Revive Spa" the 1st day to make an appt. for a $125.00 skin scrub for next morning. Made the mistake of taking one of my kids w/ me to make the appt. All of a sudden a man was standing over my child and I, motioning for us to leave. We had been in the spa reception area for all of 5 minutes!!! We were in the process of walking toward the door anyway. I wound up cancelling b/c I knew after being treated so rudely, I would not be able to "revive" there. Finally, the UGLY-and I mean UGLY: Beside shelling out a $$$$ money for the suite and joining room, we also decided to shell out even more for a passcard to the "CLOUD ROOM". They offered snacks, lite meals, drinks, web access, open bar. However, they just instituted a no kids allowed rule. That meant either parent having to go solo to the "CLOUD " while 8 yr old sat outside to help w/the carry out food; the other parent stayed in room w/other 2 kids. Never got to enjoy the view, or ambiance as advertised. Despite this, we understood and used our divide and conquer plan as mentioned above and were fine with it. Then there was the issue of me trying to take my totally asleep 2 yr old into the "CLOUD" room b/c my spouse w/other 2 kids were at the pool. I figured it would be ok since I was doing a quick snack run. I didn't think it was safe to leave her alone outside in the hall. Asleep toddler and I were 6 feet into the "Cloud" Room when "on duty " Cloud concierge person stopped me and tried to shoo me out b/c according to her, kids aren't allowed (though it is a family resort) and it's not fair to the other guests who can't bring their kids in. She spoke rather loudly, repeating herself and embarrassing me in front of the other 6-8 guests who were in there. Naturally I reacted and told her that it was ridiculous that I paid extra $$$ for the CLOUD Room, and that I couldn't stop in for 2 minutes to grab a few things to bring back to our rooms. Not once did she offer to stand outside the Cloud room and watch my baby for the 2 minutes it would have taken. As I was leaving she got infront of me pushing the Cloud Room door wide open, for all the guests to see-more humiliation for me, and said "I'm a momma too". I turned to her w/ baby in stroller and said " That's not the point " but I didnt get to finish what I was saying to her, b/c one of the male guests came charging to the door and told me I was making a scene. Of course all he could see was upsetment on my face responding to her, and not the continued snipping she was doing to me. I am 5'7", and the Cloud Concierge person was easily 5' 9" , and the guy who charged at me was atleast 6'5" tall. It was intimidating and scary to have these taller people standing over me in such an aggressive manner. And they did this to me w/ my toddler by my side. I wound up in tears at the front desk as my 8 yr & 6 yr old children walked up w/ their dad. It was awful. I didn't want to leave our suite and room after that, it ruined the last day & half of my trip. It also upset my kids to see me crying. In conclusion: If you have children younger than teen years, you are not welcome at this resort, no matter how much money you spend. P.S. The on duty manager Mr. Donough? comped us for dinner that night.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Handle the Crowds”
Reviews.Author: Rouget
Reviews.Content: April 8, 2007. My family just returned from spending Spring Break at the Marriott Desert Ridge. It is a pretty property, although surrounded by ugly construction. Our rooms were fine, quiet but overlooked the ugly construction. Problems arose on our first evening when we tried to dine at one of the resort's several restaurants. We had difficulty getting a reservation and then had to suffer long waits for service at Roy's. The next morning at breakfast, there was a large line of people waiting for a table and a long wait for service. Lunch by the pool? We waited over an hour for four sandwiches! Next morning for breakfast, the line and wait were longer (over half an hour, we were told) so we decided to try to snag breakfast at the Starbucks on the property. By 9:15 a.m., Starbucks was out of food except giant M&M cookies! We ended up getting in the car and heading to a nearby mall for bagels. We were told that the hotel was only 50% booked, yet they seemed incapable of feeding the number of people that were staying there. Other problems: crowds at the pools meant no available pool chairs for anyone arriving after 9 a.m. - yet the resort allowed people to "reserve" chairs in choice locations with towels. We had to scrounge for two chairs and then lift and move them ourselves. Meanwhile, someone had placed towels and newspapers on 7 chairs in a nice, shady location and did not show up to sit in them for several hours. When someone complained to a pool attendant, nothing was done. I would not return to this resort - next year, I'll try the Phoenician.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific resort”
Reviews.Author: cgbroderick
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is an impressive resort -- my family stayed there for four days over spring break. Though it draws a big crowd of business travelers and vacationing families and hosts lots of conferences and events, the hotel and grounds do not feel crowded because of the size and layout. The one exception -- the lazy river pool was packed when we were there. The property has five pools though so you have alternatives and our kids loved all of the pools. Highlights: It's a beautifully designed resort with a mammoth lobby; the grounds are meticulously maintained; the pool complex is a paradise for kids; the professional and courteous staff; the service; the kids programs; the restaurants, particularly Roy's. Tradeoffs: The cost is high, so if you aren't on an expense account, you need to find deals. The location is many miles north of downtown and most Phoenix-Scottsdale sites, although the 101 and 51 freeways help. You have to have a car to stay here unless you are willing to pay the high tab of cabs and exec cars. My wife and I are not golfers and we didn't do the spa, so we have no opinion on the Desert Ridge course or the spa. We would recommend this resort and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf”
Reviews.Author: mevangelista
Reviews.Content: This hotel's accomodations and ameniteis were awesome, as was the service, scenery and most of the food. The staff had it all working. Customer service at its best. Played both courses, all good. Friends ate at the steakhouse on property and said it ws excellent. Also ate at the Italian restaurant on property and it was OK and expensive. Breakfast buffett is expansive and expensive. Be prepared to have money fly out of your wallet for everything, but this is a high end, luxary resort in the desert and that is to be expected. The resort is big, 400 plus rooms so know that before you go. Also, it is located way out in n/e Phoenix on the border of north Scottsdale. Everything in this area is spread out. If you don't have a rental car, be prepared for a car service or taxi ride to Old Town Scottsdale costing between 50 and 60 dollars one way, plus tip. There are great bars and restaurants between the resort and downtown Scottsdale. Both Devil's Martini Bars were great. Dos Gringos was casual and fun and for a high end steakhouse (really high end), but absolutely fabulous for the food, decor and bar and people scene, try Drinkwater's City Hall Steakhouse in Old Town. From there you can walk to just about all the other bars and nighclubs. It was all good. Personally, I would have liked my resort to be about half the size of this one and half the distance to Old Town Scottsdale, but I was part of a golf group and it was not my call. But this place is all good, with great service. Definately 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: thedcdiva
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend at the Desert Ridge. The hotel is magnificent and the service matched it. Although we do not play golf, we found plenty to do on the vast property. Although it is extremely large, it was not hard to find a peaceful spot. We stayed in a standard room overlooking the main pool and patio. There was constant activity on the patio, but it was never noisy or bothersome. The rooms were spacious, well appointed and just plain pretty. All have a balcony, and a bath with a seperate tub and shower. The pool is really a pool complex, with several different pools and hot tub. Although the hotel was fully booked, the pool never really seemed crowded. The Spa is enourmous and seemed extremely busy, but that did not take away from the experience in any way. The treatments, were expensive but wonderfully relaxing. The restaurants we tried were quite good. We ate most often at Blue Sage, which had a great breakfast menu including a impressive looking buffet that we did not get around to trying. We also tried the Meritage Steak house which offered wonderful food and ambiance, but at a steep price. But for dinner, we usually ventured out to nearby Scottsdale. Overall, a wonderful spot and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort - great golf course”
Reviews.Author: md814
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for a company function and were very pleased. The bathrooms were large, very clean, and had plenty of counter space. We had a great sized walk in shower and separate bathub with dual sinks. The room was well spaced and had a nice view and balcony. It's nice to have a Starbucks and some other good little stores directly in the the resort. The staff was very polite, friendly and hospitable. Room service was very good. Massage was fantastic. Also, loved the convenience of the Desert Ridge Marketplace directly across the street. Try Grill Expeditions restaurant - awesome food! The Marketplace offers many restaurant choices and shopping. The resort offers 2 wonderful golf courses, and if you just want to work on your game, pay the $20 a day for unlimited range balls. My husband spent hours there not only on the driving range, but practicing his short game, as they putting greens plus sand traps and short game practice facilities. All in all, a very nice, upscale resort. Perfect for the golf/spa vacation or just to have a beautiful resort to stay in with access within minute to great shopping and restaurants. TIP: Go to the front desk and directly across from it, print your boarding pass to avoid the lines at the airport. It's a free service Marriott offers. Check in at night to avoid lines - you can do so up to 24 hrs before your flight.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Desert Ridge/Phoenix trip”
Reviews.Author: PennStater84
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at this resort (which I understand was sold the week after we left!) and was very impressed with the service, staff, and appearance. This hotel isn't near downtown so be aware there's nothing in walking distance that I could see. It was also about a 20 minute and $55 taxi ride from the airport. It was unseasonably cold during our stay (wouldn't you know - we were trying to escape the cold!) so even though the pools and lazy river were heated, they were closed because of the temps. They appeared to be well-maintained and the landscaping with markers naming the plants and trees was just beautiful. The front desk staff and all hotel staff we encountered were very pleasant and helpful. The concierge staff even created driving directions for us from point A to point B to point C and back to the hotel when we told them our tourist-y plan for my 1 free day!! We rented a car from the on-site Hertz place. We enjoyed the Frank Lloyd Wright camp tour, (Talieson West), old towne Scottsdale and Rawhide - the re-created old West town complete with fake shoot-outs. Hokey- yes, a little, but great fun and great photo opps! Looked like a movie scene. My husband and teen daughter had a great time on the Detours guided van tour to the Grand Canyon which also stopped at Sedona and a reservation and included lunch for $130. The concierge encouraged that tour group because of the cushier seats for the long drive up and back (4.5 hrs each way). There wer others that were cheaper, but I'm glad we booked this one - they got a great guide. My daughter was spouting off facts and info about plants, geology, etc for days afterwards. The hotel's free shuttle to the nearby Desert Ridge Marketplace ran every half hour or less and was very handy, since otherwise you'd need a car to get anywhere. (or go broke on taxis to get downtown) We ate most of our meals over there, since they had California Pizza Kitchen, TGI Fridays and other non-chain but similar places and the restaurants at the hotel looked expensive for our tastes. The hotel also provides internet service (not wireless in the rooms though) plus free local and long distance calls for 9.95 plus taxes a day. We enjoyed the live musicians each night in the lower lobby/bar area - very classy to a teenager and even her mom!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: JALDenver
Reviews.Content: Despite the coldest weekend in 16 years, we had a FABULOUS time at the JW Desert Ridge and barely realized that it was raining and even SNOWING in AZ! The JW did a wonderful job with service and addressing every need we had, and we were impressed from the valet attendant to the bellman to the room service! The grounds were beautiful and well maintained, and there were significant challenges given the temperature changes there. Truly a wonderful experience and would recommend this resort to anyone...that I like!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: cjjjbugs
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days while attending a conference. It is a beautiful resort with great dining. Our room was huge and beautifully decorated. They staff was very accommodating. Marriott consistently delivers.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: flyover11
Reviews.Content: This Resort was as close to perfect as you will find. From the sweeping palm tree lined entrance to the beautiful golf courses. The rooms were large, clean and quiet with excellent views. The pool areas are beautiful with large hot tubs and plenty of space to enjoy your privacy, the water was warm and clean. My husband golfed the Faldo course and had a great experience. We didn't have the opportunity to eat at the Resort, but did take advantage of the nearby restaurants. There is also great shooping nearby. We loved this resort and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Okay Resort”
Reviews.Author: kls_katidid
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort for 3 nights, Oct 8-10. The staff at this place were really great. Very kind and attentive and willing to do whatever it took to make our stay enjoyable. There was a woman who was checking in when we were checking in and it turned out she was at the wrong JW in Phoenix, so the front desk attendant arranged to have one of the resort's town cars take her to the correct hotel so she didn't have to pay for yet another taxi. That's what I call great service! We picked this hotel for three reasons: 1 - lazy river/pool complex; 2 - spa (for me); 3 - golf (for hubby). If we were attending a conference, I might have given this resort a higher rating, but as a leisure hotel, it is only okay (especially given the high price). 1. The lazy river/pool was great, but a little on the cool side and always dirty with bugs and debris swirling right around the loop with you. Pool bar/cafe food was what I've come to expect from pool bar food - expensive and mediocre. 2. The spa environment was wonderful. The facilities were beautiful, peaceful and serene and the staff was okay. The massage I received was probably the worst I've ever had, and at $150 for 50 minutes, I was hugely disappointed. 3. I'm not a golfer, but my husband was pretty disappointed with the course he played (there are two and one was closed - unfortnately I can't remember which one he played). I guess it's the wrong time of year for golf in PHX, but still, for the price he expected a lot better. Our room was nice; bedding was heavenly. Shower pressure was terrible and so I called the front desk. Within an hour, maintenance had come, removed the old shower head, located and installed a new one and the pressure was much better. There was a cockroach in our room the first morning, but it was clearly on its last leg and was the only bug of any kind we encountered in our ground floor room. We didn't eat any meals at the resort (except lunch at pool bar). There is a great mall right across the street with tons of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Love the JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: ladybug5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just love this property. The room is large, bright and just extremely comfortable with a couch to sit on and patio to see the surrounding area. The bathroom is great with a bath and shower and the service is wonderful. They have several pools including a lazy river . While staying at the hotel I received a call that my dog was in the hospital causing us to check out at 6 PM on a Saturday to return to Southern California. I expected to pay the full rate for the day and the hotel gave me a day rate of $80. I will never stay anywhere else on my stays to Phoenix in the future. Congratulations JW Marriott, a hotel that really does care about their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Rejuvenating and Refreshing”
Reviews.Author: leondrataylor
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Marriott's because of their consistency. I am rarely disappointed and this time was no acception. We stayed for three days but our main intention was to visit the Grand Canyon for a day. When I got to the hotel I could have easily forgotten about the Grand Canyon but my husband had his heart set on it. The drive was under 4 hours and both scenic as well as pleasant. However, I wouldn't do it again. Back to the hotel. The lazy river was my favorite. The grounds are beautiful and the staff courteous. We ate at the hotel only once at the Blue Sage and it was for breakfast. No big deal seeing as it's hard to screw that up. We ate and shopped in Scottsdale mostly. I barely had time to lounge at the pool but we're going back because we bought three nights at the timeshare across the street although we would prefer to stay at the hotel again. They do not have a conceirge but they did upgrade me to a pool view. The hotel is in a good location with a shopping plaza, a grocery store, pharmacy and eateries across the street. I would like to visit the JW in Scottsdale since they have all private villas. I would recommend this hotel for families although there weren't many when we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun!”
Reviews.Author: No-name-no-need
Reviews.Content: This was much nicer than I expected! We love the Phoenix area and have enjoyed stays at a lot of fine properties in the area. The property was very lovely, and the lazy river was great fun, even without the children. The pool area is so large and there are so many chairs I can't imagine not being able to find seats outside. The staff was very good. Breakfast in the restaurant was always pleasant and dinner at Roy's was great. Always a cold drink available in the main lobby. The rooms were more standard hotel styling than someplace like the Fairmont, but that said they were very comfortable, clean and well serviced. Self parking was easy, convenient and complementary. The power walk the fitness center sceduled in the mornings was not much though. Ask the concierge for a map of the local area and go on your own. Property is very large. You will do some walking. No noise heard between rooms, comfortable bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Time Share Offer”
Reviews.Author: lori a
Reviews.Content: We went there on a Time Share offer of $75/night, 4 nights, 5 days. We booked and paid for a one bedroom villa back in May of 2006. Keeping in mind that we would have to endure a 90minute sales presentation in order to get such a deal. Our friends booked in November 2006 with the same offer, or they were lead to believe so. When we arrived at the Canyon Villas our friends were told their "hotel room" was at the hotel and not a villa as ours was. We were all greatly disappionted and let the manager Adam know so. We had shared a rental car which we kept at the villa and everytime we wanted to go see them at the hotel (JW Marriott Desert Ridge) we had to valet park which was costly. I must say that the time share sales presentation of 90 minutes was the least painful one of its type we have been through. However, they killed the sale upon our arrival. The resort was beautiful as it is only 4 years old.they guys golfed the Palmer course and we ladys purchased services at the spa, used the spa pool (no children allowed) which was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: dawggirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice, attention to details in every way. I got a beautiful room overlooking the pool and outdoor lounging area but the first night the party going on down below, coupled with the neighbors (on both sides) made sleeping hard. I asked at the desk the next morning and they moved me to an exact room overlooking the entry facing west where I was able to sit on the balcony and enjoy spectacular sunsets. No noisy neighbors. Every staff person I've met - whether at the front desk, concierge, pool, restaurants, housekeeing, etc. has been exceptional. As a Marriott elite member, I got a few extra goodies such as entrance to the Spa fitness center for free. Free refridgerator on request also. The pool area is huge and easy to find a quiet place if that's your thing. Plenty of areas for families with kids too. Even the lazy river is cool. I had a spa day which was nice - the spa is wonderful; however my massage therapist acted like she could care less. Otherwise, everything else has been PRIMO!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a Marriott, but your money can go further”
Reviews.Author: rwc2theworld
Reviews.Content: So you're looking for a resort in Phoenix, right? While the JW Marriott is nice, your money can go much further in this valley of the sun. Overall, the Marriott looks good, but when you did under the surface, there's not a lot there. The spaces are big but without much character. Some of the rooms are probably very nice, but mine (for $200 per night) looked out on a concrete wall. Unbelievable, yes? Believe it. At all costs, avoid odd-numbered rooms in the 3500 wing. They all look out at the same wall. No sun. No view. Very disappointing. And then there was someone else's hair in the sink. Also very disappointing for a top end resort. Finally, the room decor doesn't really fit with the desert theme. It's more of a french colonial thing going on. For a great experience, I'd recommend the Phoenician.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice!”
Reviews.Author: cubanito1
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel even thought they were buiding timeshares right outside. I never heard any noise and the pool was fantastic!! I didnt get a chance to try the spa but I overheard a couple rave that it was pricey but well worth it. There is a mall just a mile down the road and they have eveything (just incase you dont want to pay the expensive prices at the in house gift shop. The rooms were big and the bathroom was HUGE!! Dining tip: Go to Blue Wasabi, ask the concierge for directions if you love sushi this is the place for you!! Ask to meet Fuji, he is the 1# sushi chef anywhere..and he will take great care of you. If Sushi isnt your thing then still go there. Its in this chic development of cool restaurants which include Spanish tapas, Italian just about anything.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Pasiando
Reviews.Content: Wanting to get away for Labor Day weekend. We decided to stay at the Desert Ridge. Myself, my husband along with our 6 year old son, 14 and 16 year old girls and their 15 year old girlfriend. We loved it. The pools were amazing, the kids had a wonderful time. Security to enter the pool was closely monitored with special wrist bands. Food service by the pool was excellent. We enjoy our lunched by the poolside. My husband and I went to the spa for a couples massage, the spa was top of the line. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: adrianatj
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time! I got a little worried after reading all the air conditioning problems, but we had not one problem. Everything was GREAT! We had a room overlooking the lazy river. It was so nice to look at all the beautiful scenery. This was our first visit to Arizona and this resort left everyone saying that they would like to come back again. We were there on the weekend of Sept.8 and I heard somone say that the resort was full, but it wasn't crowded at all. One of the girls had a massage and said that it was wonderful. I really enjoyed the mall right across the street, they had Target, Kohl's, Hollister, Aeropostale, lots of other clothing stores, plus tons of places to eat. If you just want a weekend to relax there is plenty to do between just the resort and the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: dje
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this "resort" for 2 days in August. Coincidentally before our stay, USA Today published an article about how great the pool area was. Perhaps this set expectations too high, as this resort was a huge disappointment. On the plus side, the grounds and overall property and design were very nice. Rooms has a garden, floral design and bathroom was huge with a nice shower. There is a nice computer system for rent in each room, and you could use it to efficiently make requests to the front desk or housekeeping (this part of the system was free). Property is also located next to Desert Ridge mall where you can find a bunch of shopping, restaurants, Target, etc. However, the resort experience left alot to be desired. The key item, as mentioned in other posts, is a faulty air conditioning system. The hallways smelled damp and musky. While the room A/C was better, it never cooled sufficiently or removed the humidity levels. Further, the pool area was awful. This could have been a result of this weekend being the most busy in the season (heard through another guest as claimed by their staff), but there were no seats, used food plates everywhere. It didn't quite live up to their Top 10 billing in USA Today. Hoping these guys will clean up their act and make this worth of the J.W. Marriott brand.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel keeps me coming back”
Reviews.Author: amzamz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend over Labor Day. YES - it was crowded but it was a holiday weekend. With that in mind, the crowds were tolerable. When I pulled up to the valet, I was asked what they could for me. When I said I wanted to drop off my bag and then park the car, I was a bit disappointed to be told to pull my car over and take the bag inside myself. Sure they were busy, but it was 104 outside and I hadn't intended to handle the bag myself. This was a repeat trip and I decided to try the Cloub Club. Not sure that it is worth the extra money though. The Cloub Club employees were exremely hospitable and went out of their way to ensure you had a fresh drink or were partaking of the breakfast, appetizers, etc. But really can a person consume $150 worth of food and drinks per day!! You do get a small gift upon arrival and a packet of stationary at departure. I spent my days at the Revive Spa which never felt crowded. I am a spa junkie and must say that Winnie gave me the VERY BEST hot stone massage. When my 80 minutes were up, I wanted to beg her to start all over! Cheryl also does a excellent facial. I noted their names and will request both of them on my next visit. If you like either of those services, you will not be disappointed. Dinner at Roy's was superb - very attentive service too. I like breakfast at Blue Sage - other meals there are OK - not great but not overpriced considering that you are in a hotel. Overall this hotel keeps me coming back - very comfortable rooms, 99% ot their employees are outstanding. Why stay anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay at the JW”
Reviews.Author: jmuemos
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Desert Ridge from August 27-31 with 6 other members of my company while attending an event they were hosting. It was a wonderful stay. This hotel is gorgeous. Beautiful lobby that has fountains, great views, marble everywhere, and free ice water and tea for you to sip when you arrive. The rooms were very spacious (I had a great view of the pool from my balcony) and the bathrooms were awesome - glass and marble shower, separate tub, big sink with lots of nice amenities, plush robe, etc. The beds were SO comfortable - I loved the soft duvet. The staff was friendly and always willing to accomodate. The grounds outside are beautiful - I highly recommend getting up early and taking a walk on some of the paths. The pools were a lot of fun! The lazy river - so relaxing! And even though this is a huge hotel - I never felt like it was that crowded! We were there for a conference - even that was done well. They have several large, very nice ballrooms and it's a great place for an event. The food that was served for our lunches and breakfast were great. As a company one night we at at Roy's and it was delicous! I also had lunch at one of their other restaurants, Blue Sage, and it was good as well. The one thing I missed out on was the spa - maybe next time! I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be back! A gorgeous resort!!”
Reviews.Author: QCTrailrider
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a Girlfriend's Getaway Spa Package for $289, which includes one night in a standard room, two 50 minute spa treatments (any ones you want), 2 Cosmopolitan drinks, 2 Starbuck's coffees, turndown service w/ 2 magazines, and a disposable camera. We changed it at the last minute to a regular Spa Getaway, which was almost the same package, but instead of the Cosmos, magazines, camera, and Starbuck's, we got 2 free breakfasts at Blue Sage, and paid $269. The resort is huge and very beautiful, with lush landscaping, gardens, water everywhere, lots of walking paths, several pools with a lazy river, and splash pad for the little kids. The spa is incredible, and mere descriptive terms do not do it justice. It must be experienced to be believed. It has a wonderful health food cafe that looks out onto a beautiful private lap pool lined with palm trees and private cabanas. There was never anyone using the pool, it seemed, and that was where we chose to spend the entirety of our second day. More on that later. Check-in was a breeze, and we got a ground floor room with double beds that overlooked a large portion of water and the Isle Of Capris. Very nice view. We were initially concerned about mosquitoes because of the proximity to water, but during our stay we didn't see one bug. The room was very nice, and the bathroom was large and well done. The only things I would change would be for the beds to be upgraded to Queen size, and I hated the sheets. They were very scratchy, and I expected that the hotel would have had softer linens. I have a very hard time sleeping in uncomfortable sheets, but the bed itself was very comfortable and had lots of pillows. The other issue I had was the way the A/C was set up. The vent was a large vertical space on the corner of one wall and only hit one bed, so one of us was hot all night and the other froze. I was glad for the big down comforter on the bed. We stayed Sunday to Monday, and on Sunday the pool was absolutely packed, but we had no trouble finding two chaises together. As soon as we even set down our bags a pool valet came up to us and gave us towels. As we sat down another pool valet appeared and gave us a pitcher of absolutely lovely filtered or bottled ice water, I'm not sure which. This was very good, because if any of you have tried drinking Phoenix tap water, it's really bad. But then we didn't see another server the entire time we were there, and we would have ordered something from the pool bar. The other review is correct in saying that some of the crowd definitely was being overserved alcohol and got pretty loud and obnoxious. We also saw one guy who was pretty raucous spill his entire drink into the lazy river. I was not impressed that you have to pay extra to get a raft to float around the lazy river, though there seemed to always be a few floating around that you could appropriate when someone left the pool. We didn't spend time at the other pools except to walk around and see what they were like, and they were nice, if set a bit close together. I loved the splash pad for the little kids which consisted of a big area with 6 deck jets aimed at the middle, and about 1/4 inch of water on the pad. No chance of drowning there! The restaurants are very expensive, though there were several to choose from with quite a bit of variety, we chose to eat at the nearby shopping center which had many more reasonably priced options. We did have our free Blue Sage breakfast, which was nothing to write home about, and arrived almost cold. We did have the option of the breakfast buffet, but we ordered off the menu. The servers will push the blue corn pancakes and say they are to die for. We thought they were pretty gross. The spa treatments were well done, and the staff was very professional. There is a required 20% tip added on to each treatment that is payable before the service, which is nice because you don't have to bother trying to carry cash around in your robe. The amenities in the spa were wonderful, and they offer everything. The layout is a teensy bit confusing and even though I spent 2 days there I still kept getting lost. On a side note, anywhere you go and anywhere you sit you will have something beautiful to look at. The hotel takes their theme of earth-water-wind-fire very seriously and incorporates into every aspect of the grounds and decor. It is just beautiful there, and I will stay longer next time and take more advantage of what the resort has to offer. Moving on, parking is $18 or 20 a day through valet. I recommend self parking, which is a little bit of a hike, but the walk to the front door is spectacular all along the way, and with everything to see it makes the walk go quickly. The valet staff is hugely helpful and friendly, and very quick to do anything you ask. The bell staff was equally nice and eager to please, as were the front desk staff, which was evident on the day we checked out. Being Elite Members of Marriott is supposed to entitle you to perks, which really don't mean that much, but the one we looked forward to was the free access to the spa for each day of our stay. We had access included anyway the first day because of the spa treatments, but we wanted to spend the day after we checked out enjoying the spa as well. We called a couple of times before we arrived to makes sure this was the case, and they said that it was. They also invited us to arrive early before check-in and use the pool and whatever else we wanted even before we were to be able to get into our room. Wow! Anyway, we checked out and went to the spa only to be told that we could use the gym, but to get a locker and robe, and to use the pool woud be a $25 charge. No way! We went back to the front desk, explained the situation, and after a minute the girl came back and told us to go enjoy our day at the spa, it was all taken care of. We found out later that the spa had charged our $50 fee to the front desk, and the hotel comped it to us. The spa told us that that was a source of contention between the hotel and the spa, and guests were usually misinformed of spa policy. What? Either way, we camped out at the pool for most of the day, we were the only two people there, and we were waited on by the servers exclusively. It was incredibly relaxing and quiet. The pool wasn't heated though, and I was too chicken to get in all the way; it was cold! Everything was great, and I will go back with my family and enjoy the hotel fully. The only other thing I have to say that is even a little bit negative is that it seemed that a lot of the staff was non-English speaking, as in mostly Russian, and we had a very hard time getting our questions answered. It was very difficult communicating with many staffers there, and if you wanted anything done or had pertinent questions you had to go to someone fairly high up on the hotel food chain, where they all spoke English. All in all I give this hotel an A-; we loved it! To break it down pricewise, we basically paid for our spa treatments, and got the room, the breakfasts, and the extra day at the spa for free. $269 total, with the spa treatments and tips being worth that, the room would have been another $115 or so, the breakfast came out to $45 including tip, the extra day at the spa, $50. Great deal, so I highly recommend taking adantage of the Summer rates; you will never know it's 110 degrees out if you are in the pool or getting a massage!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Paaltjes
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights after an extensive trip through South West USA. We only wanted to relax. This hotel is big, but we did not really noticed this because all the public areas are big too. The pool area is fantastic with room enough for everybody and a wide variety of pools. Food in the various restaurants was up to standard but not exeptional. Breakfast service was a little slow, but a lot of inexperience staff was on duty. I think the hotel is using college students in summer. We were not in a hurry so it did not matter too much, but some other guest got angry about this. The room was very nice. I always like to seperate shower. It is a nice touch to have a computer in the room. $10 for 24 hours internet access is a reasonable charge. The beds in Marriott are always superb. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still love the Desert Ridge”
Reviews.Author: michelescully
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this hotel. We had a most enjoyable time here last year and I was hopeful that it would prove to be as good this year. I was travelling with my twelve year old son so requested a room with a computer (rather than travel with a laptop) and this was granted with an upgrade to a room with a great view over the pools and mountains. The rooms are a reasonable size - with two queen beds, a spacious bathroom with shower and a balcony. We ate breakfast in the Blue Sage most days - buffet with my son paying around $9 and mine being $19.50 - a relaxing way to start the day - especially when suffering from jet lag and waking very early in the morning during our first few days in arizona. We spent some time by the pool most days and these were rarely crowded - but were noisier at the weekends when large groups of 'young (ish) men and women' would drink (a fair amount) and generally get quite loud as they turned pink in the arizona sunshine - golf parties or conference attendees - i don't know. There were many 'local' families on one occasion being allowed into the pool area by residents - you need a room key to access the pool area, they just asked if they would open the gates for them! It didn't seem to be a big problem really as the hotel pools are large and this is the off season. We ate pool side on several occasions and the food was fine - although one server over charged us on several occasions (the hotel put this right when I checked out). We had one meal (on our last day - and the server then told us that on purchasing one drink from the pool area (soft) we were entitled to refills all day (news to us) - I wonder if that will be the case next summer? - although we'd never been told this before. We ate room service often - my son prefers it, and it was usually pretty promptly delivered and generally warm. There is a 20% charge + $3 and tax added to each order - ouch! We were able to order using the inroom computer and confirm availability online - so my son was able to order the food for us this year - a nice touch. Check in and out of the hotel were easy and my special requests were met (computer and fridge). Most of the staff are attentive and helpful - always polite and friendly - the pool staff less so this year than last. We made use of the complimentary laundry service - with soap and softener provided - and left with clean clothes to finish our arizona holiday in the marriott canyon villas. We will be back here next year - we love the location, scenery and the service you get in the off-season. And as Brits we LOVE the sun......

Reviews.Title: “The best resort ever!”
Reviews.Author: luvgoodtravel
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite resort of all time! We are frequent Marriott stay-ers and this is my favorite. We love the big, wow hotels and this is one of them. The pools are great, love the lazy river and the restaurants are great as well. We always travel during Spring Break and, although it is more crowded, it is still a wonderful experience. The food at Roy's is great and this time we were there, we ate at the steakhouse at the golf course and it was great. OK, here is the best about this place-THE CLOUD CLUB. It is like a concierge lounge, you pay extra $150 a day and you get access, full breakfast in the cloud club, waters, sodas, snacks all day, internet access and a printer, open bar from 5:00pm-10:00pm, appetizers, desserts and the best service ever. We LOVE Sharon and Liz in the cloud club, they are the reason we go back to this place. It is my favorite vacation hotel, Phoenix I could take or leave but this place is great!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this resort!”
Reviews.Author: jsilva12
Reviews.Content: We stayed in mid August to celebrate our 10th anniversary. We were a little concerned based on some of the reviews. But we found the hotel exceeded our expectations as soon as we stepped into the beautiful lobby with its stunning fountains. First, we received an excellent mountain/pool view on the top floor, with a double bed and PC ($9.95 a day) as we had requested. Being August we pretty much had the pool area to ourselves. Our boys (ages 4 to 7) enjoyed the lazy river, mini water slide, and the other 3 pools. The staff was excellent and courteous. The food and drinks were pricey (like most hotel food) but good at the pool area, Blue Sage, and room service. My wife enjoyed the Spa and had no complaints about the service. It was very hot but we broke out the times in the pool to just 2 hours at a time (before 11 am or after 5 pm was best) before going back in the AC or Phoenix destination (AZ Science museum and Mesa Southwest Museum were both excellent diversions that the kids, as well as parents, really loved). We also went to the Phoenix Zoo during a cloudy day and although small, it was nice. We will be going back next year as this resort had something for everyone, especially the pool area. See attachments.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Stuff”
Reviews.Author: aeia
Reviews.Content: Well, first I'd like to start by saying that GUYS YOU ARE STAYING IN THE DESERT. THE DESERT IS HOT IN THE SUMMER. A couple days ago we reached 117 degrees! 83 degrees vs. 117. Find a cooler Travel destination if you don't like the heat. I love the heat, I am an Arizona native and I live in North Scottsdale. I go to this hotel to chill out. Honestly, I would never stay here. The gift shop staff is appalling, they used the term (--) right in front of me to refer to a co-worker who'd gone to the bathroom. But they are not affiliated with this resort. The staff of the resort itself is inexplicably friendly. I walk by in my jeans, Im not a guest, lookin all ripped up and grungy, cause I can, and they all nod and ask how I am. I admit when I was wearing my work clothes (A very very very nice ensemble.. and expensive) I was treated SLIGHTLY more friendly. That was barely though. I wouldnt stay here overnight because it's very hotel- like. I would think it should be more RESORT-like. There are hundreds of rooms crammed on top of one another. But they have free Lemonade in the lobby!!!! And a LAZY RIVER! So if you guys want to cool off hop in the lazy river and grab a glass of Lemonade. It's FREE. It's lovely, but no better than most houses Ive lived in and my friends live in. So I wouldnt stay there but the friendliness of the staff and the fact it's a great place to hang out makes it worth stopping by. Remember, guys, this is ARIZONA. You are next to DESERT RIDGE IN PHOENIX. Youll see SCORPIONS AND RATTLESNAKES. Why? Cause it's THE DESERT. Also Id like to say the best part is that there are tons of animals all over all the time, we saw baby ducks and tons of jackrabbits walking around and they arent too shy to humans either so nature lovers!

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: supastarrrrr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 2 times in the past month, once w/ the kids and once w/ the hubby. The first time I thought maybe it was a fluke, the second time was just as great. Hotel is beatiful, can't say enough. I read the reviews before the second stay and I was kind leary about staying, but who ever writes these negative reviews, are completely mistaken. The only thing that would make this place better would be if the one of the bars in the pool area would stay open after 6pm. Would definately stay again. I would never stay at the south pointe mountain resort ever again like we did at the beginning of the summer, it sucked.

Reviews.Title: “We checked out three days early”
Reviews.Author: bunky48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel often, staying at 5 star and 4 star hotels and resorts. We checked into the JW Marriott Desert Ridge on July 19, 2006 for four nights. We are NOT picky, demanding guests. When we arrived in our room it was very warm inside, but were assured it would cool down with the a/c turned on high. By 10 p.m. that evening there had been no progress and a technician arrived. Verdict : cannot be fixed. Temperature outside stll over 100 degrees. Not a problem at this point since we realize mechanical things do breakdown. Upon our request for a new room, the staff exhibited a complete lack of sensitivity to the problem, treated us in a rude manner and showed a complete lack of curtesy. In fact the first comment by the front desk was "what do you want me to do about it?", then " you will have to deal with it". Although we were eventually moved to a different room, the a/c in this facility leaves something to be desired during the peak summer months. At no time did any Marriott person offer any apology for our inconvenience or show any sense of caring. When all systems function correctly it is easy to run the ship. When problems arise, the true test of quality service starts. In this situation Marriott Desert Ridge failed. As a side comment, be sure before you stay here that you want a mega complex with all the associated large crowds, noise and a very crowded pool area with no cabanas and very few umbrellas. The main pool area has approximately twenty five lounge chairs lined up side by side and four to five rows deep. A real "meat market" set up. Also, large business groups are present with all their drawbacks to the casual visitors experience. We checked out after one night and went to the Four Seasons, Scottsdale where we thoroughly enjoyed our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Muggy rooms in the summertime”
Reviews.Author: PHX_Travel
Reviews.Content: My husband had a lengthy conference at the JW Marriot Desert Ridge the end of July. While the lobby and grounds were beautiful, the hotel has major problems with its air conditioning. We were assigned a beautiful suite overlooking the pool, and we could not get the room temperature below 83 degrees. The hotel's engineering department admitted that the rooms at the end of the halls are also at the end of their cooling "loop" and do not get adequate cooling. In addition, our lovely bathroom that was big enough to have a dance floor in it, had no vents or air conditioning supply. It was unbearable. We literally kept the door open with fans blowing the slightly cooler air from the hallway (which was still very warm) into the room. The hotel moved us to another room in the area....but same problem. We finally gave up our suite and moved to a standard room closer to the lobby and the air conditioning was at best, adequate (we kept our fan!). MANY of the conference rooms were too hot, and other rooms seemed to be cool then hot, as if the hotel was moving its inadequate cooling capabilities around. The pool areas are nice, and service was ok...beyond the seemingly unfixable air conditioning problem. If you're thinking of booking a conference/meeting at this property in the summer, my advice is don't do it. If you're just wanting to take the family for a night or two, ask for a "centrally located room" and it will probably be ok.

Reviews.Title: “A Marriott on steroids”
Reviews.Author: BaronVonH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel because of a business conference, not so much by choice, and I think we would have chosen elsewhere, if not for the business conference. The rate was quite high for the off-season, considering the level of service and the quality of the room. Maybe if I was a golfer I would have been more excited, but this resort is out on the edge of town, a 20-30 minute drive from the nightlife of Scottsdale. The hotel is big, and I think that may be part of the problem. It's very dificult to provide top service to over a thousand guests. House cleaning was quite slow and the halls seemed to be filled with maids carts all the time. We had numerous problems getting internet connections (should be better at a nearly new hotel), and the staff weren't much help. Wireless and high-speed in the room were two separate charges, for each computer. In fairness, the hotel did remove most of our Internet charges. There are several food options, quite acceptable and reasonably priced, given that this is an expensive resort. The pools are very nice, and they are generously staffed with attendants. The pool area seemed to be the most service-oriented part of the hotel. Many other folks were "going through the motions" or a little rough around the edges. This is not a Ritz-Carlton. This a very nice property, and families will enjoy a trip to this resort more than a trip to Las Vegas. But the place didn't feel that special, and I think I would have preferred to stay at one of the more established resorts closer in to the center of Scottsdale (most of which are the same price or less expensive.)

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: K3c
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice. The rooms are wonderful, the staff friendly, a vacation it iself. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Five Days of Relaxation and Pampering!!!”
Reviews.Author: shopselina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on business with my husband. Well where do I start? Upon driving in to the resort you are struck with the immeadiate immensity of the hotel. It is truly a "resort" in scale. Checking in was a bit hectic, there were a gaggle of luggage boys under the carport busily attending to peoples luggage. Getting in and over to the checkin desk was a bit harried but I think it was a busy day. They said they were at full capacity. We arrived early (around 1pm) and they had a lovely room available already. When we walked into our standard room we were surprised to see our bed covered in red rose petals. It was beauitiful. I dont know if this is standard practice for them or not, alot of other guests I spoke to did not recieve this but it was a nice touch.The bathroom was gorgeous, It was so large! It had a nice deep tub for baths and a seperate all-glass shower. The tile in the bathrooms is gorgeous but VERY slippery when wet. I think its a law-suit waiting to happen. The pools are beautiful, that is where I spent the majority of my time, while my husband was on business. There are many private corners,shady spots and umbrellas to stake out if you want to be alone. The service by the pool was unexpected. They will bring you drinks and a limited menu poolside.
