The food was great, noone I was with, was ever dissapointed in there choices. The salads could feed a small family, and at $12-14 each they should. Heres a tip: They offer a smaller managable half-size salad for $6-8 each that is still enough to fill up even a large appetite. But they wont tell you they offer this smaller size, we just found out by accident. Food and drink service poolside was a little on the slow side but the young people that were working the pool in 100+degree heat deserved a medal for that alone. Housekeeping was a bit slow, some days I would be out of my room 8 or 9 hours and come back and housekeeping was just finishing or had not gotten to my room yet. My only complaint about this goregeous place was the selection of places to eat. There is NOWHERE to just grab a low-cost meal. Even the cafe that is poolside charged $12 for a cheesburger, $12-14 for salads, and $10-12 for average drinks.(Everyone was raving about there Pina Coladas w/toasted coconut in all fareness) The restaurants I'm sure were fabulous, I only ate in the 2 that were the most affordable. You can also have drinks and a small food menu out on the large patio in the back of the hotel. ( I recommend the "Chicken Wonton-Tostada's" they were unreal....Yumm!!!) They have large upholstered furniture outside on the back patio, where you can sit and feel like your on your living room couch being served dinner. I wished I would have aten there a bit more it was so relaxing. All and all there is not much I can say bad about this place, between the mountain veiws, the gorgeous pools, the mostly prompt and couteous service, beautiful rooms, and good food it was a fantastic week. I would highly reccomend it to anyone visiting Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Kindergarten on crack”
Reviews.Author: Huneymooners
Reviews.Content: A very nice sprawling resort, however, I think every single kid under the age of 12 in all of Arizona was there!! Go the the Westin Kierland. That is where we stayed the 3rd and 4th nights of our golf trip, muuuuch better.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the hype - especially on July 4th Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Padinphx
Reviews.Content: Reading all of the reviews on this site, my wife and I decided to stay at the JW Marriott over the 4th July period, and I have to say the hype does not match the resort. OK, a nice, lavish, well decorated hotel it is, but there are many negatives. The Lazy River was not so much lazy as manic, and there were countless people smoking on rafts and drinking from brought in cans of beer - more like the Salt River than the lazy River. The hotel clearly does not splash out on air conditioning the common areas, a clear issue when it is 110 degrees. The drinks are overpriced, and the service was average - definitely nothing to amaze. I have travelled extensively throughout the world, and have never seen a valet service staffed entirely by 17 and 18 year old kids, nor been refused access to walk around the pool area as I did not have the designated wrist band on. If you are looking for a pampered, exceptionally serviced, secluded and relaxed stay, go to the Boulders in Carefree - a far superior resort, and over this weekend, $40 a night cheaper than the marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Some problems that need to be adressed”
Reviews.Author: Maxesparents
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this resort, and there are negative points that need to mentioned: 1. This hotel caters mainly to conventioneers and - especially during summer - to local families and kids by offering huge discounts. During our stay, the hotel was overflowing with kids - there must have been 600-700 every day. It is a well known "secret" that locals staying here have friends sneak in all the time for free to use the room and the pools. You can imagine the noise level by those crowds. This is definitely not a place for adults to relax. We had to change our room after three unsupervised teens started a screaming contest next door. Expect a huge unruly kindergarden, not a resort. 2. Parking: The hotel unfortunately allows its staff to use a huge part of the closest parking area. The reason is that management attempts to force you to use the valet service ($ 20 per day). If you decide to do self parking, expect long walks in 110-115 degrees. 3. Service: The food at Tuscany was wonderful (salmon/steak), the service understaffed and extremly slow. The chef de cusine came in person to our table to take our order, as she seemed to recognize the service problems. Thanks, chef! 4. Housekeeping: Has problems to get rooms cleaned in time. When returning at 3 or 4 pm, do not expect that your room has been freshened up. For someone looking for a quiet and relaxing stay, there are much better choices in the Scottsdale/Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: cm1661
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the resort in a little less than a year and the second time was even better than the first which is hard to believe considering that the first visit was spectacular as well. From the time that you drive up to the door, the staff is waiting to greet you with a smile on their face and literally sprinting to open your car door for you and then sprinting to open the lobby door as well. Our room was on the lobby level which was very convenient and the room was not your average hotel room by any means. The 5 pools on site were amazing especially the Lazy River which although crowded was a joy to float around. We stayed for 4 nights and the Vista lounge is a perfect place to sit outside in the desert air and enjoy cocktails before and after dinner. The pool restaurant Just a Splash is a great place for lunch or a snack while you sit by the pool as well. This resort makes sure you do not have to leave and who would want to, finally, enough cant be said about the nature of the staff, every single one of them was friendly, accomodating and had a smile on their face and a comment of good morning etc. I am returning in a few months for hopefully another magical stay.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible place to relax - fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: tc999
Reviews.Content: I can see why this is the #1 rated resort in Phoenix. The pool and lazy rizer are awesome, very well done. Even got a neat little waterslide. The grounds are very clean, the rooms are comfortable. Although I was there for one day, I'm thinking of returning. Walking into the lobby, there's fresh water and ice tea which hit the spot when its 100 degrees out. Staff was very accomodating, although it took until about 5:30 to check into our room when they said 4pm. And they didn't call my cell to remind me as they said they would. Little annoyance. We locked in a $160 AAA rate and was well worth it. We ate lunch by the pool which was pretty tasty. The drinks at the pool are nice and strong, but of course, you will pay dearly for it. Hard to believe its a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like celebrities”
Reviews.Author: weeniedog2000
Reviews.Content: I have been in the travel industry for almost 25 years, but was not familiar with this property. A friend from the PHX area told me about it, and now I'm ready to shout about it from the top of Camelback Mountain--"this is THE place to stay". I've been to a lot of nice places, but with all honesty, with this hotel we all felt like celebrities from the moment we stepped in the door. The employees are extremely professional and courteous. Everyone had a smile on their face, and was friendly and helpful. The hotel is beautiful, the grounds are gorgeous, and the rooms, while standard size, are very pretty and the bathroom was very spacious. We loved the pools, especially the Lazy River, and other touches including the poolside movies and the complimentary botanical walks with a local geologist. There was relaxing New Age type music playing in their botanical garden, and sometimes in their dining areas. It added to the natural setting, as did the baby bunnies, quail families, and hummingbirds that we saw on a regular basis. I would like to place golf there sometime--just not when it's 111 degrees outside. A wonderful hotel, in a nice setting. There is also a large shopping and entertainment complex nearby, so there is plenty to do. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “I did not want to leave”
Reviews.Author: aztravlgrl
Reviews.Content: I became very ecstatic about my visit to this resort when I read the reviews on this website that I felt that I had to do my own review upon return. Well, I'm back and here I am - and I have wonderful things to say about this place! I only stayed here for one night because I am a local resident.. but oh my goodness, it was so wonderful. We requested early check-in and arrived at the resort around 1pm. We were helped promptly (no line) and given the keys to our room. We were on the 4th floor (the infamous free laundry floor) and our room was non-smoking with a King sized bed. The view, even though the front desk clerk said was wonderful, was interrupted by nearby buildings. However, I said we were locals so mountain views aren't really too "new" to us anyway. The room appeared clean, except for the week-old newspaper and towel on the armoire and the broken nightstand door... otherwise everything else was fine. The bed was WONDERFUL - we slept through the night in peace. We had a spa package through the hotel - a great deal - 2 spa treatments, daily spa access, a room, and breakfast for two at the blue sage all for $289.... not bad. I have nothing but great things to say about the Revive Spa. We received a hot stone treatments and afterwards I used the sauna and steam rooms. There is also a pool in the back. Men and women are split throughout, except for the pool area and the bistro. The staff was very helpful, and there is everything a person needs to relax at this spa. There are also showers stocked with shampoo, conditioner, body wash, shave gel, razors, etc - and mouthwash at the sinks. I loved it so much I came back early this morning (yes, we came back today) to sit in the steam room. I'm thinking about going back just to spend the day there sometime in the future. Last night we ate at the shopping center across the street and had dessert at the Meritage Steakhouse. This morning we had our complimentary breakfast at the Blue Sage which was very filling (we did the buffet). We didn't have time for the lazy river, but it is basically a pool that is about three feet deep with jets to move the tubes along - great attraction for kids. The property is beautiful - even though I am from this area it really felt like a vacation. We enjoyed walking on the trails and over the bridges. The parkinig lot is far away, but if you look around the property, you might find some spaces closer to the room once you're checked in. One more thing: Even though I was there for just a night, it felt like a 3-day vacation! Definitely worth it! Anyway, go to this resort if you want a night away from the everyday stresses of life! :)

Reviews.Title: “OMG, What a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: travelfrmaz
Reviews.Content: I took the kids to Scottsdale to go shopping on Sunday and we decided at the last minute to go down the night before. We were able to get a room, a good deal in the summer too. When we arrived we were greated by the valet who took our car promptly and unloaded things for us. There were four of us in our party and the room was just a bit small but that was because the beds are small. But we were fine with that and even had a roll away brought up which was nice. We ate dinner at the golf club steak house. Nice but the service was slow a bit and they forgot a lot. It was quite expensive too and we kept feeling like we were being watched or something. You know the feeling, like everyone thinks that you dont belong there. But we ignored that and had a good meal. We swam that night in one of the pool and that was nice and relaxing. While we did that we could hear the live music playing in the patio area which made the moolight even more special. We did use roomservice for night snacks and that was prompt and good. That is 24 hours too. The bathroom was beautiful with a seperate shower and tub. Everything in marble and well stocked. The bath goodies that they give you are wonderful and we had to get some from the spa store to take home so we could have them there too. The beds are very very comfortable and I slept well. However, fitting two people on the bed if they arent children is quite hard. For two adults a King Bed would be best. In the morning we had breakfast at the Blue Sage Restr. on the grounds and that was wonderful and well priced. I will go back there over and over again to eat when we visit. The pool area is nice, however if you are going to swim at night be sure to take your own towel as there are none around the pool area that are clean. In the morning however you can find clean towels and a good place to sit around the lazy river or the pools. The service at the pools is great and prompt. We are going back at the end of the month because we loved it so much. They way that they have laid this property out is wonderful and they have decorated it beautifuly. This is the place that our family will go over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: BelieverMI
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six day vacation at the Desert Ridge Resort in Phoenix, AZ. We stayed there on a great deal through the Marriott Vacation Club package. We paid only $75 per night (for the first 4 nights). We were required to take a 90 minute tour of the Canyon Villas (on the grounds of the JW) which were beautiful. The resort is beautiful. The rooms were very clean and organized. The pool area was wonderful. There were always chairs and towels. The staff serving the pool area was constantly serving pitchers of water (free). The shopping area across the street provided additional dining options as well as entertainment. We will visit this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway... no need to leave the grounds!”
Reviews.Author: Travlin'Bug
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this resort in Dec. '05, and it was a wonderful experience... the most luxurious resort we'd ever stayed in. The grounds are immaculate and the aroma is refreshing as you stroll past the herbal gardens. The many pools are incredible, and spread out enough that couples can find a quiet spot to enjoy the Arizona weather on one side of the resort while families are enjoying the the lazy river with the kids on the other side. The views of the mountains are spectacular, and my husband enjoyed the challenging golf course. The restaurants are excellent, many on site, and there is a Starbucks in one of many halls. While we were there, a handbell choir entertained with Christmas Carols one evening; a jazz band the following night. The outdoor fireplaces are a great place to relax in the evening & staffed to serve you if you'd like a coffee by the fire. The spa is equally wonderful and it has it's own private pool reserved for spa guests... a quiet place to relax. The rooms are luxurious and the beds very comfortable; the bathrooms are beautiful and spacious. You don't have to leave the resort for anything... a very pleasing & relaxing getaway. Yet, it is a great location if you choose to venture out & shop in Scottsdale or drive to the mountains... upscale shopping & restaurants are nearby. We will definitely return again, and maybe someday bring the kids to enjoy the pools. You won't be dissappointed!

Reviews.Title: “SPA, STARBUCKS, SERVICE DOES NOT GET ANY BETTER”
Reviews.Author: websling2
Reviews.Content: This was my wife and I second stay at Marriot Desert Ridge. First visit a year ago was a 9.5 on a scale of 10. This years stay was an 11. After some small glitches with our room on our first trip May of 05, the Desert Ridge this year did more than make up for it. Great room, great hospitality, Spa, Starbucks, Roys, Lazy river, this place is hard to beat for the journey from Seattle. Attentive staff full of smiles and doors opened for you at every corner just a great experience. Spa treatments were top notch. My wife and I have been to The Grand Wailea in Maui as well as other well known spas in the Western US and this one is right up there. Many resturants inside the hotel but Roys stands out. A mix of traditional Hawaiian flavors with a mix of seafoods,steaks and other choices that make you go YUMMYYYYYY. The pools are amazing with our favorite being the lazy river where one can just float around the proporty, and let you cares melt away. The spa has an adults only pool which is nice if the kids becaome a distraction. We find May a great time to go because of the weather, but also the hotel is not packed with spring breakers. Overall just a great trip, perfect for three or four days. Lot shorter of a flight to Phoniex than Hawaii... Temps around 100 but no humidity so like 90 in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Marriot Resort”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoGolfNut
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the Easter weekend at the JW Marriot Desert Ridge Spa and Resort. This resort was absolutely fabulous. The outstanding service started the moment we arrived. It was amazing to arrive at 7:30am in morning from a flight, and have a room waiting for you. The staff was superb. Courteous, professional, and most of all, helpful. They went out of their way to ensure you had whatever you needed. The facility was superior. The pools and the lazy river raft ride were clean and inviting, especially after a round of golf on one of the two world class golf courses. The Wildfire Golf Club was truly worth the trip. We enjoyed both the Arnold Palmer and Nick Faldo courses so much that we played 18 holes on one day and 36 holes the next. The Pro Shop staff was always courteous and treated golfers to a memorable golf experience. Everything from cleaning and packing your clubs, to having your cart ready to go in the morning with your clubs already on board. We had a chance to sample all of the restaurants in the resort, all were very good. The Meritage Steak House, Roys, and the Blue Sage all served delicious food in a relaxed resort atmosphere. Especially nice was having a Starbucks right off the lobby of the hotel. More hotels should take note of that feature. Phoenix and the JW Marriot Desert Ridge Spa and Resort are definitely on all of our travel plans for the future.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise oasis in the desert”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The moment I pulled into the grounds of the hotel I was blown away by the size of the resort. Soon as I stepped out of the towncar that took us from the airport I was greeted by the wonderful resort staff who welcomed me to Phoenix. Then the bell staff took my luggage and then up to the room, along the way he was telling us about the area and what to and not do to in Phoenix. I planned a side trip to the Grand Canyon and he even told us the best way to get there. We had a standard room which was very nice for 2 people. Beautiful bathrooms are the norm. Bed is very confortable and easy to fall asleep on. We had a nice view of the grounds on our balcony and was nice just to sit out there and enjoy the weather and ambient sounds of the resort. The hotel restaurants are all great and the food is top notch. I highly recommend the butterfish at Roy's and the Salmon dish at the italian place there (forgot the name). When you get out to the main pool area (which there are a lot of different pools) you get to experience how nice the place really is. There are waterfalls, tons of desert flowers, cacti, etc to look at. There were plenty of chairs available and the area was not overly crowded at all. We were there on the weekend and you still can find a place to sit, even in the afternoon. You can sit anywhere and the staff will come by and take your food and drink order and you can eat right by the pool. The lazy river is great to get out of the hot sun and you can relax in there for hours on end just floating aournd. They even have a waterslide for the kids. I saw all different types of people, families, etc, so everyone is welcome here and kids are not a problem. They have 2 fitness centers, one where you have to pay $10 for that includes other spa services, and a free one, which I used and is better than your average hotel gym. They had 8 new treadmills, ellipitcals, free weight area, bikes, etc. Better weight machines are in the pay gym though. Golf courses are well maintained and very challenging. I do not play golf that much, but it was one of the nicest courses I have played. There are 2 and I played the Faldo one. They have a car rental place in the hotel so you can rent a car, like we did and drive to the Grand Canyon or other places. We were with a group of people who paid for our stay at the hotel, if not I am sure I could not afford the $300 plus a night. It is a bit pricy, but worth the trip. One of the nicest resorts I have ever stayed at!! The only small problem I had was there were a lot of birds flying around. Just watch your food so they do not start picking at it!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: travelerMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking surrounds, quiet, excellent attentive staff, but way too pricey unless you can get room for a reduced rate. Rooms are above average but not for the listed price. Pools and golf course excellent. Free laundromat & detergent a bonus. Convenient mall 15 min walk from resort with alternative meal choices. No convenient transport except by resort's towncar.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste you money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We requested a pool view and instead we recieved a view of constuction going on out side our balcony! When we spoke to the manager he just brushed us off and refused to deal with it! Finally after 2 days they changed our rooms to a different location not really any better but at least we didn't hear constuction going on in the morning. We didn't find the hotel to be very clean and it is extremely expensive, not worth the money. I had a drink at the pool and it was $14!!! Please keep away!!!!! NYC

Reviews.Title: “Easter fun”
Reviews.Author: denvrgal
Reviews.Content: Went for a quick getaway Easter weekend with our 2 kids. Great resort, great weather, great fun. Our kids were in the pools all day, every day. They loved the lazy river, water slide and other pools. Pool food was decent and found prices here at the pool (for food & drink) acceptable. Ate most dinners at Dessert Ridge mall across the street (since our kids don't really appreciate fine dining) which consisted of Mimi Cafe, Rock Bottom Brewery, BJs Brewery (chicago style pizza), and On the Border. There are others too, but that's some of the choices. We did eat dinner one night at the resort at Tuscany (Easter dinner) - it was just ok. There were shortages on Sat & Sun of towels at the pool - for a long time on Saturday. Also, we had probelems not getting towels in our room from the cleaning service, and then when we did, the nightime service would take them away and not replace them. I feel this was an issolated incident though and not respresentative of the overall stay. Our kids participated in the free Easter activities, which were well organized. All in all, a great place & we would return. The only thing I would change, is we had 2 beds and they were doubles, not queens. I don't see why they can't fit queens instead, they have the room and adults traveling with their kids would be more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with the Desert Ridge”
Reviews.Author: AllieBrookie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this hotel in early April for a weekend getaway for some sunshine. Our main purpose was to relax, and this hotel was perfect for that. We spent two days lounging by the pools, enjoying the lazy river (fun even for adults!) and the excellent pool-side drink and lunch service. We ate dinner at the resort two nights -- one night at Roy's and one night at the Meritage Steakhouse. Roy's was excellent and we'd highly recommend it, but we do not recommend the steakhouse. Service there was terrible and the steaks weren't that great either -- especially for the high prices. We loved the Starbucks that was on-site. It was so wonderful to have a leisurely morning, sipping our Starbucks on the store's patio and enjoying the beautiful desert botanical gardens. We found the hotel rooms to be of decent size. The bedding was wonderful and bathrooms were nice. Everything felt very new and was very clean. We wouldn't hesitate to return to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced small rooms but beautiful hotel resort.”
Reviews.Author: pwrshift
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights April 7&8, 2006. The room was about the same size (12’w x 16’) as a Holiday Inn but the rate was $450 a night. Nicely furnished with the Revive bedding but 3 uncomfortably narrow chairs. There was no place to put anything in the double room and we were tripping over each other. Even the coffee maker was hidden away in the closet. The desk had an experimental computer on it you could use for $10 a day, so that took up even more room. Even the tub was tiny, but the separate shower was OK. This is a huge hotel with 950 rooms on only 5 floors, the largest in AZ they said, so it fans out like spokes on a wheel from the lobby in the hub. Getting a pool view means you are pretty much at the end of the spokes and a long walk from the lobby where the restaurants were. We got lost a couple of times finding the room, getting to the end of the wrong ‘spoke’ and had to go back and start all over again. Everything is first class and quite impressive. Staff friendly and happy to serve. We joined the Cloud Club – like a concierge room any guest can have for an extra $150 a night per room (max. 2 people) that includes complimentary drinks in the room from 4-10 pm each day including weekends, appetizers from 5-6 pm, dessert & cordials at 8 pm, and a chef prepared hot breakfast from 7-11 am. In addition they make dinner reservations for you, as well as for tennis, spa and golf. There is only one computer to log on with and no WIFI yet (although WIFI is available in the upper lobby). Cloud Club staff are very anxious to please and is a new project started Jan. 9, 2006. It is a large very comfortable room. So that took our daily rate to $600 before taxes. Dinner one night was at Tuscany restaurant on site. It was a beautiful Italian restaurant but the service is spotty. It was the first Italian restaurant where we had to ask for bread … then had to ask for butter. From the moment we ordered drinks the waiter wanted us to give him the order – after 4 requests if we were ready we told him we’d signal him when we wanted to order. We ordered Lobster Bisque (excellent) at $8 each, Rack of Lamb (excellent) for $26 and Veal Scaloppini (ordinary) for $24. The next night we ate at Roy’s and had their price fixed $33 meal. It was very good – the chocolate explosion excellent. We found Roy's service more acceptable but both restaurants would have you outta there in 20 minutes if they could. The grounds of this hotel are outstanding.. they even have a ‘lazy river’ where you can get on a tire and float around the entire thing in about 5 minutes. Other pools are plentiful and nice. After dinner drinks outside on the patio with live music at a fire pit is dreamy. People staying at the adjacent timeshare, Marriott Canyon Villas, have full use of the facilities of the hotel too. Valet parking is $20. Self park is free but a hike – they do have a shuttle for that.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place for family trip on Spring break”
Reviews.Author: schnoodlelover
Reviews.Content: Our family took a trip to Phoenix for spring break during the week of March 25-Apr 1, 2006. I would highly recommend the JW. I took the advice of other travelers which included the free laundry on the 4th floor (even detergent is free) although only 2 washers and dryers, but still free. The poolside food was great, especially for the kids. I wouldn't recommend the cobb salad..very bland. I would recommend the quesadillas and fruit..Yum. They also have a Starbucks in the hotel which had free fruity water that was so refreshing. Spa: While we didn't use the services, we did order smoothies and food for lunch. We also used the fitness center. Much better equipment at this one than the regular hotel one. It was crowded early in the am, but by 9am thru the afternoon (I worked out at different times) it was empty. Room: we had a standard room. Not very big. We had a very comfy king bed and a pullout which was a twin. So we had to get a rollaway and fit it in between. This left for very little room. They were out of rollaways when we called but we found a maid who brought one right to us. The bath was fine, but only one sink and one plug area. Very limiting. Otherwise it was fine. Pools: My kids loved the lazy river and the main pool with the fountain. It was cool the week we went but the water was heated. There was never a towel shortage either. They have pitchers of water and cups free of charge which is great. Kids: there were tons of kids, all ages and yes, they do play continuously in the grassy area. My boys, age 10 and 7 were in heaven. We went to the marketplace (free hotel shuttle) and bought them a football so they could play all the time (what a nice perk to have Target so close). Food: We ate at Roys..very good and the kids loved their meal too. We ate at the Blue Sage for breakfast several times. Kid buffet only 6.95 but adult 18. So we let the kids eat and we ordered off the menu. Other: we went to the Grand Canyon and Sedona prior to our visit. I would recommend it. We will definitely return Scottsdale/Phoenix area: Highly recommend the Kierland commons shopping area (ate at North..yum), the Rawhide ranch area south of phoenix (old western town and steakhouse), the Science museum (good rainy day thing to do), and old Scottsdale art gallerys (gallery walk on Thursday nights). We ate at Los Olivos in old Scottsdale..great, authentic Mexican food. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “DO YOURSELF A FAVOR”
Reviews.Author: mikedoylestown
Reviews.Content: Well done Marriott. Wonderful three day stay. Great room. Dining outside. Superb staff (some interns from Germany were also exceptional) Beautiful grounds. Water? Everywhere. Pools, rivers, splashing fountains. Stunning at nite. Only downer was room ac did not work in winter. Loved it so much bought a timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “hang out in this beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: longtimeresident
Reviews.Content: If, like me, one of your hobbies is luxury hotels, you might like to see this one. The grounds and the public areas are georgeous. So many palm trees! We were there during the great weather in March, and the huge hotel lobby was open to the outside pool area, making it feel very spacious and inviting. You can sit around fire pits, near the pool, in the lobby, or back by the golf course. A great hotel for hanging out, and at these high spring prices, you want to and get your money's worth. The "lazy river" is perfect for kids. The spa is beautiful, and you can spend hours there just relaxing. Just across a street is an upscale shopping center with many restaurants and a grocery store, so it is great for families. The only thing I would not rave about are the rooms - the bathrooms are wonderful, but the rooms themselves are slightly above standard Marriott. But most have incredible views! I have stayed at many nice hotels and this is one of the most pleasant for just spending time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HockeyMomNJ
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 3 nights at his hotel for a business conference he was attending. The hotel is huge and very beautiful! The staff was very attentive although on the second day we did tell the front desk that our coffee maker wasn't working and also that we would like non-down pillows. Neither problem was ever taken care of to our satisfaction. Our room was clean and spacious - the bathroom was enormous! Had lunch one day at the poolside restaurant. Good casual food, reasonably priced. The spa was overpriced for what you got. We each booked massages. My husband was satisfied with his but I don't think I got the quality of massage that I've experienced elsewhere. There's a shuttle bus to take you to the resort condos or across the road to a nice shopping mall. Also a shuttle to take you to the airport. (Not one that you can take from the airport to the hotel, though.) Otherwise you need a car to get anywhere. Taxis turned out to be very expensive. Did not get to try out the lazy river or any of the pools since Phoenix was having unusually cold weather at the time. Overall we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvs2travel69
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went to the resort for a 4 day long weekend getaway. We took our 3.5 year old son with us and had a great time. The hotel lobby was beautiful and our room was nice, a little small but not a big deal for us because we were hardly in it. The beds were super comfortable! The hotel grounds & landscaping were beautiful and the pools were nice and heated. The location of the hotel was great. Directly across the street there were plenty of restaurants and shopping. Also, a movie theater. The restaurants at the hotel seemed high in price, again not a big deal to us because we dined at the local restaurants across the street. The hotel offers a child day camp (kokopelli) for ages 4 to 12. We were planning to let our son go for a half day but when we arrived, only 2 older kids were there and we found out that all the kids hang out together in one area. They dont have age specific activities. This may not be a big deal to some families, but my husband and I felt uncomfortable since there were no kids his age and we didnt let him stay. For the most part the staff were friendly, although we did find some of the staff to be rude & we did have one negative encounter with a valet attendant. Overall our stay was very nice and we would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: amlamay
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure that the pp stayed at the same place as me!! This place was amazing. The service unbelievable. As soon as you got there valet was waiting checking in was flawless even though we were 6 hours before check-in time. The rooms were nice but nothing "so special" for the price. But they were definatly clean. We had our 8 month old son, they had a crib in our room and a pack and play for us to carry around with us. The pools were a dream. We popped up the Pack and Play put up an umbrella and all enjoyed the day. The pool was large but had several strips and smaller pools for privacy for those of us that are not excited about how we look in a bathing suit. The service at the pool was good and drinks were $9 but you could double the size for $13.50. So $6-7 per drink which really isn't bad for a pricey resort. The concierge was amazing. They recommend two different off the beaten path restaurants that were wonderful and full of character. There are little firepits throughout the resort. We mentioned while stand at the concierge desk it would be fun to make smore's. The girl working the counter started a furious search (9PM) for supplies for us. She called the executive chef at home and asked where to find marshmallows... we kept telling her don't do this we can go to the store! She kept insisting she would find them, after waiting a few minutes we told her we would go to our room and to call if she happened upon them. She told us earlier she was off at 9:30. At about 10 we had knock on our door. We opened it, she had went to the store, after her shift, and bought us stuff to make them!! My husband kept saying, Wow there are still people like that in the world? Our whole experience was delightful! Yes... it is pricey but if you're going to spend that much this resort is awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: pmschneidau
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent two nights here for a short getaway to warm weather. My wife works for Marriott, and I stay in hotels over 150 nights a year, so we both have a good basis for comparing hotels to each other. First of all, the resort is beautiful. The gardens are immaculate and go beyond just being pretty. There is just something about a stylish building (that's only 6 stories tall) surrounded by ponds, fountains, pools, lawns, flowers, golf courses, and LOTS of palm trees. You could easily mistake this for a Hawaiian island setting. Our room was above average, overall. It was pretty big, with a large bathroom and bright walls, it was very clean, and there is a hint of some kind of flower perfume that is pleasant when you walk in. I was surprised that for $500 a night, though, that guests still have to pay $10 daily if they want internet access. You can stay at Courtyard by Marriott for under $100 w/ free internet. The pools were very warm at 86 degrees, and the Lazy River was nice and relaxing. There seems to be lots and lots of space for guests at the pools - hundreds of lounge chairs. The fitness center is great - all new equipment, including cardio w/ individual televisions, free weights, and machines. All of the hotel staff was very professional and pleasant. We ate at Roy's one night and off-property for all other meals. Roy's was nothing to write home about. We had eaten at the one in Pebble Beach, which was very good, but this one was about a 7 out of 10. We ordered the appetizer sampler platter, and everything was delicious, though pricey at $25. The entrees we ate were two of Roy's signature dishes - "macadamia nut encrusted mahi-mahi w/ lobster Cognac sauce" and soy-glazed butterfish. Both fish were cooked well and tasted good, but lacked depth of flavor. They was no explosion of flavors in the mouth. So, the meal was good, but not outstanding in my opinion. Service was very slow every step of the way, from taking our order, to getting a drink, to getting dessert (it took over 30 minutes even though we ordered the souffle with our dinner order, as recommended on the menu). They came around early on and gave us each 1 breadroll (yum!), but despite my requests for another roll, we never saw the bread guy again the entire night. There are plenty of places to eat near the hotel, if you don't want to go fancy all the time. We spent a whole day in Old Town Scottsdale. We highly recommend a sundae at The Sugar Bowl and authentic Mexican food at Los Olivos. So, I think the Marriott is a very nice hotel, but probably a bit pricey for the average traveler, espescially considering the cost of eating on-site.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I absolutely could not WAIT to leave this place. Granted I was there for a conference but still. The room was ok (but stains on carpet and ceiling) but very standard Marriott, nothing special AT ALL. The service was, with VERY few exceptions, absolutely terrible. Food was ok. Note that this hotel was built to take advantage of the HUGE conferences that take place in AZ around this time of year. Do not, and I repeat DO NOT, think about going there for a vacation. Horrible!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Scottsdale”
Reviews.Author: stonemanmb
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I stayed at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge the week between Christmas and New Years in December. We couldn't have been any happier with it. From the moment we got there, we were treated like royalty. The hotel is gorgeous, and the water/fire/earth/sky motif is just amazing. So many waterfalls and fountains around, it just feels so relaxing. After getting to our first room, we decided that since we'd be staying for a week, we would like a room with a better view, and they gladly gave us one overlooking the botanical gardens and the driving range. The restaurants are delicious, and it was a treat to sit by the pool and enjoy a margarita and the cobb salad. The golf is a little pricey ($190/round), so we decided to use the driving range each day. We couldn't have had a better time. There are so many shops in close proximity to the resort, we felt like we were in heaven. The Spa is amazing, and to fully enjoy it you need to spend the entire day there. We had lunch, sat by the pool, and got a couples massage. It was all AMAZING! The only downside was that on the day we checked out, we were awakened by a fire alarm at 4am. We had to scurry outside, and the desert air is mighty crisp that early! This is the nicest resort we have ever stayed in, and we will come back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: hazlejo
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place, my wife and I loved. I'm not going to be able to be objective in this review because I can't think of a thing that wasn't outstanding. The grounds, the lobby and the rooms are beautiful. Everyone was friendly and accomodating. There's a wonderful smell that permiates the place. They play this soft ambient music throughout the botanical garden. Our room was located on that side of the building and the smell and sounds at night set the tone for some of the world's best sleeping conditions. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was so elegant and stylish, my wife took a picture of it. The pools are beautiful, the lazy river had as many adults as kids lazing round and round most of the day. So many places to just flop and be comfortable. I'm not able to comment on the spa or golf, as I didn't use these facilities but I can tell you they were both also very pleasant to just be around. If there wasn't so many other places in the world I want to see, I'd come back to this place every chance I could. I don't think I've ever had a more wonderful and relaxing week in my life (outside of Maui).

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: bdouty
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Desert Ridge from 12/27 to 1/01. We had picked it over the Biltmore based on reviews here. It met but did not exceed our expectations. Big hotel, nice facilities but starting to show wear after only three years. Pretty crowded and noisy (Fiesta Bowl attendees) - good for families but not for couples who want a romantic getaway. Rooms nice but nothing special - beds could be improved. Service above average overall, especially in Cloud Club (but you're paying extra so it should be better). My husband is a serious golfer and gives good marks to both courses. But as a first time visitor to Phoenix, I must say I don't know what the attraction is other than the weather. Wasn't overly impressed by anything I saw there. Took a day trip to Sedona - that was impressive, especially views at Enchantment resort(and that gets spotty reviews). Tuscany restaurant meal very enjoyable, but at the Meritage steakhouse they were just about throwing the food at us. And I just wish people would learn to dress in something other than jeans in nicer resort restaurants. Nice break from Minneapolis weather, but I don't know if I'd return. My husband will, but year-round golf is the attraction for him.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay JW Desert Ridge”
Reviews.Author: cheesecake92
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed with our family for Thanksgiving weekend at the JW Desert Ridge. We had a total of 3 rooms and chose to stay at the Cloud Club level, Executive Suite rooms. Glad we made that choice - the rooms were very comfortable, large & roomy, beautiful view of the mountains beyond, well maintained and housekeeping did a very good job. The Cloud Club level was excellent. They could not do enough for us and the Cloud Club level facility was the best! Breakfast was great - they offered something for everyone and if we did not see what we wanted - all we had to do was to ask and they accomodated us. Light tastings and drinks were available later in the day and coffee & dessert in the evenings. It worked out just perfectly for our family. The staff at the Cloud Club level was outstanding - Ken, Sharon, Laura -& everyone else were unbelievably friendly. The hotel has amazing pools and the grounds are beautiful and very well kept. The lazy river pool is great fun as is the water slide. One evening they had a western singer outside with a fire going and had the children make s'mores over the open fire - it was a real treat! The food at the different restaurants were very good as were the service. Many choices to please our whole group. The only meal that we did not enjoy was dinner at Roy's. The food was good, not great - but the service was a nightmare. We all enjoyed treatments at the great spa. A beautiful facility and very well run. I like to stay at top quality hotels & definitely consider this hotel to be on my list of top quality resorts. It was a great Thanksgiving family trip and I highly recommend the JW Marriott Desert Ridge.

Reviews.Title: “Had Great Experience Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: WillieC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at JW Marriot Desert Ridge Resort for three nights in mid-November 2005. This is a beautiful resort with excellent grounds and rooms. Check in was smooth and the room we received was in a very good location, just steps from the exercise room and the “lazy river” pool, and in close proximity to the main pool and the lobby areas. The room was ground floor, with a patio overlooking gardens and the golf course. A room one or two floors higher, with balcony, would have afforded a better view, but we were happy with ours. The room was very large, with king size bed, sofa, coffee table, two chairs, desk, television cabinet, and a huge marble/tile bathroom with both tub and separate shower (glass enclosed). The bathroom amenities were top-notch. The room was immaculate when we checked in and stayed that way while we were there. The room also included a digital safe and small fridge to the side of the mini-bar. The only complaint at all about the room is that the fridge did not keep things real cold, just cool. We had a small ice chest with us so things we wanted to be really cold we just iced down. The resort is quite large and spread out, so be prepared to walk. While valet parking is offered, it is not mandatory and self parking is available. It is quite a walk from the self park lot to the room wings so people that have mobility problems should be aware of that. The exercise room by the pool area is open 24 hours and is very well equipped with state of the art equipment. It was busy while we were there, but early morning visits usually found open treadmills. The spa was very nice and offers the typical services. It also has another pool available, but one must pay a daily spa fee to use it. This might be worth it when the resort is full of kids but while we were there we say maybe 4 children. There is also another exercise room located adjacent to the spa, but it is not open 24 hours. The grounds and the public areas are very nice. There are several dining options available in the resort, as well as a Starbucks for coffee drinks. There is of course lots of out door dining space. The bars at the main pool and the lazy river offer a wide selection of drinks (reasonably priced for a resort) and a nice selection of food (also not priced too badly) and make a nice place for a pool side lunch. We ate dinner at the resort only one evening, at Roy’s, which was excellent. It was expensive but worth every cent. We both chose the fixed price menu which is good value at $33. It offers a very nice selection of Roy’s specialties served in three courses. Roy’s also has a nice wine list and offers some fairly inexpensive house wines (which were quite good) by the glass. We highly recommend Roy’s. Just outside the gate of the resort is the Desert Ridge Shopping Center which offers a wide variety of dining options and many shops. Hint: if you want to buy liquor, beer or wine to stock the room, Osco Drugs is MUCH cheaper than the Albertsons Grocery store. Marriot offers a free shuttle to and from the shopping center so you could leave your car parked at the hotel. It runs until fairly late in the evening. We really enjoyed our stay and rate this hotel as excellent. We were able to relax around the pools, have some good food and drinks, and just chill, which we both badly needed. We found nothing to complain about at all and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this resort. Our package included free breakfast which was wonderful. We had a choice between the buffet or menu items. I chose the buffet which consisted of made to order omelettes, pancakes, and waffles. There were also many other pre-prepared hot and cold items to choose from. The resort itself is beautiful and makes you feel like you're miles and miles away from home. There was live entertainment in the evenings so you could sit outside and enjoy it. Roy's restaurant is excellent. It is open for dinner only. I recommend the Blackened Ahi Tuna and the chocolate souffle. It was so good that we had dinner there two nights in a row. The pools were crowded during the day, but it was too hot for us to be by the pools during the day anyway. We used the hot tubs and pools at night which was nice since it was less crowded. The fitness center was great. I especially liked that it was open 24 hours and there weren't any hidden "resort fees" to use the fitness center. My favorite part was Revive Spa. The facility is absolutely gorgeous. Treatment includes full use of the facility which includes a fitness center, steam room, showers, jacuzzi, sauna, as well as a beautiful outdoor pool and spa. There is a cute little restaurant that you can have lunch at after your massage. We actually had lunch in our robes and slippers. There is also a relaxation room that you can enjoy before and after your treatment. I had a Swedish massage one time and a Hot Stone Massage another time. I was not impressed with the Hot Stone Massage. Mainly because my therapist took too much time to prepare the stones which took away from my massage time. Lastly, the room itself was nice, very clean and comfortable. We had a beautiful view of the golf course. This is an expensive hotel, but there are great seasonal packages. We have been to many resorts and this is one of my favorites. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: dobie102977
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Phoenix and a stay at the JW. Still conflicted on my feelings regarding our stay. My husband was out there for a conference and it just happened that our anniversary was the day after the conference ended. So I flew out a few days after he did and we just extended our stay. Overall I enjoyed it. The grounds are breathtaking! The food is great and everyone is very friendly. I really liked the location because it was located between Phoenix and Scottsdale and close to the freeway. It made getting around very easy. The staff was very helpful and always had smiles on their faces. Like I've already said the grounds are amazing. I really can't say enough about that and it really made up for the bad things (I'll get to those). There is a patio just outside the lobby that has several tables and lounge chairs with firepits and it was always the place to be in the evening and early morning. I really enjoyed taking a book and just hanging out. The pools are very nice and never seemed crowded. Okay so here are the few negatives. The pools weren't heated and it wasn't very comfortable to swim. However, this was in November. Second, I called two weeks in advance and spoke with someone at the hotel. I explained that my husband was going to be there for the conference but that I would be flying in halfway through the week for our anniversary. I told her it would be great if we could get a room with a good view and a king sized bed. When my husband got there he was put in a room with doubles. He told the front desk I would be there in 3 days for our anniversary and could they move him as soon as a king came available. So when I arrived 3 days later he was still in the doubles. We slept in seperate beds because I am 5 months pregnant and there was NO way we could both squeeze into one of those little beds. Not ideal on a romantic getaway. The next day we called and again requested a king room. We were called back around noon and were told our new room was ready and a bellman was on his way up to move us. We loaded everything up and made the trek across the hotel to our new room. When we opened up the door it was another double but the view was amazing (pools). The bellman called the front desk and explained we were wanting a king and again said it was for our anniversary. He was told which room to take us to but it was on the 3rd floor and overlooked the front drive! Not exactly romantic but we opted for the king vs. the view. This was the biggest problem we had. I know the hotel was sold out because of conferences. However, it just seems to me that someone would've thought to put more of the single business travelers into the doubles and leave the king rooms for couples. Also, over the course of a week can you really tell me there wasn't a king room with a decent view that came available. Also, my husband is a preferred Marriott reward holder. So much for rewarding loyalty that week. We did make the best of it and really enjoyed ourselves. Overall it was nice. Just a few little annoying things that keep me from giving it an "Excellent". Not sure if we'd stay again. If we knew the room situation would be better we would. However, because of the volume of conferences that seems unlikely.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely grounds and great breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: PYKZTF
Reviews.Content: Spent two days at this resort. Very clean and grounds were lovely. Got the package one night that included a full breakfast. The second night got the spa package which again included a full breakfast plus two 50 minute spa treatments. Breakfast was anything on the menu and included a buffet which was pretty much anything you can imagine-freshly made omelets, pancakes, many breakfast meats, potatoes and delicious fruit, not to mention sweets etc! It was great. We eat so well that we were not hungry until dinner. Spa was nice, facial was ok. Used the spa pool which was a bit more private.Biggest complaint was the fact I was ignored for an hour at the pool when I wanted something to drink. Every waiter didn't come near the area I was in. So strange, but I finally got someone's attention and service was fine. The Desert Ridge Marketplace was across the street and we ate our dinners there. The meals at the resort were expensive and a bit more expansive than we really wanted to eat. Starbucks on premises which was a nice touch as I like their coffee. The room is nice, nothing out of this world but comfy bed and very clean. Ask for a pool side room as they are the best. Do not get a room around the Isle of Capri unless you want to look at the most lifeless view in the resort. No color, no interest. We will try another resort on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best resorts...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at Desert Ridge on vacation and had a wonderful time. The hotel and property are beautiful. The hotel is only 3 years old and is in excellant condition. The room was great, with a large bathroom, balcony, and view of the moutains. The restaurants are very good - dinner at Roy's was a treat. Drinks are surprisingly cheap. 7 pools and an excellant spa. Palmer golf course is in great condition and 95 degree heat was not an issue. The thing we were most impressed with was the quality of the staff. EVERYONE was friendly and did a great job. They were the best staff we have ever experienced. We ate all of our meals outside and really enjoyed drinks on the patio overlooking the beautifully designed property. We highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, Nice pool, great restaurants”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great resort resort. The only drawback is it's distance from Phoenix and Scottsdale. It has several restaurants with great food choices, including Roy's. I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!!”
Reviews.Author: JULES821
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely beautiful resort. I took a solo trip to the resort in July 2005 for some much needed rest and relaxation. The rooms are clean, pretty, and nicely sized. The pool area is spectacular with 3-4 pools and a lazy river. The spa was awesome! I had four spa treatments while staying at the resort and the service and ambiance of the spa was the best (I took advantage of a great "BUY 1, GET 1 FREE" summer spa service special). An added bonus is that there is a huge shopping/entertainment/dining complex directly across the street from the hotel. I highly recommend this resort to anyone looking for a nice vacation. Do not be deterred by the fact that this hotel hosts lots of conferences. The hotel is so massive that there is enough space for everyone -- conference attendees and pleasure travelers alike!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the JW Marriott last night on Sept 6th we were there for labor day weekend. This place is really beautiful considering 106 deg weather everyday. Then again who goes to Phoenix in Aug or Sept. Hahaha The resort is huge we got lost a few times trying to find our room. Everyone in the hotel meaning The Staff, were the most friendliest people I have ever met on a vacation. Service at the pools were very good too. The rooms were very nice with a very spacious bathroom and nice size deck. We were given a garden view first but they were very helpful in giving me a pool view with no hesitation. By the way you def dont need to rent a car there is a market place accross the street. 5 dollar cab ride. They have everything you need there, restaurants, shopping, drug store, target, malls everything. If you want to go a little further like 15 minutes or so there are some really elite restaurants. I forgot the name but it was seafood and very good, pricey but worth it. My only issue was that night we got there 2:45am some kids pulled the fire alarm waking the whole hotel. Living in NY and witnesing 911 we knew to get our stuff and get right down the steps and out. The whole hotel gathered outside front and back waiting for further instructions. It took like 25 minutes for them to shut the alarm which was annoying but it was just a false alarm. It wasn't that great that all that was done was management left a notice under our doors that morning to apolize for the inconvience. Free breakfast would have been better then just a stupid note. But over all this was a beautiful place and if I came back I would definitly get out of the hotel and see more.

Reviews.Title: “Goods and Bads, but mostly goods”
Reviews.Author: jbains
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 5 days at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge where she was attending a conference. Hence, our rooms were only $125.00 night which for this place is a bargain. I am sure the low rate also had something to do with the fact that Arizona in August is brutally hot (107-112 degress) every day. Our check in was easy but was somewhat dismayed at the poor view from our room given the fact that I am a Marriott Rewards member. Our balcony overlooked...a roof. Not exactly what I was hoping for but I'll get over it. We initially had our car parked by the valet but at $20.00 per night we couldn't justify that someone else's expense so we self parked the rest of the time. If you self park be prepared to hike a distance in to the hotel. The front of the hotel is arranged like a horse shoe with parking at the lower end and the lobby at the apex. So, if you self park, wear comfortable shoes. The first night we ate at the hotel's Tuscany restaurant and I was not very impressed. The portions were small which I don't mind when the quality is overwhelming but here the quality was just average. The remainder of the time we dined on food catered by the hotel for the conference and it was exceptional. We had the breakfust buffet a couple of mornings ($25.00 each) and it was more than filling. Try the blue corn pancakes! The hotel is full of ammenities from the spa to the pool to the desert botanical garden to the golf course. The pools are big and unique and we spend a lot of the time beating the heat at the hotel's lazy river raft pool whichl, if you can get a tube away from the kids, is well worth your time. The landscaping is beyond reproach and the hotel service was typical Marriott quality. Our one complaint was that my wife's shuttle service back to the airport was piloted by a very rude gentleman who complained the entire way about having to do his job. Overall, we enjoyed the hotel. I took a day trip up to Sedona which was wonderful and very scenic. If I were going back to Phoenix I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel but it is not a destination I would base an entire vacation upon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: AndreaGIllinois
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from spending 4 nights at the Desert Ridge Marriott for a conference. Beautiful hotel and great staff! I hope this review doesn't sound negative but if we had paid the standard room rate, I probably would have been a little disappointed. We were able to check in early which was very nice so we could enjoy our first day out by the pools and lazy river. The guest rooms were decorated nicely and the beds were very comfortable!! There were a couple little maintenance things that could have been overlooked in our room but it really didn't make a difference in our stay. One of the lightbulbs was out in our bathroom and part of the shower handle was coming off the wall a little. Our room was on the fifth floor and when the bellman took us through the hallways, it was very warm. But maybe, that is to be expected in Phoenix in August. The air conditioning wasn't on in our room when we checked in so it took an hour or so to cool off. One of the things that I really thought wasn't very appealing was the carpeting in the hallways of our wing, in quite a few areas it seemed to be dirty. Inside one entrance out to the parking lot, there were dried flowers or leaves on the floor that were there the entire four days we stayed. I kinda thought that would have been cleaned up as soon as it was noticed by the staff. The lobby was beautiful and very clean though! All the beautiful marble and large windows overlooking the back of the hotel. There was always iced tea and water available to the guests. At night, it is absolutely beautiful on the grounds, torches lit along the pathways and fire pits with comfy chairs and table all over. We enjoyed our visit to the spa tremendously! The Revive Spa was a beautiful building. The private spa pool was a very relaxing place to enjoy the rest of the afternoon after our massages. If I were to suggest to anyone coming to the Marriott Desert Ridge, ask for a room other than in Wing A if you have a car. While walking out to the parking lot from this wing, you walk past the garbage area and there is a strong sewer and garbage odor there. Like I said earlier, if we had paid the standard rate I would have been just a little bit disappointed but we were really able to overlook these little issues and still had a wonderful time!!

Reviews.Title: “This JW is VERY nice! Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: iyhberry
Reviews.Content: July in Phoenix? Who goes to Phoenix in the midst of a never ending heat wave? We did and WE LOVED IT!! The hotel is beautiful. It still feels new--after three years of service. We had a large suite (Rm 4222) and decided to splurge on the Cloud Club Access--which by the way--is absolutely worth every since penny--a lovely, abundant breakfast buffet....delicious appetizers....open bar in the evenings....lovely sitting areas....the Cloud Club was our favorite feature aside from.... THE LAZY RIVER. The LR was wonderful. We spent at least 5 hours per day in the LR...sipping the Kokopelei (sp?) Cabana Coladas that the nice pool attendants were happy to deliver to our spot. It’s not five hours in the pool...its five hours of heaven....with a purpose...there is a current...there is a water slide...the lazy river made us forget that the outside temp was >110. The LR by mid-afternoon gets rather crowded (almost too crowded)...but we did not let this stop our enjoyment...rather it was noted..."The Lazy River is now crowded. Good thing we have our rafts already. Let's keep on going." We used the Spa workout area. It was nice. The regular gym had a little bit of "high school locker room smell"--which happens when people work out....but we found the Spa Gym a bit less crowded. We loved walking around the outside common areas of the hotel at night. The environs are beautiful. The torches (yes, torches in the summer) all around the main lawn. The outside lounges and restaurants and live music created a tranquil but not dull....a relaxing, lively....beautiful spot.... There were lots of kids. We were travelling without kids and were not overwhelmed by their presence. The resort is large. We did not golf or do much else besides eat and spend time in the lazy river...and we were PERFECTLY content. Overall, the service of the hotel staff was top notch. We loved our room. We did not leave the hotel for 4 days and we didn't want to....we felt spoiled every minute and will definitely be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: Reporter
Reviews.Content: Just spent four nights at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge Resort while attending a convention there. Having read all the reviews on Trip Advisor, I went there with high expectations and wasn't at all disappointed. I kept being reminded of the things other people had said, from the fresh fruit and ice water around the pool to the cool mist sprays and the delicious food and wonderful service. I especially enjoyed the music at night on the patio, and the awesome chocolate martinis. I don't want to repeat over and over what everyone else has raved about, but I have to mention how friendly and helpful the entire staff was. We were treated like royalty. The hotel is simply beautiful and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun at the Desert Ridge!”
Reviews.Author: Daisymom
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 6 nights at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge with my husband and two children (4,7). We had a fabulous time there - spending the majority of it in the pool areas. We loved the lazy river. My kids preferred not using a tube but just "free floating". My 4 year old wore a ski life vest and was able to safely float, too. The resort is very beautiful, especially at night. The many pool areas are nice so that everyone can find a pool that is their speed. One pool we called the "quiet pool" because it is off to the side a bit and was used very little. We were, however, disappointed with the poolside service. During 6 days there we always had to wave down a waiter to get them to come by. Very few servers would stop by and say, "Can I get you anything?". Once they took our first order, we would usually receive fine service. Poolside food is pretty good. Kids meals are a deal at $4 with soda, fries, and entree. My kids ended up sharing one since they were good size. The Cobb is great and huge! We were also surprised that the poolside service and bar close at between 6:00 and 7:00 pm. The rooms were spacious and nice. Our view over the front courtyard area was nice because the city lights at night were gorgeous. During the evenings we often sat out on the patio (Vista Lounge) and listened to the music, had drinks, ate off the small appetizer menu and watched our kids play for hours on the grassy area with several other children. They had a blast and it worked for us. Our overall experience was great, though I did not feel we received great service in any area. I was never told about many of the perks at resort and only knew of them because of TripAdvisor. For example, the complimentary laundry on the 4th floor, the free shuttle to the mall area, the gym, spa specials, etc. We would definitely come back to the resort with our children. For my husband and I, we might try an adult oriented resort that is more focused on service.

Reviews.Title: “All in all a great choice”
Reviews.Author: FWCOrlando
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an upscale resort that would let my wife and I enjoy some of the offerings of a resort while allowing the kids to be kids (who are 5 and 3). The JW Marriott at Desert Ridge is an excellent choice. Let me start with saying that the service personnel from check in to the poolside service to housekeeping were friendly, helpful and courteous. The resort itself is beautiful with many pools to fit whatever age group is interested. The lazy river was a nice feature for all ages. A large grass area in the center of the resort allowed kids to run and run. I saw kids playing there from morning until night. The rooms were nice and spacious and the balcony a nice touch. It allowed us to put our kids to sleep at a decent hour and continue to enjoy drinks on the balcony that overlooked the outdoor seating and band. We felt like we were part of the nightlife without having to leave the room. Once you closed the sliding door to your room is sufficiently cut out the noise from the outside. The outdoor Desert Ridge Mall which is adjacent to the Marriott property ( the resort faces away from this) was extremely convenient to access the 30 or so restaurants which offered a nice variety of prices and food choices. It even had a Target for those last minute items you did not bring (actually knowing its there we would have just bought some things when we got there). This location of Desert Ridge is north of Phoenix and convenient to 17 that allowed us day trips to the Grand Canyon, Sedona and Verde Canyon. It was 110 to 113 degrees during our trip but what they say is true, its a different kind of heat. One small negative, the view of the resort from the rooms is great but the view of nearby mountains was limited.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort Top Of The Line”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well first let me say I have been in the travel industry for awhile and I was very impressed with this resort. Beautiful grounds nice rooms, great bathrooms and very clean. I will be honest there were a couple of things I didn't like but I will factor that into it being July and a bit off season. I really hope that Marriott checks Trip Advisor at times because they have a wonderful associate (manager) who is Karen Chastain. Without her service and the time she takes with the guests I don't think this resort would be as nice as it is! As for the food I disagree with one of the reviews, I would stay with the restaurants that are staffed by Marriott employees. One of the restaurants NOT owned by Marriott or maybe I should say not staffed by Marriott employess is Roy's, so with that said you can draw your own cunclusion. I would defintly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Desert Resort”
Reviews.Author: LakersFan
Reviews.Content: June 28, 2005 - This was my first stay at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge Resort in Phoenix. Often first impressions of a hotel are formed quickly while checking in. Once again, Marriott came through with a check-in time of about 90 seconds. The associate who checked me in was friendly and efficient. I liked the fact that he asked if I wanted help to my room, which I never do when traveling alone. I lucked out getting one of the better view rooms in the resort. Room 6303 is on the 6th (top) floor and looks directly out onto the garden, stream, and pool with the desert and the mountains in the background. I made good use of the small balcony by having my room service dinner there. The room itself was about average size, but decorated and furnished very nicely. Everything was of good quality, especially the bed, pillows, and bed linens. The king bed was one of Marriott’s new “I want one of these at home” beds. They are extremely comfortable. The duvet covering the bed seemed freshly laundered. On one of the night stands was a CD player/clock radio, a nice touch. My only disappointment with the room was that there was no swiveling-tilting office-type chair. I guess it would have not fit with the décor, but I always have work to do and a good office chair is appreciated. The desk also fit with the décor, but was not as conducive to working as a true desk would be. I suspect very few visiting this resort spend much time at a desk in the room! The bathroom was great. It was large and had both tub on one side of the room and a glassed in shower on the opposite side. The lighting was excellent. There were the usual upscale assortment of amenity items, a hair dryer and a magnifying mirror. There were plenty of thick towels. It was 109 degrees when I checked in and I took advantage of the pool quickly. Actually the pool complex has three pools, each different and on a different level. There were stacks of pool towels available and I saw most guests had pitchers of ice water at their lounges. I decided to try the Lazy River pool where you can effortlessly float in an inner tube around the pool in about 10 minutes. That was great! It being summer vacation there were a lot of kids, but that was to be expected. I had room service for dinner and was impressed when the associate who took my order suggested instead of the soup of the day they prepare me shrimp chowder. She said the regular soup did not look very good. The shrimp chowder and my American Kobe Beef burger were great. It took about 25 minutes from the time I called until my dinner arrived. I also liked the fact that they said up front that a 20% gratuity was being added as well as a delivery charge. Some hotels have a service charge and I am never sure how much of that the server gets. All of the hotel associates that I came in contact with were very friendly and helpful. My room key stopped working (I took it into the pool) and instead of just giving me another key, the front desk associate came with me to my room to make sure I did not have any other problems. I had a drink at the lobby bar and the service there was prompt and very friendly. There is a lot to do at this resort. Besides the pools, there is a wonderfully equipped health club. It is next to the spa and is complimentary. You don’t have to pay to use the spa to use the workout room. There was every conceivable piece of exercise equipment you could want. Most had LCD monitors and wireless earphones. Another thing I liked about the hotel was the Starbucks. Their patio overlooked the botanical gardens. All in all, I can highly recommend this Marriott resort. The service was excellent and the all aspects of the resort are 1st class.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott Desert Ridge Resort & Spa Phoenix is an absolutly incredibal resort. there are no faults in this hotel from the mini bar in the room to the two 18 hole championship golf courses - everything is just too good for words. a short walk around this resort is an attack on the senses the lush green golf courses set on a background of desert mountains and sky;(cloudless by the way unless you're talking about marriotts simply outstanding cloud club suites) the gentle hum of music from the outdoor speakers; the smell of some of the best food you will ever taste. It is just unbelivable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.. Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptional. Everything I asked for was granted. The only suggestion I would give is to have an adults only pool built. I don't know what the guy with kids expected. The hotel was full of families this Memorial Week and the kids were happy. They had a special area for entertaining them. Kids are parent's responsibility. If you wish to travel with your spouse and have a romantic vacation, leave the kids with the grandparents or maybe go to a club Med. This hotel does give the kids great importance.. perhaps I wish there were less of them.. since mine are now adults. The kids there were happy and enjoying themselves. There was a children program, but you had to pay a fee. Again I remind parents that this hotel is not a children only daycare center.. it is a large resort and most of the time has large adult conventions.. Around Memorial weekend we had the Pediatric Nurses Convention. Food: Roy's was excellent.. Drew our waiter was fabulous as was the Manager that night.. she knew we were celbrating a 50th Birthday and gave us a quiet area in the patio overlooking the grounds. We felt as though we were in Hawaii... even had a lovely breeze. The breakfast/lunch restaurant was great also. We did utilize the Cloud Room facilities and the staff catered to all our wishes.. by the way, the chocolate chip cookies were fabulous. Also, if you wish coffee and don't see it .. ask the ladies for some... whatever you want.. ask them for it.. they were amazing. Pool: there were always chairs. We positioned ourselves by a tree facing the water way and if you wish an umbrella, ask the pool employees, they will bring one to you. I have stayed at the Westin Kierland and enjoyed it.. but this hotel was like being tucked away on vacation in an island. I loved it! PS.. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 days at the Desert Ridge. What a wonderful experience. We booked on Hotelopia.com and saved a lot of money! What a bargain we got. The service was top notch! The rooms were very nice with a lot of space and big bathrooms too. The food was pricey, but excellent and the spa was quite relaxing. We are not the pickiest people around, but we do like nice, new, hotels with high quality of service. Even though we felt the restaurants were pricey on location and the amount of food was quite small, the overall experience has us booking a trip in a couple of months. You can be comfortable knowing that the hotel is very clean, comfortable and a great place to relax. Dont pay $400 per night though! Shop around, you will find it cheeper! Enjoy - we sure did!

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough-long distance between guest rooms and conference facilities”
Reviews.Author: vmarshcpa
Reviews.Content: The room was quite nice but I would never have paid that much on my own if my employer hadn't paid for the conference. Beautiful property and close to nearby restaurants and shopping. Conference facilities were nice but only complaint was the sheer distance between room and conference facilities---took me over 10 minutes to get to and from if I walked at a quick pace. I liked having a nice view of the desert. Restaurants close a little early during the week (10:00). I was still staying in Phoenix elsewhere later in the week and drove back to check out Roy's Restaurant-Hawaiian Fusion. They were very accomodating with reservations and food was great. We loved the fire pits to relax by and it has a lot of ambiance. I wouldn't pay the high cost for the room if I were traveling for pleasure---rooms weren't THAT special so I was glad that conference rate was about half rack rate.
