Only other thing is that I had to ask three times to have my Marriott number added to my reservation---I finally got it added at the front desk after I had checked out. Valet service was friendly and reliable and was validated at Roy's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort to Relax and Rejuvenate”
Reviews.Author: Aurora100
Reviews.Content: I spent five days at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge Resort in late April. Based on what I had read on TripAdvisor.com and based on information from a person in my office who had briefly visited the resort, I had some hesitation about staying here. I knew that it was in the middle of nowhere, and I also knew that it catered to large groups. Plus, I had the pleasure of staying twice at the JW Marriott Camelback Inn, both times for a business conference. I really enjoyed the Camelback and knew the experience at Desert Ridge would be quite different. However I got offered a package deal at Desert Ridge for a price that I couldn’t turn down and just wanted to relax in the desert for a few days My first reaction was mixed. I checked in on a Saturday, and the place was busy, no doubt about it. It was hot and I was looking forward to a long swim, but the pools were crowded with kids. Plus, the one pool that seemed somewhat suitable for lap swimmers was closed for a special event. I asked the front desk if I could be comped to use the Spa pool, and they said fine. That was a nice bonus (and service proved to be excellent at the resort, during the course of my entire stay), since use of the spa facilities cost $25 at a minimum. The pool was beautiful, but I still felt it in no way compared to the spa pool at the Camelback. Despite my initial mixed reaction, the place grew on me day by day. The Desert Ridge is the largest hotel in Arizona, but to me, it didn’t feel that way. The architect did a great job of making the resort seem like a manageable size. There is still quite a bit of walking to do, but not nearly as much as some of the big Vegas hotels. The hotel was pretty full over the weekend (and less so as the week went on), but for the most part, the restaurants, pool, and area by the pool never seemed congested. There were a couple of big groups there, but they never bothered me. Rooms were quite large size and were very cheerful. The bathroom were large too, with a separate marble tub and shower. There were some quirks with the rooms: there seemed to be a waste paper basket only in the bathroom and not by the desk as well ; the shower leaked, unless you positioned the showerhead in a certain way, and there was no way to turn the light on the balcony off, meaning you had to completely close the curtains to get to sleep. But these complaints are relatively minor and in no way subtract from the great overall experience at the hotel. I only ate at the Blue Sage, the casual restaurant. Great burgers at lunch and dinner; breakfasts was good, but not great. Prices were on the high side, but I’ve seen them higher elsewhere. However, unlike a lot of other resorts, you are not locked into eating only at the overpriced restaurants on the property. A short way from the hotel is an outdoor mall with a good food court, an Albertsons supermarket, Einstein Bagels and a bunch of casual restaurants including On the Border Café and California Pizza Kitchen. This really gives a guest a lot more options, in term of food. For those without a car, I think the hotel runs shuttles to this mall, and if it’s not scorching hot, it’s probably not a bad walk. The best feature of this hotel for me was the beautiful two-level lobby and outdoor patio area, as well as the beautiful pool area. The resort was extremely conducive to relaxation. While it is true, that Desert Ridge is somewhat isolated and away from the heart of the action in Phoenix, I found it fairly easy and quick to get around by car, and since I’ve been to Phoenix many times, I preferred staying close by the hotel. By the end of my stay, I was dreading having to leave and return to the real world. In summary, I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: lswg
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 days at theJW Marriott Desert Ridge. What a great experience from beginning to end. I had used this site to conclude that this hotel must be pretty special, but must admit to being even more impressed on every level. It was not only one of the most beautiful hotels we have encountered, but also one of the most "user friendly". Huge public spaces to enjoy on every part of the outdoor and indoor areas. Groups are welcome to use grassy areas for play or simply sitting. There are also a wealth of chairs, chaises and tables in and just outside of every lobby. Family groups as well as conference groups congragated with ease. The staff was delightfully friendly and helpful. The pools beautiful! In response to some of the earlier posts, we found the area in which the hotel is situated to be most convenient. The Desert Ridge Market Place, right across the street is beautiful and its not a bad thing to have 15 extra restaurants so close by. We also found the Northern location to be a big help to cutting down on traffic when taking day trips to Sedona and the Grand Canyon.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: marciakf1
Reviews.Content: Am writing this review on last night of a seven night stay at this resort. Rooms are wonderful, housekeeping services wonderful, restaurants ( dined at all four) excellent especially Roy's. All employees were especiallygratious. Golf courses were great. Only other resort I have stayed at in past five years better than this was Four Seasons Punta Mita Mexico. Excellent shopping within 10 minutes. Can't say enough good about Desert Ridge!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort”
Reviews.Author: thsloppy
Reviews.Content: I've been very underwhelmed by other Marriott Resorts I've stayed in over the last few years ... but not here!!!. This is a fabulous resort in every manner. I'll break it down: Property ... could not ask for any more. The location is not great ... in the middle of nowhere. However, the resort itself is practically made of marble. Everything is new, spotless, impressive etc. The pool complex is absolutely unreal. We loved all the pools, especially the lazy river. The property outside impeccably managed ... full of flowers, waterfalls, palm trees etc. Always the sound of relaxing soft music everywhere, as they have speakers throughtout all the garden areas. Rooms ... Very average. Marble baths are nice. Not the highlight of the hotel. View from main building was unbelievable. All rooms have balcony's, refridgerators etc. Service ... Perfect (not too much or too little) and always with a smile. I've been to scores of resorts and hotels as I travel a lot and never felt so welcomed. Everything was right on time and to our specification. Tips seemed appreciated in return for good work, not expected. Maids, front desk, bell, wait staff, and valet all took the time to say good morning and play with our 1 year old. Recreation ... Pools are the highlight as discussed earlier. The Wildfire Golf Club has two courses, Faldo and Palmer. I thought the Faldo was OK. I'm not a fan of the overbunkered type of course. I've played better desert layouts. Everything was well maintained and in great condition though and service was outstanding. A little pricy at $150, but that does include range, cart and 6 Calloway balls. Food ... There are 4 real restaurants ... the others are really casual, patio type snack bars. Roy's was outstanding (I mean top level outstanding). Blue Sage was average / good. We didn't eat in Tuscany or Meritage but I heard both were very good. The pool bar serves great lunches ... we ate lunch there every day. The have outstanding salads (Cobb is awesome) and great wraps. We went offsite a few nights. Spa ... My wife said it was incredible. I was wondering if she would ever come back. The resort does a great job with young children. Although it does cater to business meetings, we hardly even saw them even though there was a huge one in the hotel. It is very large and plenty of space for all. Pool and restaurants not really crowded, even though hotel had high capacity. All in all ... If you want a desert vacation ... you can't go wrong here. Not as scenic as some other places (Camelback resorts, Phoenician etc.), but everything else scores highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: BESnow
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a meeting and stayed at the JW Marriott Resort and Spa. It was first class all the way. The resort was immaculate, the restaurants superb, and the golf (Palmer course) was great. This place has it all, so much so you never have to leave the property. Hope to return again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute”
Reviews.Author: amz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights & wished that I would have scheduled my entire 10 day vacation here. In general the staff went above & beyond to provide excellent service. The only exception was the staff at the concierage desk. They seemed too busy taking phone calls to deal with those of us who were standing in line,in person. This same problem occurred consistently each time I tried to use their services. Rooms were exceptionally clean; turn down service always provided. Food was great with very fast delivery to the pool areas. Food prices were typical of resorts. The fire pits were great for early morning coffee & late night drinks. Poolside - One nice touch was the availabliltiy of better quality towels than generally found poolside. Another was the free rafts to use in the pools. While you're there....do not miss the spa. One of the best ever (and I am a spa junkie!) I had a facial & massage package that were both exceptional. There is also a spa pool that is available to the users of the spa. So quiet and relaxing that you will want to spend the day there instead of returning to your room and the hotel pools. I can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott Desert Ridge Resort is an outstanding accommodation for business and pleasure. My husband and I stayed for a business conference March 30-April 2, 2005 and enjoyed it tremendously. Only about a half hour drive from airport. The hotel is just beautiful with impressive marble entry and a fountain. Our room with balcony overlooked about 5 different pools, lazy river, golf course and palm trees. Restaurants have excellent service and delicious food, especially enjoyed Meritage. The property is well manicured and pristine. Staff was friendly and courteous. Spa is immaculate and massages are wonderful. Felt pampered and rejuviated and didn't want to go home to reality. I rented a convertible from Hertz (on property) and had a great time driving 20 min. to Scottsdale and on to Tempe for a day trip. Perfect weather at 82 degrees and great time of year to visit. We don't golf but everyone we spoke to thought it was wonderful. We would like to visit again with the children, they would love the pools and lazy river. I would highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel for a meeting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here 2 nights for a meeting. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere, although there is a shopping center across the highway. It looks like a giant, sprawling pueblo. Every room has a Holiday Inn-like balcony (a small slab of concrete with 2 plastic chairs). My room was large and comfortable, with all the usual amenities such as 27" flat screen TV. The beds were disappointingly soft for a hotel of this price range. The bathroom was very large, with separate bathtub and shower stall and wonderfully plush towels. However, the showerhead was fixed, and it was impossible to properly wash your lower body. The MAJOR problem was the noise from the atrium, which came through loudly at night. Definitely ask for a quiet room that is NOT on the atrium.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, great service.”
Reviews.Author: Jannel43
Reviews.Content: We just returned from five days there and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Despite the fact that the hotel was massive and also that it was sold out, we never encountered lines or glitches in service. Also, the hotel is extremely quiet. I expected to hear the many children staying there (including ours!), but I just didn't. Also the onsite restaurants were all very good and while Roy's was always packed, the steakhouse and the fine Italian place were nearly empty and still served exceptional food. The service was flawless everywhere. On the negative side, we were able to get one standard room (tried to get a second one, but it was too late), and the four of us were packed in like sardines. The trundle bed which was brought in was quite comfortable, but took up valuable living space. The bathroom was huge -- maybe we should have put the trundle bed in there! Secondly, this hotel is remote. We nearly broke the bank being driven to spring training baseball games and the airport. While we loved this resort, if we returned to Phoenix for spring training we would definitely search for a more centrally located property.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: travelerof3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in early March for a long weekend and thoroughly enjoyed every part of the hotel. We stayed in the Club Cloud which is definitely worth the money! Free breakfast (and we're not talking muffins and bagels,) free wine and cheese and dessert every evening. Also, open bar from 4-10pm. Very nice and relaxing. The staff was great and had wonderful recommendations for what to do, where to go, and where to eat. Elizabeth was very helpful and always made a point of remembering our name and asking us about our day even though she was busy helping other people. Everything was great. The only complaint I had was the bed. It was hard as a rock. I woke up with a back ache every morning. If they could have put the Westin Heavenly Bed in here, it would have been perfect. Everything else about the room was great. The bathroom was huge and the ammenities were good. The spa was very relaxing. They treated you like a queen or king. We made our reservation a week before going since we had read on here that some people had a hard time getting a reservation at the last minute. The spa bistro had great food and everything was very relaxing. This place is definitely worth the money. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: montebello
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in early Feb 2005 and thoroughly enjoyed this property. We had a suite with a murphy bed and it was great . staff did all they could to please and food was also good. Played both golf courses with much enjoyment. Definitely will return again in April with our 10 year old daughter who will enjoy the fabulous pools.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: debbie35
Reviews.Content: This property is good if you're traveling for business, but there are many other more luxurious properties in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area if you're on a real vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I and my wife stayed at the JW Desert Ridge for 2 nights during the thanksgiving break and had a great time. They gave us a room overlooking the pool and the mountain preserve (a room on the south side will get you this) and it was simply beautiful. The service is impeccable, the house keeprs won't bother you until late, the servers by the pool are always hospitable and there to bring you anything you want. I'd highly recommend this Hotel and if we ever go back to Phoenix we know where we are going back to stay. BTW, the Hotel is also quite kid friendly (we were surpised to see quite a few kids enjoying the "lazy river". The pools were very clean though a bit cold (despite the water being at 82), so we used the 2 outdoor jacuzzis instead. During the evenings, the patio has beautiful outdoor fireplaces where guests mingle and there is live music. All in all, it was a wonderful experience. The view in the evenings of the tall Palms and the outdoor Patio is incredible. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “5 star... I don't think so.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If your a true user of 5 star Luxury Resorts such as Four Seasons and Ritz Carltons, then you'll be disappointed in this one. Just got back from this resort (Nov. 2004) and booked it because of the reviews on line, but very disappointed all around. Rooms are average and the bathroom after reading the reviews was very disappointing. Only one sink and not very large at that. Eventhough there is a sperate shower stall, it was so on top of the toilet that when you opened the shower door you just miss the toilet by about 2 inches. One day I had the call front desk to get my room cleaned. This was after 2:00 pm the day after I checked in. I was told they were busy because a lot of guest checked out and new ones were arriving and they needed to turn over the rooms. So I quess that means I was put on the back burner since I was already checked in. Staff were ok, but not 5 star helpful or even 5 star friendly. Beware major conventioneers at this hotel. In fact the week I was there the hotel was 95% booked and probably 80% of quest were there on conventions. They litterly take over the hotel. One night the only lobby lounge in the hotel was taken over by these conventioneers and there was no place to sit and have a quite drink. Also a hugh TV screen was brought in so all the "men" could watch Monday night football, for which they proceeded to behave as typical male's would during a football game. I think you know what I mean. Another evening most of the pool area and hot tub section was closed off for a private convention dinner party. This type of service would not happen in a true 5 star resort. The Marriott is trying to match the Ritz Carltons and Four Seasons, but are falling short. Remimber conventioneers do not pay out of their pockets for these trips, their corporations do. They could care less about your hard earned vacation. All in all not worty of a 5 star rating. Spend a couple of dollars more and stay at the Phoenician or Four Seasons. Much more worth your hard earn dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulously Relaxing Retreat.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visited this glorious hotel in early October 2004 with two girlfriends (we are all in our early to mid twenties) from NYC. Although we are all well-traveled internationally, we had never thought of a domestic trip. However, with tight work schedules affording us only four nights to play, and looming hurricanes along the Atlantic Coast, finding this hotel was a terrific accident. We arrived exhausted on Thursday night, and were all pleasantly surprised over the extremely conformable beds and down comforters that awaited us. The bathroom was tremendous, and the products were all from the spa (ah the revive lotion!) For the days we were there, we awoke early (since we were still on EST) and took full advantage of the desert botanical tour, the Starbucks and other morning activities offered by the hotel. Days were spent poolside, and we enjoyed the food of the pool bar, as well as the Jamaican steel drums that lulled in the background. Evenings we would decide upon a restaurant and events over a glass of wine while listening to the live music around the fire pit. Everything was new, clean and gorgeous. The concierge desk was very helpful in lending restaurant recommendations, and providing directions to everywhere you could imagine. Although we had initially planned to divulge in a spa service, none of us wanted to leave the beautiful outdoors and all passed. We rented a car and found it convenient to drive and find our way around. It was a fabulously relaxing retreat, and we have all pledged to return with our boyfriends!

Reviews.Title: “A great resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a quick 3 night stay (10/7-10/10 at this resort. We had reserved two rooms and requested connecting rooms via email and also by fax, but upon check in they said they hadn't taken care of it. They were apologetic and Roxanne said she would take care of it the next morning. She came through (Thanks Roxanne!) and the next day we had connecting rooms of which one was the standard deluxe room connected to a luxury suite which was perfect for our family. This is a great time of year, the weather was still in the high 90's but the crowded pools I've read about in previous reviews was non-existent on both Thursday and Friday. Saturday there were more people around the pools but there was plenty of room to sit wherever you wanted and hardly anyone was in any of the pools. Almost everyone was just sunbathing. They have 4 pools, a lazy river with a water slide, a long narrow j-shaped pool, a standard rectangular pool, and another large pool with a huge water drencher at the end of it. They also have two hot tubs, one for 15 people, the other holds 26 people. The resort has a Starbucks on site as well as several other restaurants. I read previously that turn down service was non-existent, but we did have turn down service every night although one night it wasn't until 830pm. There are two washers and dryers on the 4th floor which are complimentary as is the detergent and Bounce. Depending on your group the mall across the street probably isn't within walking distance. We have a 9 and 3 year old so it wasn't for us. From our room it was probably a good HOT mile from room to mall. The mall is nice though not enclosed and is spread out. Staff was very attentive and friendly, the grounds were very impressive, lots of water mixed in with the desert surroundings. We definitely would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great two day stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent the week in Phoenix for our first anniversary & stayed at the Marriott Canyon Villas for 4 days & the JW for two days. We used points & upgraded to the Cloud Club for the two days and were not dissapointed! The grounds were lovely & the service was excellent. There were only a handful of people using the Cloud Club both days so the staff was more than attentive. We played cards one night & watched part of a movie with a few of the staff members. Great people! The hotel room was very nice, no real complaints. All of the staff were very helpful and friendly which made for a great two days. We ate at Roys & the Tuscan restaurant & had good meals. Although the wait staff at Roys was very slow. We also thought it was strange that there were a ton of empty tables throughout the night but when you told them you didn't have a reservation they looked at you like you were crazy & they would have to really work to squeeze you in! We also played golf at Wildfire Faldo course & thought it was only ok. The course is ready to be overseeded so it is very dry. Also, of all the courses we played, the Wildfire staff was the least friendly and helpful. They could improve on that. Overall - great stay & will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of 5-Star but beware...”
Reviews.Author: beenthereseenthat
Reviews.Content: It's a deluxe resort & spa, no argument. The deluxe room was spacious, the bathroom opulent with separate marble + glass shower and comfy bathtub. The restaurants pricey, but the food presentation and quality does match. The outdoor seating is very attractive, surrounded by lush gardens and water features. The grounds are well looked after. All rooms have a view of some sort, the least preferred would be the rooms looking west, across the front entrance, although the sunsets from that vantage point are outstanding. Other views are across the golf course to the South and North, and the best view, from what I observed, would be over the pools, gardens and golf course, to the east. While the resort is deluxe, the type of guests staying can range, and you may be exposed to noisy, obnoxious, and unwanted behaviour. Not the hotel's fault, mind you, but might affect your enjoyment all the same. Lots of cell phone activity at this resort since it is a conference site. Also, lots of kids...so, you might not get the quiet relaxation you're seeking. The Spa is outstanding with its own swimming and exercise facilities (additional charge) but well worth the additional fee(s). The staff ("associates") in all areas understand customer satisfaction and everyone is friendly and efficient to deal with. I would return to this hotel under the right circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Flyerno.one
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything one would want in a resort. We stayed with our family,and everyone had a great time. The rooms were very nice, and the amenities were above the norm. The staff was friendly and helpful. The shopping mall across the street had numerous resturants and stores. I could not find anything wrong with this fine edition to the Marriott chain.

Reviews.Title: “Superior”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am in the travel industry and I only stay in 4 to 5 star properties. This is the best I stayed in the service is excellant the rooms are very big . You can not go wrong at this hotel. The pools are fabulous,the spa to die for. I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went there Sept 1st for 3 nights. We are not award members or platinum members but we were upgraded to a suite. It was 2 rooms , one was reg hotel room with 2 queen beds etc the other rooms consisted of a living room, dining room with a table & 10 chairs, a pantry, a wet bar, an office area, a bedroom area with a murphy bed & 2 night stands, 2 full bathrooms with double sinks & separate glass showers, 2 walk in closets & 3 patios with beautiful patio furniture. What a treat!!! The pools are wonderful you could never go there & not find an empty chair like sometimes happens. We never had turn down service at night so maybe they don't do it there. We had lunch in the steak house, crazy where it is loacated it's hard to find & a long walk but worth it. i wouldn't like their dinner as it is ala cart but lunch was exceptional & reasonably priced. I am used to being at Marriotts where a drink of water can cost plenty but here they had pictures of water eevrywhere, plain or with strawberries or lemon. The $17 per day parking was comped because we have a handicapped card. As all JW Marriotts the landscaping & pool areas are magnificant. Restaurant wise there is not much variety but we were always out anyway there are some good rests. in the area. everyone raves about the mall across the street I found it to be a big disappointment. Great experience. Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “A stay of two halves”
Reviews.Author: UKtog
Reviews.Content: Had I written this review after day 2 of my four night stay, the result probably would have been 5 stars as I could have tolerated some of the early slip ups, however, I made a mistake and stayed on over the Labour Day Weekend. My husband and I stayed for four nights and paid to upgrade ourselves to a Cloud Room. Well in advance (ie 3 weeks), reservations were made for all four restuarants with specific requests for outdoor seating. On arrival we were greeted well by many people and thought we were onto a winner here although it did take us some time to attract the attention of the gentleman at the Cloud Room to gain admission. Our first nights meal at Roys was exceptional with excellent attentive service; our room was beautiful and our walk in the gardens delightful. Day Two went well until Dinner, when we were seated in a corridor at Blue Sage (the dining room was empty) advised no outside seating was available (though tables were visible) and served our entree four minutes after our appetizer - the server could not understand we were not ready for it so left it anyway. Next day our problems started with the Cloud Room - this has the potential to be a great facility and the staff really do try their best. However, for Appetizers read - lovely food but used as Childrens Teas and dinner by those too mean to pay for it elsehwere. On one day there were 12 children racing around the room and others shouting and crying - one parent even pushed in ahead of us to get the last of an appetizer as it all was l her little darling would eat - we had to go without. The staff advised they have no control over the number of children in the roomas any guest in a cloud room can bring in unlimited children to the room free - so it is not a quiet oasis of calm for a pre dinner drink - quite the opposite. Breakfast was even worse as one dear child was in training for the Muffin Throwing at the Olympics event much to the amusement (and encouragement) of their parents. Obviously the hotel is not responsible for the behaviour of the parents, but be warned on the marketing, this is not the quiet facility you might think you are paying for. Contrast that with our lovely well cooked, romantic meal outdoors at the Tuscany where incidentally delightful well mannered child sat at the next table to us. Wildfire was also a good spot, though again that evening our pre dinner drinks were a shambles as the kids had empty all the adult mixers and Perrier from the fridge and the staff had to get more brought up - and when the first lot arrived doting grandparents took all the water bottles for the children. The poor assistant was so frustrated as he tried to get our preferred drinks to us. Other lapses that needed addressing were, a 50 minute wait for the (wrong) food order at the pool, with no supervisor available to register a complaint - an offer of free drinks was made but as we were about to drive and did not want alcohol or desserts that was worthless. Also had to point out every single day we were in a Cloud Room so should not be charged for parking, yet the charge still appeared on the final account; newspapers were not delivered on two of the days and each day we had to call housekeeping about things missing from our room (like the trashbin). Yes, some of these are minor grumbles, and many of the staff did work hard to provide a very good personal service, but the hotel let itself down too many times during our stay for us to rate it any higher. On check out, the lady adjusted the parking costs but was not interested in our issues re the Cloud Room (which its staff had suggested we raise with them as it concerned them too) - as we were on a tight timescale to get our flight it was pointless pursuing them, but my advice think very very carefully about spending $100 a night for a Cloud Room if you are a couple wanting a more relaxed atmosphere to sit have pre dinner drinks or breakfast in. I do hope this hotel can get its act together consistently - rather than some of the time for some of the guests

Reviews.Title: “This is the place...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When Hurricane Frances decided to go to Florida the same time we were planning to be there we made some quick changes and headed West to the JW Desert Ridge in Phoenix. It turned out to be one of the best getaway weekends my wife and I have taken. It's never any fun going home after one of these weekends. Everything you needed and wanted was there on the property. Golf, the pools (including a lazy river), the restaurants and bar, all added to this incredible resort. Great restaurants and shopping were less than a mile away. We day-tripped to Sedona and further north to the Grand Canyon, all within a good full days time. The resort set us up on a great horseback ride in the desert with a very professional and friendly outfit, Canyon Creek Ranch...I couldn't imagine going back and using someone else, these guys are great. The staff at the resort were very friendly and attentive to any of our needs, the rooms very great, clean with very comfortable beds and pillows, huge bathrooms, and all rooms had a great view of something.

Reviews.Title: “About Par”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Decidedly ho-hum. A place like this sets high standards and it misses on most counts. Strange how people can go to the same place and come away with a different opinion, but there's no question my wife and I were disappointed after a recent visit here. Ok, yeah it was a weekend and crowded with families and kids, as many Arizona resorts are in the summer -- thanks to off season rates and priceline. But even if you're only paying $39.95 a nite you should treat the place better than a Red Roof Inn. We saw guests lugging huge personal coolers to their rooms and even out by the pools. Little kids ran around unsupervised through the lobby and hallways. Underage (and unsupervised) kids were also jumping into the spas. Of course families taking over resorts is now commonplace and when you have a huge property like Desert Ridge it's understandable to keep the rooms full. What's funny, though, is that there are any number of other resorts in the Phoenix area with better family-oriented activities, pools, slides, games and so on. In fact, there are better places period. The Desert Ridge is far out of town cut into freshly-bladed desert and not especially convenient to anything. The place is huge and unattractive from the outside-- we thought it was a prison or a government building at first. There are other resorts that have better views and are more intimate and charming. Our standard room was smallish and appointed with only fairly humdrum furnishings. No doubt there are nicer rooms, but I like to judge a place by its standard room. The restaurants were fine and not too expensive for this kind of place -- we ate at the Blue Sage and Roys (Roys was more interesting) -- but nothing gourmet. In short, the phrase that comes to mind after a visit to the Desert Ridge is "fair to middling." Probably fine for a business meeting, maybe fine for a family, but there are much better places at the 5 star level in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Desert Ridge resort”
Reviews.Author: candaceg
Reviews.Content: I was at the resort August 22-26 for a conference. The hotel was completely sold out and during the day the conference facility was serving an additional 1000 people. Despite that, the service and facilities at the hotel were outstanding. I had no complaints about my stay. Having a small refrigerator in the room was a nice touch, especially since you can come nowhere close to getting cool water from the tap! I also appreciated the power outlet inside the in-room safe so I was able to charge my laptop and have it secured. As others have mentioned, the staff is extremely friendly. The pools were great - I loved the lazy river. Since I was on eastern time, I would have liked it if the pools opened a bit earlier in the morning so I could get some laps in, but that is a minor complaint. Regarding the airport transportation - there is a shuttle service you can book through the concierge desk that is $15 a person - it's called the TransStyle shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Off season a good option”
Reviews.Author: RCDC52
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights during the first week of August. We made the choice based on favorable tripadvisor ratings and an unbelievable package deal we received on a last minute booking. Service and staff were first rate and very attentive. They were well below capacity during the first couple of days, although it became crowded toward the end. The resort is huge and has ample space to handle large groups of people but it was a more relaxed experience, especially around the pools when less busy. Roy's was a very good restarant, especially for seafood lovers. The Blue Sage was typical hotel fare. Decent food but a limited menu. Ditto the pool food service. Didn't eat at Tuscany. We were offered an unadvertised 3 spa treatments for the price of 2. They wound up giving us the most expensive one for free ($180 vs. $120 for the other 2) which was surprising. The facilities are very nice and having the run of the more quiet spa pool and building for the day a nice extra. My wife and I agreed the treatments were wonderful. Played the Faldo (the other is a slightly more difficult Palmer design) and found it of average difficulty depending on the tees you use. It was in pretty rough shape, but it must be difficult to keep a desert course in shape this time of year. The grounds and lobby are beautiful and designed to keep you cool even in the heat of summer. In the evening they actually air condition the patio lounge by opening the huge double doors to the lobby. It really made a difference . Always ice water on hand. It was a great choice for a romantic getaway even though it may not cater to that crowd as much as the Scottsdale resorts. The only complaint has little to do with the property itself. It cost us $100 including gratuity to travel from the airport and back using super shuttle on the way out and their much more convenient car service back to the airport. It is over 20 miles away so I wouldn't expect a complimentary shuttle, but that seemed a ridiculous amount. Seems like there should be a better otion for those who don't want to leave the resort during their stay and therefore don't need a car rental. Otherwise had a great time and would recommend the JW Marriott Desert Ridge to anyone looking for a great resort experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Desert Ridge resort at the end of July. Everyone thought we were crazy to leave the hot Kansas summer for an even hotter Arizona summer. But we are so glad we went! The staff at the resort were wonderful. We had four teenagers with us. We asked the front desk if they had any larger rooms available. They searched and found a conference room which was very large! It had a king size murphy bed, sofa, leather chairs, dining room table, bar and an extra large bathroom. We were in heaven! They brought us three very comfortable cots for the kid to sleep on. We had planned to spend a day of our vacation driving to Sedona and on to the Grand Canyon, but after the first hour at the resort we decided we didn't want to leave. It was a perfect place to vacation. Wonderful shopping close by, Beautiful gardens everywhere,very relaxing pools plus my husband had a great time golfing for two days. Again the service was by far the best we have ever experienced. The heat didn't bother us at all, I guess it's true that without the humidity it doesn't feel so hot. When we were in the shade it was quite pleasant. I definitely want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would like to go back!”
Reviews.Author: eminis
Reviews.Content: My husband, 8 year old daughter and I stayed at the Desert Ridge Resort in Phoenix and wished we had been able to stay longer. We were on our way to Sedona and just spent one night since we flew into Phoenix. Our room was large and the bed was heaven with down pillows and a large down comforter. The bathroom had a separate shower and large tub. Our daughter and I swam in the lazy river pool while a bartender took our drink orders that we sipped on while we were floating around (our daughter drank Sprite by the way). They have a Starbucks on the premises along with some great restaurants. I forgot to bring my swimsuit cover-up and bought one at the Spa shop. They had a nice selection. Room service at breakfast time was super. The staff was very friendly and we had a wonderful stay. I wish we could figure when we can go back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: docajenk
Reviews.Content: Outstanding in all respects. The hotel is stunning with exceptional facilities. Excellent choice of restuarants with very good food. Staff very helpful at all times, using your name whenever possible. Sports facilities are wonderful. Rooms very nicely appointed, had one with a view of golf course, well worth the extra for the amazing view.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best!”
Reviews.Author: carlsbadkid
Reviews.Content: Two night stay--- June 30 - July 2 This is an incredible resort hotel that caters to professionals, (the bellmen said about 70% business) and their families that join them! We were thrilled with our vacation! We were not there on business, so we just used their pools and lazy river to catch some fun in the sun! We experienced no crowds at all in the water, in fact we marveled that about 95% of the chairs were empty all day around their pools. Now, we did drop a bit of money at their Blue Sage restaurant and Roy's, but we knew we would. We could have gone across the street and saved some money, but we so adored the wonderful live music, the refreshing breezes, the lit torches and the surroundings that we couldn't tear ourselves away. Our daughter was tired of the same old kids menu items, so we requested that a small bean/cheese burrito and side of rice be made at Blue Sage--- no problem at all, they were happy to oblige. They may want to look into offering that to other kids as a healthier alternative to chicken tenders etc... I must comment on the service. I've read that some people have experienced sub par service. We did not find this to be the case at all!!! I would say that I had the best service that I have encountered at any hotel from the front desk, to the bellmen, to the valet and every restaurant too! Everyone accomodated our every request including a couple special ones with a smile--- I find it hard to believe that the service could vary so widely from the attentive and friendly help we received. We have traveled widely and found this hotel to be top notch. I think you will enjoy your stay! Families, ask for a room in the 4000 wing-- the views are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights at this beautiful resort with my wife and 2 kids. The rooms were great, service was outstanding, food at the Blue Sage was very nice. The pools and the laid back atmosphere here made our vacation time very relaxing. We asked for a microwave and refrigerator upon arrival and within 15 minutes we had each(Great Service). One plus that guests enjoy is complimentary washer and dryer use. This service saved us a bucnch with all the kids clothing. The location is great to get on the 101 and head anywhere in the Phoenix area quickly, yet away from all the hustle of the city. Only negative comment is the long walk to the car in the parking lot during heat of day. Probably a quarter of a mile, seems more at 100 degrees. Would definately come back during off season.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very good choice, especially for families. New, clean, good service. Good deal in summer! A few warnings: the "lazy river" closes very early most days, college kids make it clear it is time to get out as early as 5 pm. Also restaurants are expensive for families. Entertainment, beautiful landsaping, good size rooms. Know that this is a mega-resort, so no personal feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Week at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the resort from June 5-10, 2004 for a visiting conference. We both *loved* the resort, from the beautiful grounds to the excellent dinners at Blue Sage and Roy's. We spent our first day at the Revive Spa. The massages were great, and since you have access to all spa facilities for the day, schedule your massage as early as possible. We were able to enjoy the private pool area for many hours (until 8pm) away from the kids and crowds at the other pools (which weren't very crowded, but there were only a few others at the spa pool). The lobby is beautiful at night. We enjoyed sitting outside on the lounge chairs and outdoor couches, looking up at the pools with the firepits around us, sipping on drinks from the bar. Phoenix weather is also something to behold - we didn't see a cloud for 5 days and the nights were warm, but not hot. Perfect for late night strolls around the grounds. Our room was also great, with a private balcony and turn down service twice a day. The bathrooms are beautiful. Service was top notch. The staff was very nice. There is a car service to the mall across the street for $5, or it's a quick 15 minute walk (time of day is the key of making the choice to walk or get a ride.) I used the fitness facilities twice, which are adequate. If your body is on east coast time, you'll be treated to early morning sunrises across the back of the resort earlier than 5am. The gardens around the resort and water features are gorgeous. The only possible negative of the resort is that from the distance, it doesn't look like much. You can only really see the palm trees in the front and since it expands out to the north, you only see the southern stucco wings from the road. From the highway, it's even hard to pick out the resort, so the resort doesn't look like the oasis it is from a distance. However, once you drive up to resort and walk in the lobby and see the grounds, you immediately know it's a special place. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Highest Praise for the Desert Ridge Reort and Spa!”
Reviews.Author: sullgreg
Reviews.Content: My family spent spring break at the new JW Marriott DEsert Ridge Resort and Spa in April. We have been to a number of wonderful hotels around the country, and none of us can wait to return to this hotel. We stayed in one of the Cloud Club rooms, which gave us access to additional amenities. If it is within your budget, the additional cost is well worth the level of service and amenities (such as full breakfast, snacks and beverages throughout the day, evening appetizers and full open bar, and dessert, including specialized concierge services) provided, and the Cloud Club staff could not be more helpful. The recreational offerings include several pools and a "river" pool, with a slide, that was great fun for us and for our teenage daughter and her friend. Golf courses and services were first-rate. The spa, which includes a terrific (and quiet!) pool as well as a spa restaurant, offered excellent massages. We were less impressed with the manicure/pedicure services offered in the salon, which were overpriced and lesser quality. Rooms were spacious, with balconies, and the hotel staff was attentive; on the occasions that we made a special request, we received immediate service. We at at Roy's and the Blue Sage (breakfast and dinner) and found both to be extremely high quality, with exceptional service. The appetizers that we sampled from the other hotel restaruants were excellent, as well. I would highly recommend using the hotel's vacation planning services (check the hotel web site) in advance of your visit; we did, and we received wonderful recreational, dining and cultural recommendations and had all reservations made for us prior to our arrival. If you are looking for a bargain, this hotel is not for you. If you are looking for an upscale, high-quality experience, with impressive retaurants, spa, and recreation, make your reservation now!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently took my kids on an in-town getaway and was very disappointed. I was excited to see this "great new hotel in town" but I feel like it fell short on all accounts. First, the check in staff was a bit unfriendly. The pool area was a joke. I was expecting a fun pool area for kids but it was confusing and very over crowded. I took one float around the so called "river" and that was enough for me. Total log jam if you know what I mean. Restaurants were very expensive and I don't feel this hotel/resort caters very well to families. I've been to several resorts in town and this is not one I will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort / Terrible Spa”
Reviews.Author: jknox
Reviews.Content: We took the entire family to this resort for springbreak this year and had a wonderful time. The hotel is beautiful! The rooms are large, clean, and stylish. The staff is incredible, everyone goes out of their way to accomodate you. The kids loved the lazy river and pool. We tried the kids club one day and although it was expensive, well worth the money. One of the niceast touches were the pool waiters going around and handing out fresh strawberries and ice water with lemon (FREE) to the people around the pool. We ate at both Roy's and Blue Sage and enjoyed both. The evenings always included some live music in the courtyard and was always very nice. My husband and I both tried a massage at the Spa and were very disappointed. We both get massages on a regular basis and were told this spa was one of the best. However, that proved to be wrong. The whole thing was rushed and the lady didn't seemed like she was very experienced. My Friend got a mani/pedicure and had the same rushed experience. I know that they overbook appointments quite a bit, maybe they should concentrate on quality rather than quantity. Overall, loved the resort but skip the pricey sub-standard spa!

Reviews.Title: “Great Summer Prices - Fun Resort”
Reviews.Author: ltp_tango
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the brand-new resort in June 2003. I live in Phoenix, just 4 miles from the resort, and received a fantastic $99.00 a night rate, plus discounts on the spa. I invited 3 girlfriends to share a room with two double beds with me (you can have up to 5 people per room for no extra charge, so the room cost $25.00 plus 1/4 tax per night). We stayed for two evenings (Friday and Saturday nights), and had a blast. The resort is absolutely beautiful. The pool and water features are fantastic. The spa is wonderful, and the staff there treats you like a celebrity. The spa is gorgeous, with its own pool and the spa services are excellent. For visitors from out of town: for dining, go across the street to the Desert Ridge outdoors mall. The prices are MUCH better. There are a number of excellent restaurants; nightclubs; shopping and an AMC theater, all within walking distance (right across the street from the resort). Restaurants include Macaroni Grill; Friday's; Bahama Breeze; On the Border; Malee's; and much more, serving any kind of food you desire. Ray's restaurant at the resort is excellent, but VERY pricey. Ditto for the resort bar: you'll pay about $10.00 per drink. Go across the street and drink and eat for MUCH less. There's also an Albertson's grocery store across the street for munchies, toiletries, drinks and more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: rlmwdc
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter (10) and I finished up a weeklong Easter 2004 vacation at this property. We stayed three nights and thought it was great. The property is BIG - but the staff is friendly and accomodating. We ate at Roy's the first night and we weren't disappointed. Dining outside the next night at Blue Sage was fantastic. Mostly, we enjoyed the Lazy River. So many pools to choose from - that we never felt crowded. I like the lawn area for the kids to play on and also the beautiful desert garden in the back. A nice Towne Center style shopping area is directly across the street with a big movie theater and nice choices for additional dining. Good property - good value.

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing, loved it”
Reviews.Author: fun-on-wheels
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin. Our suite was a 2 bedroom and amazing. We had a kitchenette, dining room set, large desk, 2 huge bathrooms and 2 king size beds. Oh, did I forget to mention the large couch and 2 oversized leather chairs. The staff couldn't have been nicer. The golf courses, walking trails, swimming pools and spa offered sometime for everyone in my family. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week long stay at this resort. It is awsome. The pools are wonderful, the staff is very helpful and the rooms are clean and spacious. We added the Cloud Club and it was worth every penny. The meals served at the Cloud Club are excellent. Ask about it when you make your reservation. The kids club is first rate. Shopping and many restaurants are located close by at the Desert Ridge shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel in the desert”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel, given its size is one of the best I have ever stayed in. The only reason that I didn't give it an excellent review was the size.. but when I asked my kids aged 12 and 8 they didnt waver in their love of the hotel. The pool area was too crowded for my liking ( even though the service was quick , friendly and efficient) but there was so much pool there was never a problem getting a chair. The lazy river was nice, my kids koved it , but I was expecting a more exotic setting for that after reading the reviews , so I was a little dissapointed. The Cloud club was amazing, well worth theprice, . The spa was beautiful and the massages were good . Check in was fast friendly and stressless. The hotel could use a more casual restaurant and perhaps some nighttime entertainment.Roys is a great restaurant. The tennis program needs to be developed and is too pricey.The service and staff though not a trained as Ritz Carlton staff was great and I have never met people so willing to make my stay pleasant , especailly at the cloud club level.I will definitely return ..especially with my kids. If I want a quiet getaway without thekids though ,I might think twice and go to a smaller more intimate place..

Reviews.Title: “New paradise in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Desert Ridge is a great new resort.The pools are nice with a great lazy river.The lobby is a great place to have a drink at night.The food at the pool was good and the Blue Cafe was also good enough to eat at 2 nights in a row.Ask for great waitress named cathy c.The cloud Club was worth the cost having 3 kids.The staff at the cloud club was very helpful answering many questions.In all a great new resort and great for families.

HotelInfo.Name: JW Marriott Desert Ridge Resort & Spa Phoenix
HotelInfo.Address: 5350 E Marriott Drive, Phoenix, AZ 85054
